directions: Butter one or both sides of bread. Cut in cubes and lay in pan (9 x 13-inch). Sprinkle cooked sausage over bread cubes. Grate cheese over sausage. In a bowl combine eggs half and half salt pepper and dry mustard. Mix at slow speed until well blended. Pour over other ingredients and refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350\u00b0 about 40 to 45 minutes in the morning and do not drain.
Combine ingredients. Bake for 30 minutes at 350\u00b0 in a 9 x 13-inch pan.

Put the vegetable oil in saucepan or melt the butter. Add the squeezed garlic lime juice lemon juice vermouth salt and pepper cook with medium heat for 20 minutes. Add fresh cleaned shrimp and cook for 6 minutes don't overcook. Make sure that the linguine is prepared so that it is finished to your liking at about the same time that the shrimp sauce is finished. Serve with Chilean wine and a nice smile.

Peel mirlitons and boil until tender. Save some of the water. Put vegetables in pot and cook to clear in oil. Add ham and saute. Put cooked mirlitons in pot and cook for about 1 hour slowly. Put shrimp in pot and cook until shrimp turn pink. Add some of the mirliton water to pot and then cook for 1/2 hour. Add enough bread crumbs to make stuffing stiff. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add 1/2 stick butter and stir well. Place in casserole dish. Sprinkle with bread crumbs and dot with butter. Cook in oven at 250\u00b0 to 300\u00b0 until hot.

Cut and cook sausage pepper and onion together until brown. Cook noodles and drain. Mix noodles and sausage mixture and tomato soup together. Put a layer of noodle mixture layer of cheese alternately until used up ending up with cheese on top. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes.
Drain mushrooms. Mix and put in casserole. Top with crushed potato chips. Bake 1 hour at 350\u00b0.

Mix all together. Use enough water to see in pan. Bring to boil. When okra changes color pack in jars and seal. When ready to eat open jar. Rinse with cold water drain. Fry as fresh okra. Don't re-salt.
Soak quail in salt water overnight. Dip quail in flour. Fry in oil. Serve with biscuits and quail gravy.

Peel eggplants slice 1/2-inch thick. Brown slices quickly in large heavy skillet in 4 tablespoons butter (more as needed). Set aside. Heat 4 tablespoons butter in same skillet. Cook onions until lightly browned. Add ground meat cook for 10 minutes. Combine tomato paste with wine parsley cinnamon salt and pepper stir into meat. Simmer stirring frequently until all liquid has been absorbed. Remove from heat.
One Tongue that doesn't slander.

Mix all ingredients with enough water to make a medium soft dough. Knead well. Roll out until thin. Cut into squares to make 50 pirogie. Place on each square 1 teaspoon filling. Fold in half to make triangles. Pinch edges well to keep filling from escaping. Drop in salted water and cook until all pirogie rise to the top of the water. Cook for 5 minutes longer. When done pour a small amount of cold water on them and strain. Place in serving dish and pour over butter that has been melted and slightly browned. Eat while hot and if desired add salt and pepper. Pirogie may be spread carefully on a breadboard after draining to allow them to dry a bit then place on a serving dish. This will make them less soggy.

Pat out ground chuck in electric skillet to make crust. Salt and pepper. Layer potatoes onion carrots and cabbage. Add milk to cream of chicken soup. Spread over top. Cook on medium heat until hot. Then simmer 40 to 50 minutes. Melt cheese on top and serve.
Beat eggs on low speed until foamy add sugar and salt blending well. Add evaporated milk vanilla and cinnamon blend.

Beat egg whites with electric mixer until stiff and dry. Gradually add sugar until all the sugar is dissolved. Mix baking powder and cornstarch together. Sprinkle over meringue while mixing. Add vanilla and vinegar. Beat for another minute. Preheat oven to 300\u00b0. Line a cookie sheet with aluminum foil. Grease foil and sprinkle with cornstarch. Mark out an 8-inch circle on the foil and spoon meringue into circle heaping it up in the center as much as possible.
Cook carrots until crisp-tender. Drain. Add remaining ingredients stir carefully so as not to break carrots. Refrigerate overnight.

Fry sausage first in a pan with oil then add the peppers and mix altogether with the tomato sauce salt and pepper. Put all ingredients in a Pyrex and add the cheese. Bake at 300\u00b0 for 40 to 45 minutes.

Place graham crackers on an oven-proof plate. Top with milk chocolate bar and heat briefly under broiler or in a hot oven. Cut marshmallows in half and place over melted chocolate bar. Broil marshmallows until golden brown. Drizzle chocolate syrup randomly over marshmallow and serve immediately.
Wipe konbu with dry cloth lightly. Do not wipe off the white powdery substance on the surface which is one element that provides a unique savory flavor.
Boil sugar and water for 10 minutes. Add coffee. When cool add vodka. Blend well. Add vanilla bean. Store in dark bottle tightly for 3 weeks or longer.

Cream butter and sugar. Add beaten egg yolks and vanilla. Add flour and baking powder alternately with milk. Spread in two layer pans (greased). Cover with meringue or egg whites and 1 cup sugar. Sprinkle chopped nuts on top. Bake at 325\u00b0 for 45 minutes.
Mix first 5 ingredients and cook over low heat for 8 minutes. Add vanilla and Rice Krispies. Cool then roll finger-size cookies and roll in powdered sugar.

Use a butter loaf pan. 9 x 9 x 3 inches. Heat sugar milk brown sugar corn syrup and salt in a 3 quart pan on medium heat stirring constantly until sugars are dissolved. Cook stirring occasionally to 234\u00b0 on candy thermometer. Remove from heat and add margarine. Cool without stirring to 120\u00b0 (bottom of pan will be lukewarm). Add vanilla beat continually with wooden spoon until candy is thick and no longer glossy 5-10 minutes. Mixture will hold its shape when dropped from spoon. Quickly stir into loaf pan. Cut into about 1 inch squares.

Place 1 graham cracker square on a paper napkin. Top with chocolate and marshmallow. Microwave on High just until marshmallow puffs up about 20 seconds. Top with second cracker. Peanut butter or sliced bananas may also be added if desired. Wait 3 minutes before eating so you don't get burned.

Combine all ingredients until batter is smooth but do not beat more than enough to remove lumps. Pour into well-greased popover pan (or muffin pan). Fill each cup 3/4 full. Put into cold oven set at 450\u00b0 bake 30 minutes. Don't open oven during cooking. Makes 9.

Melt butter in a 9 x 12-inch pan and sprinkle crackers on top. On top of crumbs sprinkle in this order: chocolate chips coconut and drizzle condensed milk over this. Bake at 325\u00b0 for about 25 minutes. Cut in squares or bars.
Blend all ingredients. Roll into 1/2 inch balls and chill. Roll in confectioners sugar when ready to serve. Makes 2 1/2 dozen.
In a large skillet brown meat. Place potatoes celery carrots and onion in crock-pot. Sprinkle peas over top. Spoon browned meat over vegetables.
Arrange croutons in baking dish or pie plate. Sprinkle cheese over croutons. Cover and chill overnight. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes until firm in center.

Mix together hamburger sausage chili powder cayenne and salt. Make into small 1/2 x 2-inch servings. Combine cornmeal and water to form a mixture that does not stick to hands. Scoop up enough mixture to cover meat serving. Roll in tamale papers which have been softened in water. Tie with string in middle. Drop into boiling water and cook for 35 minutes. Serve with chili or alone with mustard. Yield: 25 tamales.

Place egg whites and salt in bowl of electric mixer. Beat on medium speed until egg whites are white opaque and just beginning to hold their shape. Add vinegar. Increase speed to medium high and slowly add sugar 1 tbsp. at a time until all sugar is added and meringue is stiff. Beat in cornstarch. Line baking sheet with parchment paper and draw 10 inch circle on paper. Invert paper. Spread meringue in circle on prepared pan and using back of spoon make meringue disk concave in center spreading from center to sides. Bake meringue shell at 350\u00b0 for 5 minutes. Lower heat to 250\u00b0 and continue baking 1 hour or until meringue is firm crisp on outside and still slightly moist within. Cool on pan on rack. When completely cooled slide spatula or knife between meringue shell and paper to loosen. If prepared in advance wrap meringue with plastic wrap and store at room temperature.
Use pie dough enough for a two crust pie your favorite recipe or prepared crust. Cut each round crust in two pieces.
Soak ingredients over 12 hours in refrigerator. Bring to a boil. Cover reduce heat and simmer stirring from time to time for about 1 1/2 hours until tender. To serve top with grated Cheddar cheese.
In a 2-quart non-metal container combine bourbon lemonade beer and lemon juice. Refrigerate. Serve over ice and garnish with mint leaves and lemon slices if desired. Makes 8 (1/2-cup) servings.

Combine ingredients. Cook in large container until it forms a soft ball when tested in cold water. You may use candy thermometer if preferred. Beat until creamy. Add nuts. Drop by spoonfuls on waxed paper. You need to do this quickly because ingredients dry and stiffen quickly.
Rinsed sauerkraut cook simmer sauerkraut garlic and caraway seed 1/2 hour to 1 hour. After cooking put in bacon and bacon grease and pour over the sauerkraut. Serve warm. You may add sliced kielbasa.
Mix together yogurt Cool Whip and puddings. Fold in pineapple and oranges. Makes 6 to 8 servings.
Bring water and sugar to a boil cool. Add other ingredients and place in 5-quart container. Add 2 cups peach Schnapps before freezing. Freeze stir occasionally.

Sift dry ingredients into an 8-inch square baking pan. Make a well in the center put in the moist ingredients and mix well. Bake at 325\u00b0 until done. This cake is delicious with a broiled coconut frosting.
Mix ingredients as given. May be used as dessert or salad.

Cream butter and cream cheese until fluffy. Beat in vanilla. Combine flour and salt. Add in fourths to butter mixture blending well after each addition. Chill dough until easy to handle. Roll dough to 3/8-inch thickness on a floured surface. Cut out 2 inch circles or other shapes. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Make a thumbprint about 1/4-inch deep in each cookie. Fill with jam. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 to 15 minutes or until delicately brown on edges.
Combine all ingredients and bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 to 45 minutes. Serve and enjoy!

Mix flour soda baking powder and salt together. Beat egg add to mixture. Mix in sugar margarine or butter nuts and vanilla. Grease a 9 x 12-inch pan. Pour batter into pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 package semi-sweet chocolate chips. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes.
Saute hamburger onions peppers and garlic drain. Add all other ingredients except macaroni. Cook on low heat for 1 hour. Add macaroni cook 15 minutes more. Serve.
Cook your macaroni drain. Chunk up pepperoni cucumber and tomatoes. Cut olives and onion to your desire. Mix everything together mix in your Italian dressing.
You mix the flour with the oil and then you add the eggs one by one while you keep on mixing it. You butter the molds and you let it cook for 1 hour at 350\u00b0.

Pound beef until 1/4 inch thick. Cut into pieces 7x4 inches. Lightly sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Spread each piece with 1 Tbsp. mustard. Place 1/2 strip bacon down center of each piece. Sprinkle with onion and snipped parsley. Place 1/2 of a pickle on narrow end of each piece roll up. Fasten with wooden picks. Heat oil in 10 inch skillet until hot. Cook rolls over medium heat until brown on all sides. Add 1/4 cup water 1/2 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. Heat to boiling reduce heat. Cover and simmer until beef is tender about 1 hour. Remove rolls and keep them warm. Add enough water to liquid in skillet if necessary to measure about 1 cup. Mix 2 Tbsp of flour and 2 Tbsp of water then stir gradually into broth. Heat to boiling stirring constantly. Boil and stir for 1 minute and add water if needed. Serve rolls with gravy. Garnish with parsley springs and serve over mashed potatoes.

Mix the Holy Ghost and prayerful life with faith in God. Blend in thankfulness prayer and fruits of the Spirit. Add witnessing and Bible study. Sprinkle abundantly with holiness. Show it by being faithful to the house of God and share it with family and friends every day.

In large mixer bowl combine yeast 2 cups of flour and cardamon. Heat milk butter sugar and salt just until warm stirring occasionally to melt butter. Add to dry mixture in bowl add egg. Beat at low speed with electric mixer for 1 minute scraping sides of bowl. Beat at high speed for 3 minutes. By hand stir in fruits and peel (or extract). Stir in enough flour to make a soft dough that is easy to handle. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic about 8 to 10 minutes. Place in a greased bowl turning to grease top. Cover and let rise in a warm place free from draft until double about 1 3/4 hours.
Mix red hots cinnamon stick whole cloves and brown sugar. Fill coffeepot (10 cup size) with water after cranberry juice and pineapple juice have been added.
In an 8 x 11 baking pan make layers of the ingredients in the order above. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes or until lightly browned. When cool cut into squares.
Cook the milk sugar and butter 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add the chocolate chips. Beat well.
Cook the onion in bacon fat until lightly browned drain. Combine all in frying pan. Cook 15 to 20 minutes over medium heat. Serve hot.
Toast oats by preheating oven to 250\u00b0 and baking 1 hour shaking pan occasionally. Toast nuts with oats. Cool and mix in raisins and dates. Store in covered container.
Cut bacon strips in half and stripe sparingly with anchovy paste. Wrap around oysters and secure with toothpicks. Broil until done and drain. Makes 3 dozen.

Stir well. Roll out dough cut out with cookie cutter. Make small indentation in the middle of kolache. Put jelly or jam in the middle of the indentation. Put on pan and bake for 10 minutes at 425\u00b0.
Whip all together then chill until set.

Mash the garlic cloves in a bowl big enough to hold tomatoes. (I use the garlic press then mash them.) Squeeze or pour lemon juice. Sprinkle liberally with salt and mix well. Add about 2 tablespoons olive oil and a dash of Italian dressing if you like. Add tomatoes and toss. Add more oil or dressing if the tomatoes aren't thinly coated. Add basil about 15 leaves. Chill. Toast the bread and serve with extra virgin olive oil and the tomato mix. If you want to toast the tomatoes already spread on the bread DO NOT add basil until you remove it from the oven.

In serving dish (9 x 13-inch) place tamales (with wax paper wrappers removed) kidney beans chili and black olives. Bake uncovered at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour. During the last 15 minutes put Doritos slightly crushed and Cheddar cheese on top of casserole.

Steep coffee in 1 1/2 quarts of boiling water. Combine the sugar and 1 quart boiled water and cook for 1/2 hour. Cool. Mix coffee and sugar mixtures together. Add vanilla alcohol and 1/2 fifth more water to make 1 gallon. May be served over cracked ice or vanilla ice cream.
Pile ingredients on top of each other in order given. Very good. Great for least effort in serving a big crowd.

Place meat in large bowl. Cover with a mixture of 9 ingredients. Cover bowl and refrigerate for 36 to 48 hours turning meat 1 or 2 times a day. Remove meat. Pat dry rub lightly with flour and brown well in hot fat. Strain vinegar mixture and add to meat. Cover and simmer until meat is tender (about 3 or 4 hours). Remove meat keep warm. For gravy skim excess liquid from pan.

Brown beef and drain. Peel and slice potatoes 1/4-inch thick. Layer potato slices beef sauce and onion until casserole dish is full. Bake uncovered approximately 1 hour until potatoes are tender. You may add your own spices to this dish or substitute potatoes with eggplant. Tastes even better the second day.

Sift together flour salt soda cocoa sugar and baking powder. Add milk shortening and egg (nutmeats if desired). Batter will be cake like. Drop by teaspoon on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 425\u00b0 for 5 to 7 minutes. Can be frosted sandwiched or plain. Kids love them.

Melt oleo in very large bowl.\tMicrowave on High for 1 minute. Stir after 30 seconds. Add Worcestershire sauce garlic salt onion salt garlic powder onion powder cayenne mixed nuts and cereal (Crispix or Chex). Mix well. Microwave on High 6 minutes stirring after each minute.

recipe_name: Clay For Children(Children Use It For Making Objects.)
directions: Cook over low heat stirring. It looks like thick mashed potatoes. Put on waxed paper. Knead until it can be handled. Use for school projects.

Preheat oven to 325\u00b0. In small saucepan cook the 1/4 cup sugar over medium heat until sugar begins to melt shake pan occasionally. When sugar melts quickly pour caramelized sugar into an 8 x 1 1/2-inch round baking pan tilting pan to coat bottom. In mixing bowl beat eggs. Stir in skim milk and evaporated skim milk the 2 tablespoons sugar vanilla and salt. Pour into caramel coated pan. Set the round pan in large baking pan set on oven rack. Pour hot water into the large baking pan around the 8-inch round pan to a depth of 1-inch. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a knife inserted near center comes out clean. Cover and chill thoroughly. Loosen flan from sides of pan. Carefully invert onto a plate. Serves 8. Per serving: 87 calories 2 gm. fat.
Use a 4-quart nonmetal container. Mix lemonade and lime concentrate powdered sugar and egg whites with a whip. Add crushed ice and club soda. Serve in salt rimmed glasses.
Heat enthusiasm and tolerance but do not boil. Beat handshakes and friendliness then smiles. Stir all together until personality is formed. This recipe is appropriate for any occasion.
Mix cereals in a roaster. Pour liquids over cereal mixture. Sprinkle on the spice mixture from a shaker. Stir so that it is mixed evenly. Bake 1 1/2 hours at 225\u00b0. Stir lightly every 15 minutes.

Mix well (very sticky dough). Drop by scooping with hands into hot oil. Zeppolis will rise to top. When golden brown remove from oil and drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar. Eat hot. . .mmmm better than St. Anthony's feast!
Cream together sugar and butter. Add eggs and beat. Mix together flour cinnamon salt vanilla and baking soda in a little hot water. Add dates and nutmeats. Bake at 350\u00b0 to 375\u00b0.

Cook noodles as directed. Mix remaining ingredients and add to drained noodles. Bake in 9 x 13-inch glass baking dish at 400\u00b0 to 425\u00b0 for 1 hour. (All dairy products can be low-fat except butter or margarine.)

Grease large casserole dish or roasting pan. Layer ingredients in the order they are listed. If tomatoes don't have much liquid add some water to keep casserole moist. Bake at 325 \u00b0 for 1 hour covered. Then 10 to 15 minutes uncovered if ground beef not browned.

Mix ground pork green onions water chestnuts 1/2 bottle oyster sauce salt and pepper. Stuff aburage and place in pot. Pour remaining oyster sauce over stuffed aburage then pour chicken broth over and simmer for 30 minutes. Check pork to make sure it's cooked.

Heat olive oil in a large heavy skillet. Brown meat. Add remaining ingredients except cheese cook covered over low heat stirring occasionally about 25 minutes. Remove lid from skillet cook another 10 to 15 minutes. If Parmesan cheese is used remove to serving dish and sprinkle with cheese. If Cheddar cheese is used fold carefully into mixture. Serve.
Place frozen fillet of turbot in shallow baking dish. Dot with pats of margarine (do not use butter). Salt lightly. Do not preheat oven. Bake at 375\u00b0 for 35 to 40 minutes.
Dash equals 2 to 4 drops.

Preheat oven to 425\u00b0. Separate crescent dough into 2 large rectangles. Place in ungreased 13 x 9-inch pan. Press over bottom of pan and 1/2-inch up sides to form crust. Seal perforations. Brown sausage drain. Spread over crusts. Combine eggs milk salt and pepper. Pour over sausage. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.

Melt butter in a skillet over low heat add the zwieback mixed with sugar and cinnamon and stir until light brown. Allow to cool. In a glass dessert bowl put down a layer of zwieback followed by a layer of applesauce and a layer of whipped cream continue for two more layers. Serve chilled. Serves 4 to 5.

Bake cake make pudding as directed. Cool them both. In large bowl break cake in small squares and layer it in bowl. Then pour 1/4 Schnapps over cake. Make 1 layer of pudding 1 layer of pie filling and layer of whipped cream. Sprinkle with coconut and pecans (crushed). Then repeat layers and refrigerate until served. Hope you enjoy.
Cook garlic and onions in oil until tender. Add vegetables and bay leaf. Add salt pepper and a little oregano. Bring to a boil and simmer 30 minutes.
Mix all ingredients except margarine. Cook until mixture forms a soft ball when dropped in cold water. Add margarine and beat until thick and creamy. Drop by spoonful onto buttered waxed paper.

Brown sausage and meat separately and drain well. Mix well with remaining ingredients until cheese melts. Refrigerate. After chilled spread on rye bread and bake 15 minutes at 350\u00b0. This can also be heated and served with crackers or party bread.

Brown sausage break up and drain. Beat eggs and milk well. Break up and drop into egg mixture. Add grated cheese and crumbled sausage. Pour into greased pans and refrigerate. Take out of refrigerator ahead of cooking if you want it to cook quicker. Serves 20. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 2 hours.
Whip egg whites. Set aside. Combine all other ingredients. Fold in egg whites. Cook on waffle iron. Makes 12 to 13 waffles.
Cook tortellini in 3-4 chicken bouillon cubes 1 Tbsp. oil for 7-10 minutes.

Beat egg yolks until lemon-colored. Add sugar gradually and beat until creamy. Add sour cream and buttermilk. Stir in dry ingredients. Add flavoring and melted butter. Fold in beaten egg whites. Bake in waffle maker until golden color. Serve either hot or cold.
Melt chocolate (microwave directions on package) and pour over mix. Stir to coat and spread to dry on wax paper.

Boil together until well done. Next add one stick of margarine and 1 bag of croutons. Add salt pepper and poultry seasoning to taste. You need enough croutons to make it hold together. Roll into balls and bake until done.
Combine tomato juice and vinegar. Add garlic and sweetener a little at a time until flavor is right for you. Use as a substitute for commercial catsup.
Mix together all ingredients. Spread in 8-inch square glass dish. Cover and freeze. Makes 8 servings.

Mix together bread crumbs Romano cheese garlic parsley salt and pepper by rubbing in hands. Cut tops and bottom from artichoke and turn upside down. Mash lightly to open leaves. Fill each leaf from outside in by using the top of each leaf. Pour oil over stuffed piece. Steam in covered pot in a little water 45 minutes or longer. Done when leaf pulls off easily.
Tear newspaper into small pieces. Soak overnight in hot water. Mix well and knead. Add Flour Paste and mix well.

Beat eggs slightly. Add milk. Then add flour and salt. Beat vigorously for 2 minutes. Pour batter into very hot greased custard cups or iron popover pans (425\u00b0) for about 40 minutes in preheated oven. Serve at once. Makes 6 large popovers.

Slice half the sponge roll into 1-inch squares or rounds (or use ladyfingers) into bottom of glass bowl. Soak with half the sherry. Layer with fruit salad (reserve the cherries) 3 sliced bananas the remainder of the sponge roll and finish with half a cup of sherry.

Cream butter and oil with sugar until creamy. Add egg yolks and flavoring mix well. Gradually add dry ingredients alternating with milk. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites blend lightly. Pour into 3 greased and floured 9-inch pans. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 minutes. Cool. Split layers for 6 pieces.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Blend in the flour until smooth. Gradually add the milk stirring constantly to the boiling point. Mix in 1/4 cup of the cheese and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Beat the egg in a bowl. Gradually add the hot sauce beating constantly to prevent curdling. Taste for seasoning.

Mix bell pepper celery onion beef tomato paste sauce and soup with water mushrooms. and garlic. Simmer to thicken. Add cooked and drained macaroni. Pour into covered casserole. Sprinkle top with cheese. Bake for 30 minutes at 250\u00b0 covered the last 15 minutes.

In skillet brown chicken in butter. Add broth wine mushrooms onions and seasonings. Cover cook over low heat for 45 minutes or until tender. Stir occasionally. Remove bay leaf. Gradually blend water into flour until smooth. Slowly stir into sauce. Cook stirring until thickened. Makes 4 servings.

Cut steak into 1-inch pieces. Whisk together oil lemon juice water mustard honey oregano and pepper in large bowl. Add chicken bell pepper and mushrooms stirring to coat. Alternately thread ingredients on each of four 12-inch skewers. Place Trish-A-Bobs on rack in broiler pan so surface of meat is 3 to 4 inches from heat. Broil 9 minutes turning occasionally. Season with salt if desired.

In saucepan combine chips and butter. Cook and stir on low heat until melted. Remove from heat and cool. Stir in marshmallows and 1/4 cup pecans. Divide mixture in half. Shape each half in 6-inch logs. Roll each in remaining nuts. Shape on wax paper. Wrap in wax paper sprinkled with nuts. Chill thoroughly. Cut into 1/2-inch slices.
Slice cookies in half horizontally. Mix the other ingredients together and spread on cookies. Put the halves back together.

Saute onions and peppers in margarine add meat and brown. Add tomato sauce water salt and pepper to taste.\tAdd uncooked noodles and stir until tender. Add more liquid if necessary. Remove from heat and add corn. Pour into a large casserole dish. Dot with butter. Cover top with cheese. Bake 40-45 minutes at 350\u00b0.

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. In small pan bring sugar and water to boil until thick (about 5 minutes). Set aside. In 8-inch square pan layer half the bread cubes syrup raisins and apples. Repeat layering. Pour on the oleo set aside. In medium bowl combine eggs milk and seasonings. Pour over layers and ingredients. Bake 35 to 40 minutes. Sprinkle cheese on during last 5 minutes. Allow to cool 15 minutes. Scoop into 9 serving dishes. Top with frozen yogurt. Per serving: 329 calories and 9 g fat.

recipe_name: Faren'S Yummy Milkshake(This Recipe Is For 1 Serving)
directions: Pour milk into blender container. Add ice cream jam and pudding mix. Cover tightly blend until mixed well. Pour your milkshake into a tall glass and enjoy.
Wash chitterlings. Pull off all excess fat. Split open chitterlings and clean thoroughly. Wash in several waters.

Peel turnips and cut into 1/2-inch thick slices. Melt butter in a skillet and add turnips. Cook over low heat until barely tender. Add beef broth cover and simmer over low heat until turnips are tender about 15 minutes. Remove lid and allow some of the broth to cook down leaving a small amount of sauce. Sprinkle with lemon juice and chopped parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oven to 350\u00b0. Line bottom of loaf pan crosswise with bacon slices bringing bacon up sides and over edge of pan (reserve any remaining bacon slices). Mix remaining ingredients thoroughly. Spoon into pan being careful not to disturb bacon. Smooth top. Fold bacon ends over top of meat mixture. Place remaining slices of bacon lengthwise on top. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until done drain carefully leaving pate in pan. Let stand uncovered 1 hour before serving.

Mix the children and dogs well together. Put them on the field stirring constantly. Pour the brook over the pebbles sprinkle the field with flowers and spread over all a deep blue sky and bake in the sun. When brown set away to cool in the bathtub.

Blend pudding and milk until thick. Blend in Cool Whip. Layer 9 x 13-inch pan alternating graham crackers with pudding. Cover with chocolate frosting sprinkling graham crackers on top. Refrigerate overnight.

In 2-quart freezer container stir together thawed juice concentrates and corn syrup. Stir in water and rum. Seal container and freeze overnight. Before serving thaw 30 to 60 minutes or until slushy. Fill glasses 2/3 full with slush. Top with club soda and stir gently. Garnish with orange slices.

Sift flour baking powder sugar and salt into a large mixing bowl. Combine milk and egg yolks. Add to flour mixture and beat. Mix in butter. Combine the frothy egg whites to mixture and mix well. Pour enough to make a waffle into the waffle Iron. Makes approximately 4 waffles. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Rehydrate the porcini by placing them in a small bowl with hot water reserve the liquid. Saute the green onions and carrots in half of the butter for 10 minutes. Add rice and stir to coat with butter. Add the wine and 1/2 cup of the beef stock. Strain the porcini liquid through cheesecloth and add it to the rice. Remove any grit you find in the water. Simmer over low heat stirring and adding more stock as it is absorbed by the rice. Cook until tender about 30 to 40 minutes. While the rice is cooking saute the garlic porcini and mushrooms in the remaining butter.

Melt caramels in double boiler. Add the chopped pecans. Drop by teaspoons onto cookie sheet and chill. Melt chocolate and paraffin in double boiler. Dip caramels in chocolate and place on waxed paper.

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Beat eggs with rotary beater until egg yolks and whites are well blended. Add granulated sugar and salt. Mix well. Beat in two cans evaporated milk and add the vanilla. Put brown sugar in bottom of loaf pan and pour the custard gently into loaf pan over it. Place in shallow baking pan container hot water but not boiling. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour or until knife comes out clean. Do not cover. Refrigerate overnight. Before serving run a knife around the edge of pan and turn out onto a small platter.
Combine all ingredients and simmer in crock-pot or covered pan on stove.

Brown ground turkey and onion. While this cooks put cream cheese evaporated milk and soup into another large saucepan. Stir until melted together set aside. Undercook your noodles by a minute or two and drain. Stir all ingredients together. Add frozen corn if using. Pour in a 2 to 3-quart casserole. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1/2 hour. Serves four.
* Kitchen Bouqet or instant coffee to darken rice if desired.

In large bowl mix bread and cornbread. Saute celery onion and mushrooms in butter. Add to bread. Add chopped eggs. Stir in broth until consistency you like. Don't make too dry. Pour into Pyrex dish. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 to 20 minutes. Top with mushrooms or giblets if you prefer.
Mix all ingredients in a bucket. Work from bottom up to clean walls. No rinsing necessary.

Combine grated apples with sugar in heavy pan. Slowly bring to boil. Soften gelatin in applesauce. Add to cooked apple mix. Bring to full boil for 15 minutes. Stir constantly. Remove from heat. Add nuts and vanilla.

Combine cake mix sour cream water and eggs in a large bowl. Blend then beat at medium speed for 2 minutes until creamy. Spoon 1/3 of batter into well-greased and floured 10-inch fluted tube pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 the gelatin. Repeat layers. Spread remaining batter over gelatin to cover. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 to 50 minutes until cake springs back when lightly pressed. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pan cool on rack. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar if desired.

Tear cake into bite-sized bits into 13 x 9-inch oblong pan. Mix hot water and jello pour over cake. Then pour pudding over cake (cherry pie filling). Top with Cool Whip. You can multiply this to make as much as you need.

Cook diced turnips until almost tender about 5 minutes. Drain well. Melt 1/4 cup butter stir in flour salt and pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook quickly stirring constantly over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat and add cheese stirring until completely melted. Stir in cooked turnips. Turn into 10 x 6 x 2 baking dish. Combine bread crumbs and butter. Sprinkle on top of turnip mixture. Bake at 375\u00b0 until crumbs are golden brown about 30 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. In a bowl beat butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add egg. Blend flour into creamed mixture. Stir in baking bits raisins and nuts. Drop rounded tablespoonfuls of dough about 2-inches apart onto greased cookie sheet. Bake 13 to 15 minutes.
Melt oleo over very low heat. Add chocolate chips to melt them. Add beaten egg. Cool and add the marshmallows. Shape into a log. Cover with the pecans. Wrap in waxed paper. When cold slice.
Cook until thick about 10 minutes. Pour into loaf pan to shape. Slice and fry in butter. It's good.
Beat powdered sugar and egg white for 15 minutes (no less) on medium-high speed (again no less than 15 minutes). Do not double!
Dissolve lye in hot water let cool. Then pour lye solution slowly into melted fat. Stir until pretty cool. Let this set overnight and cut into squares.

Make the bread (see recipe instructions under Muffuletta Bread). Toss the lettuce cucumber onions and tomato set aside. Cut the bread in half horizontally. Spread a thin layer of mayonnaise on bottom half of bread. Arrange the meats next then lettuce mixture. Vigorously shake the Italian dressing. Measure and stir in the drained olives. Spoon over the lettuce. Sprinkle on cheese. Spread mayonnaise on top half of bread and place on bottom half. Cut in 8 wedges and serve.
Spread in 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan. Bake at 350\u00b0.
Grease pan with spray or shortening. Mix all other ingredients together. Spoon onto pan. Preheat oven to 400\u00b0. Cook until golden brown. Serve hot.

In saucepan bring sugar water and salt to a boil boil 3 minutes. Pour all at once into marshmallow cream and beat until mixture begins to thicken and stiffen. Add vanilla and nuts quickly and spoon onto wax paper. Cool.

Wash peppers and slice in half lengthwise removing all seeds being careful not to rub your eyes and wash your hands thoroughly when done. Stuff each pepper half thoroughly with cream cheese. In med saucepan heat oil on med-high heat until oil is hot. In a med size bowl mix all of flour with enough water to make batter consistency thick enough to cling to peppers. Place poppers 6 at a time in hot oil. Let cook until crisp turning over to cook both sides. (New oil will not allow batter to brown as well.) Remove cooked peppers from oil and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Combine first 3 ingredients in 8 cup measuring cup. Cook in microwave on High for 13 minutes then add last 2 ingredients. Beat candy mixture until creamy. Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper or buttered lightly aluminum foil.

Saute green pepper onion and garlic. Add tomato sauce and Worcestershire. Brown ground chuck with sausage. Add olives and noodles. Place in large casserole dish that has been coated with Pam. Add grated cheese. Heat 30 minutes at 325\u00b0.

Beat cheese and sugar until smooth. Fold in 1 cup Cool Whip (or more) spread on cooled crust. Mix chocolate pudding and milk. Beat until thick. Spread on cheese layer. Top with more Cool Whip. Refrigerate. Serves 10. May be frozen if desired.
Mix ingredients thoroughly and pour into shallow buttered 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake in 350\u00b0 oven for 20 to 25 minutes or until set. Cut into 12 pieces. Very good for a brunch or lunch.
Melt butterscotch. Remove from heat. Stir in noodles and peanuts. Drop on wax paper to cool.

In a saucepan over medium heat bring water parsley sugar and salt to a boil. Add Brussels sprouts. Cover and simmer for 6 to 8 minutes or until tender drain. Add water chestnuts and butter heat through. Yield: 6 servings.

In a large pot bring soup and water to a boil your need to get the \bags of gold\ ready while soup is on. Slice each biscuit in half. Place a 1-inch cube of cheese in middle and make sure dough completely covers cheese. Drop in boiling soup cook about 10 minutes. (Cover pot while cooking.)

In a skillet fry bacon just until cooked. Drain reserving 2 tablespoons drippings. Add remaining ingredients cook and stir over medium-high heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until Brussels sprouts are crisp-tender. Yields 4 servings.

Drain artichoke hearts and arrange in 9 x 13-inch casserole. Spread chicken on top. Combine soup mayonnaise lemon juice and curry powder and pour over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Top bread cubes with butter and place on top and sprinkle with almonds. Bake at 350\u00b0 until bubbling and slightly brown. Can be prepared in advance. Good served with a simple rice pilaf.
Mix ingredients. Cook slowly stirring often until boiling. Let cook about 20 to 30 minutes or until syrupy stirring often. Spoon boiling fruit into sterile jars and seal immediately.

Mix flour and salt add water and oil slowly stir until well blended. Knead dough until soft. Roll out and use cookie cutters to cut into shapes. Bake for 45 minutes at 350\u00b0 until hard. When cool paint and decorate ornaments. You can varnish too.

In a 2-quart saucepan combine sugar corn syrup water and salt. Stirring constantly bring to a boil over medium heat. Without stirring cook over low heat (small to medium bubbles breaking across surface of liquid) until temperature on candy thermometer reaches 266\u00b0 or small amount of mixture dropped into very cold water forms a hard ball which doesn't flatten until pressed about 40 minutes. When temperature reaches 260\u00b0 in a large bowl with mixer at high speed beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Beating at high speed gradually add hot syrup in a thin steady stream. DO NOT SCRAPE SIDE OF SAUCEPAN. Continue beating at high speed until mixture begins to lose its gloss about 3 minutes.
Mix well and store in tight container.

Place prepared ingredients on large platter in the following order: bean dip avocado (to keep avocado from browning sprinkle lemon juice on top) taco seasoning and sour cream mixed together chopped tomatoes chopped green onions black olives and grated cheese (on top).

Layer bacon in bottom of sandwich bag. Fold top of bag over 3 or 4 times. Punch a hole through folds with a sharp stick. Brace stick to hold bag over coals until bacon starts to cook coating sides and bottom of bag with grease. Remove bag open and pour eggs directly onto bacon. Close bag place back on stick and lean back over coals until eggs are cooked. When finished tear off top half of bag and eat directly from bag. Tastes better than it looks!

Brown hamburger with salt pepper brown sugar and onion. Add tomato soup. Cook egg noodles and drain. Add chicken soup. Layer hamburger mixture and noodle mixture in casserole dish with processed cheese between layers. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1/2 hour.

Grease a 13 x 9-inch pan. Spread 1/2 of the coconut on bottom. In double boiler melt margarine. Add chips and peanut butter stir until smooth. Let cool then add marshmallows and stir. Spread over coconut sprinkle the rest of coconut over the top. Put in the refrigerator for several hours then cut into squares.
Blend in blender on medium speed. Pour in glass. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Makes 1 serving.

Rub both sides of meat with Lawry's salt and pepper. Cover meat with onions and green onions. Sprinkle with minced garlic. Add about 1/4 cup each of oil and water for juice. Let set for at least 24 hours covered in refrigerator. Grill or bake as desired.
Blend butter powdered sugar cornstarch and vanilla. Add flour and mix well. Add chocolate chips and walnuts. Put on ungreased pan. Bake at 350\u00b0 approximately 10 to 13 minutes.
Cut meat into bite-size pieces. Fry onions in grease. Brown flour in some grease. Chop onions add to browned flour. Put in tomatoes last add the meat. Simmer until tender.

Wash peas in cold water. Boil fatback in a large pot of water on medium heat for about 30 minutes or until water is low and well seasoned with fatback flavor. Add peas onion and enough water to cover peas. Cook on low to medium heat for about 1 hour. When peas are soft season with salt and pepper. Remove onion and add rice. Add more water if necessary to cook rice (about 5 cups is needed). Cook for another 30 minutes and adjust seasonings. Serves 10.

Choose 4 different treasures. Put 2 tablespoon of each treasure in the bottom of each dessert dish. You may put more than one ingredient in each dish if you wish. Pour 2 cups cold milk into bowl with pudding mix. Mix until thick. Gently spoon the pudding over the \treasures\. Pudding will thicken quickly and will be ready to eat in 5 minutes or refrigerate until ready to serve. Serves 4.
Heat oven to 450\u00b0. Grease 6 deep custard cups or 8 medium muffin cups.

Wash pheasant well. Salt and pepper. Line Dutch oven with tin foil and place bird in center. In a bowl mix wine marmalade cinnamon and nutmeg. Pour over bird. Cut butter in squares and put on and around bird. Cover and bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 1/2 hours. Baste every 20 minutes. Tighten foil after each basting.
Put salt and cabbage in pan and fill with boiling water. Seal. Keep in warm place a few days.

Cook noodles drain. Add turkey pimento pepper and onion to noodles. Place in a greased casserole. Pour soup and broth mixture over casserole season. Add part of cheese to mixture sprinkle cheese over top. Cook 45 minutes at 350\u00b0. Yield: 8 to 10 servings.

Cut chicken into strips. Fry over high heat in 4 tablespoons oil for 5 minutes. Add bamboo shoots pea pods celery cabbage water chestnuts broth and soy. Cover pan and steam for 5 minutes over medium heat. Mix cornstarch with cold water. Add to Moo Goo Gai Pan to thicken. Serve with rice. Serves 4.

Brown meats in margarine add onion and cook until tender. Add soup cream cheese sugar Worcestershire sauce and seasonings simmer for 15 minutes. Cook noodles drain. Place noodles in 11 x 7-inch buttered baking dish. Pour sauce over noodles. Mix cornflakes with melted butter sprinkle over top. Bake in a 350\u00b0 oven for 20 minutes.

In large saucepan over low heat melt butterscotch chips brown sugar and butter. Remove from heat. Add eggs. Beat well. Add flour baking powder and salt. Stir in remaining ingredients. Spread in 8-inch square pan. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

Slice sirloin steak into thin strips. Brown in oil. Add salt and pepper soy sauce and Worcestershire sauce to suit taste. Cover and cook about 10 minutes or until tender. Add cut up peppers and onions with water. Cover and simmer about 5 minutes. Serve with baked potatoes and salad.

Saute garlic lightly in oil add vegetables and saute until onion is tender. Add tomato sauce and stewed tomatoes sprinkle all with seasonings. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes to blend flavors. Add snapper fillets cut into serving size portions. Bring to boil lower heat and simmer for 15 minutes or until fish is firm and flaky. Can keep warm for 1 to 2 hours. Serves 4 generously. Good with cheese bread and salad. Can also add scallops shrimp or squid.

Pour 1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil in 7-inch nonstick skillet frypan. Heat to hot. Put in scallions and peas. Cook 5 to 10 minutes. Add asparagus and cook until tender (10 to 15 minutes). Water may be added during cooking to prevent drying of vegetables. Serve hot as side dish. Salt and pepper may be added to taste. Season with sprinkle of dried basil if desired.

Cook vegetables combine. Make cheese sauce by combining flour and butter or margarine in small saucepan. Stir until margarine melts add milk. Continue stirring until milk is hot and sauce is thick add cheese. Melt and pour over vegetables.
Mix together and simmer on stove until hot. Serve on po boy buns. A tasty way to use leftovers.
Brown meat drain. Add cheese stirring until melted. Add spices and mushrooms. Spread on party bread slices. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 12 to 15 minutes. Watch time. Mixture may be frozen.
Melt chips and then add peanuts and chow mein noodles. Spoon onto wax paper. Chill.
Combine first 6 ingredients and set aside. Split bun in half. Layer one half with meats then spread with olive mixture. Top with cheese. Put top on bun cut in half and enjoy.
Beat thoroughly margarine sugar egg peanut butter water and vanilla. Add flour salt and soda. Mix well. Blend in oats and chocolate chips.

Put heat on medium low and add onion margarine and cloves. When onions are golden brown add chicken (skin can be removed before frying). While chicken is browning make your meatballs. Roll meatballs in flour and brown in pan. Drain meatballs on paper towels. When chicken is golden brown add just enough water to cover the chicken. Add the chicken cubes. Put heat to medium high until water boils for 5 minutes then put down to medium low. Make sure water doesn't evaporate. Once meatballs are browned and drained add to the ingredients in the pot. Add water as needed. Cook for 3 hours.

Combine butter flour and chopped pecans press in bottom of 13x9x2 inch pan and bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes. Let totally cool. Mix powdered sugar and cream cheese layer on crust. Spread 1 c. of cool whip on cream cheese. Combine 1 1/2 c. of milk with each pudding and layer on top of cream cheese. Top with 12 oz. of cool whip. Serve chilled.

Place the bulgur (crushed wheat) in bowl and cover with cold water. Let soak for 10 minutes then drain. Wrap bulgur in cheesecloth and squeeze vigorously until dry. Drop bulgur into a deep bowl add tomatoes parsley onions lemon juice and salt. Toss gently but thoroughly mixing together with a fork. Just before serving stir in the olive oil and mint. Taste for seasoning.
Mix all together in large pan. Cook over medium temperature to a good boil. Continue cooking for 5 minutes. Seal in pint jars for future use.

Place the oil in a medium-size skillet. Turn the heat to 100\u00b0. Add the mushrooms. Cook over low heat until any moisture the mushrooms release has evaporated. Stir the spinach into the pan and continue to cook stirring constantly until the spinach is wilted. Remove from heat. Sprinkle Feta cheese over the spinach mixture and stir together.

Thaw dough. Spread on cookie sheet like pizza crust. Mix next 7 ingredients and spread on dough like butter. Cover with pepperoni Mozzarella ham and mushrooms if you desire. Roll like jelly roll from long end. Place seam down and brush with egg white. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 to 40 minutes. Slice and serve with bowl of heated pizza sauce for dipping.

Heat 3/4 cup sugar until it turns light brown on low heat. Pour into 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Coat the bottom and side of dish. In a large bowl beat eggs then add 1 cup sugar slowly while beating mixture set aside. In a saucepan heat milk on medium heat with cinnamon stick until bubbly. Take cinnamon stick out. Pour into dish that has the caramel. Place dish inside a bigger pan. Pour hot tap water around the flan in the bigger pan until water is an inch deep. Cook at 325\u00b0 in oven uncovered for 1 hour or until knife comes out clean.

Grease fish inside and out with cooking oil. Stuff with stuffing mix celery and onion (very wet). Fold aluminum foil tightly over fish and lay it in a baking pan. Put a small amount of water in the baking pan. Bake at 300\u00b0 for 6 hours. (The bones will melt away.)

Place peanut butter cream cheese and honey in mixing bowl. Stir until well blended. Trim crust from bread. Cut into animal shapes using cookie cutters. Spread peanut butter on half the bread animals. Top with a matching bread animal. May be covered and refrigerated until ready to serve.

Cook noodles then brown ground beef. Add onion and cook until done. Cook celery and green pepper in water until done then drain. Mix altogether and add mushrooms tomato soup and mushroom soup. Put in 9 x 13-inch pan sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bake in oven at 350\u00b0. Takes about 30 minutes or until top is lightly brown.

Quarter seed and derib peppers. Using a sharp knife or food processor slice the peppers very very thinly. Peel and quarter the onion and slice very thinly. Set aside. Mix olive oil vinegar sugar salt and pepper. Toss with vegetables. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Cook rigatoni noodles rinse in cold water and drain. Lightly grease dish. Cut cheese into small strips (approximately 1-inch long 1/2-inch thick) and stuff each rigatoni noodle. (Don't panic it doesn't take that long.) Place a layer of stuffed rigatoni noodles in pan cover with sauce sprinkle with Italian seasoning and garlic powder. Grate a thin layer of Mozzarella cheese on top. Repeat the process for the next layer. Cover with foil and bake in oven at 375\u00b0 for 1 hour. Makes 6 or more servings.

Place meat vinegar and water to cover roast and seasonings in a bowl. Marinate 3 days (turning daily). Remove roast to Dutch oven and brown. Add carrots onions and 1 cup marinade. Cook 4 hours in a 350\u00b0 oven. Remove roast and vegetables. Add sugar and crumbled gingersnaps to liquid. Cook until thickened. Add more vinegar salt and pepper if desired. Spoon some gravy over meat. Serve the rest separately. Makes 8 servings.

Slice onions and separate in rings. Soak in sweet milk for 1 hour or overnight if you like. Make batter of Aunt Jemima pancake mix as it says on box. Have the batter pretty thick. Dip onion rings one at a time in the batter and drop in hot deep fry grease. Drain on paper towels.
Roll oysters in flour then in egg then in cracker crumbs then in oil. Drain for a few minutes. Bake in a 400\u00b0 oven until browned.
Boil sugar water and Karo until it reaches the crackle stage.

Melt butter stir in flour. Gradually add milk and cream whisking constantly. With pan on high heat stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil and is smooth. Simmer still stirring 2 to 3 minutes longer or until the sauce coats the wires of the whisk heavily. Remove from heat season with salt.

Prepare pudding into each of four dessert glasses. Fold whipped topping into remaining pudding. Spoon over plain pudding in glasses. Garnish each with additional whipped topping if desired. Makes 2 cups.
Mix the sugar flour and baking powder together. Add the milk egg whites and vanilla.
Mix together spinach oysters onions and Tabasco and put into casserole dish. Top with bread crumbs butter and Parmesan. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 50 to 60 minutes.
Cut kielbasa into 2-3 inch pieces. Place into crock pot. Pour pineapple topping over kielbasa. Cook on high for 1 hour then turn to low for 2-3 hours.
Mix with spoon disregard lumps. Fill greased muffin pans 3/4 full. Put in cold oven set at 350\u00b0. Turn on heat. Bake 35 minutes. Do not peek!
Thaw- have a large pan of water boiling with about 1 cup sugar (1/2 cup sugar/lb. fish).
Combine all ingredients except butter with water to cover in saucepan. Cook until tender drain. Mash with butter and serve immediately.

For pudding mixture mix together the pudding milk and Cool Whip. Line a 9 x 13-inch pan with graham crackers. Pour half the pudding mixture over crackers. Lay another layer of crackers top with remaining pudding. Top with another layer of crackers.
Soften and dissolve yeast in warm water. Combine all ingredients. Mix well. Divide dough into 12 pieces. Let set for 20 minutes. Roll out on lightly floured board. Stack with wax paper between each.

Brown the ground beef salt pepper and cumin. Saute and combine the onion celery and green pepper. Add flour (for making sauce). Add the tomatoes tomato sauce and mace. Simmer 30 minutes. Serve over toast with hash brown potatoes. Serves 3 to 4.

Melt oleo chocolate chips and peanut butter in double boiler (or over low heat) just until melted and mixed together. Pour over Crispix in large bowl (looks terrible). Gently fold until all the cereal is covered. Take white kitchen garbage bag and put half of the powdered sugar in the bottom of the bag. Put cereal mixture into bag and put remainder of powdered sugar on top. Tie bag shut and gently shake bag until cereal separates and the pieces are coated with the powdered sugar. After cooling store in airtight container. Lasts several weeks. Delicious.
Take love and loyalty and mix faith. Blend it with tenderness and understanding add friendship and hope. Sprinkle with laughter. Bake it with sunshine. Serve daily with generous helpings.
Wash the celery and cut into pieces (about 5-inches long). Spread peanut butter on the celery from one end to the other. Press raisins into peanut butter.

Combine salsa beans chili seasoning and water in crock-pot. Cook covered on high for 1 hour. Stir in shrimp. Cook additional 30 minutes then add okra. Cook additional 15 minutes and add corn. Cook additional 15 minutes and add rice. Stir thoroughly turn off crock-pot. Let stand 10 minutes. Keep lid on crock-pot throughout cooking and after the rice is added.

Mix flour oleo and nuts until crumbly and spread on bottom of 10 x 15-inch jelly roll pan. Bake 15 minutes at 350\u00b0 or until slightly brown. Cool. Blend cream cheese 1 cup Cool Whip and the sugar. Spread on top of crust. Mix pudding and milk and pour onto cream cheese layer. Chill 2 hours. Frost with remaining Cool Whip. Store in refrigerator.
Make a small batch of biscuits or use canned biscuits. Do not bake. In a baking pan add soups and cooked ground beef. Top with biscuits. Bake at 450\u00b0 or until biscuits are done.

Preheat oven to 450\u00b0. Lay 4 pieces of foil each 10 inches long on counter shiny-side up. Place one fillet in center of each. Place 1 teaspoon butter 1 tablespoon orange concentrate and chopped green onion on each. Wrap and seal. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. The extra juice makes a nice sauce. Serve with rice and mandarin orange salad.

Beat egg yolks milk and shortening. Combine flour baking powder and sugar. Add to egg yolk mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Fold egg yolk mixture into egg whites. Bake in preheated iron. Makes 8 waffles.
Slice roast thin and marinate overnight. Grill meat and reserve the marinade for dipping meat in or to pour over steamed rice.

Measure words carefully. Add heaping cups of understanding to milk of human kindness and sift together 3 times before using. Make a smooth sauce not too thick. Use generous amounts of time and patience. Cook with gas on front burner. Keep temperature low do not boil. Add a dash of dry humor and a pinch of warm personality with individual molds. Works best when made by a good mixer.
Brown beef onion pepper and celery in skillet. Drain if necessary. Add cream of soup stirring to blend. Mix together cream cheese and sour cream.

Brown meat pepper and onion in 2 tablespoons oil with garlic. Add tomatoes. Drain all liquid so mixture is very dry. Flatten out crescent rolls into 1 sheet mush seams together so there are no holes. Place meat and vegetable mixture on one half and bring other side over. Press edges together. Cook 35 minutes at 350\u00b0 until crust is golden brown. Serves 2 adults and 1 to 2 children. Repeat recipe to make more Strombolis as needed.
Place bowl in ice water. Use mixer to beat until of spreading consistency. Spread icing smoothly on cake.
Mix all the ingredients thoroughly. Cook slowly until mixture forms a ball in water. Add butter nuts and vanilla.
Blend and serve with pita wedges or blue chips.
Wash fruit well. Cut in small slices. Mix 1 cup of fruit to 3 cups of water. Let stand for 2 plus hours in a glass container then boil (hard) for 15 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Roll out dough. Mix the egg yolk parsley oregano pepper olive oil garlic and parmesan cheese in a 2 quart bowl using a whisk. Spread over the rolled out dough. sprinkle the cheese and your favorite toppings on top and then roll like a jelly roll with the seam side down. Brush with the egg white and bake in preheated oven for 20-25 minutes. Serve with warm pizza sauce. Enjoy...

In a large bowl beat butter with with mixer on medium high for 30 seconds. Add half the flour and all the sugar milk and vanilla. Beat until combined beat in remaining flour. Stir in cherries and pecans. Shape dough into two 8 inch rolls roll each in coconut. Wrap in waxed paper or plastic wrap chill 4 to 48 hours. Cut dough into 1/4 inch slices and place on ungreased sheet 1 inch apart. Bake at 375\u00b0 for 10 - 12 minutes.

Cream 1 cup of butter or margarine and 1/4 cup confectioners sugar add vanilla and water. Add sifted enriched flour mix well and add pecans. Form into small rolls 1 1/2 inches long. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet in slow oven (300\u00b0) for 20 minutes or until delicately browned. While hot roll in confectioners sugar. Makes 3 dozen.
To the browned and drained hamburger add taco mix and water. Simmer 15 minutes. Stack ingredients starting with Fritos then meat beans lettuce and cheese. Top with picante sauce.

Place oysters on a shallow baking tray lined with rock salt. Melt butter in frypan. Add parsley celery onion and garlic. Add spinach and cook 1 minute more. Blend all in blender. Add bread crumbs salt pepper and sherry. Sprinkle with grated Gruyere after adding 1 tablespoon of sauce to each oyster. Bake at 450\u00b0 for 4 to 5 minutes until oysters are heated through and sauce bubbles slightly.
Cook flour and milk until thick (will be solid) and cool completely. Cream butter with sugar and cooled white sauce beat until foamy. Add vanilla. This will not get sugary or crusty. Freezes well.
Mix all ingredients. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Makes about 1 cup dip. Serving per tablespoon contains 7 calories and 0 gm fat.

Make custard (I use Bird's custard powder) with 1 pint of milk. Let it cool cover with wrap to stop skin forming. Cut sponge cakes into thick slices. Put into dish and add defrosted raspberries and macaroons. Pour over wine mixed with milk adding more sherry as necessary to soak the cakes thoroughly. Sprinkle with lemon rind. Add the almonds and cover with cooled custard. Beat cream and egg whites together until stiff. Sweeten to taste and pile on top of custard.

Mix willingness love faith trust and family. Simmer smiles for at least 24 hours. Slowly combine. Sprinkle with compliments and serve with any extra smiles. Do not be discouraged if this recipe fails the first time. And remember faith is the key ingredient.

Sift together flour and salt gradually add milk to flour in a bowl. Add melted butter. Beat batter for 2 minutes with mixer. Fill muffin pans 2/3 full. Bake in 450\u00b0 oven for 14 minutes. Reduce heat to 350\u00b0 and bake 20 minutes more. Serve hot. Can be filled with creamed vegetables or meat or served alone.
Drain pineapple reserve juice. Add jello mix and stir. Then add Cool Whip marshmallows and crushed pineapple. Refrigerate.

recipe_name: Freako(An Old Depression Recipe From My Grandmom)
directions: In a deep heavy pan brown salt pork chunks and remove. Brown chicken with Italian seasoning garlic and pepper. Remove from pan and put aside to cool. Place potatoes and onion in pan with enough water to cover potatoes. Begin cooking over medium heat. Remove chicken from bones and add to potatoes and onion. Continue to cook over medium heat until potatoes are very done. Your mixture should be thick not too soupy. Serve with cornbread and enjoy!

Mix Crisco sugar molasses and egg together. Stir in all dry ingredients. Add raisins last and mix well. Press evenly into ungreased 11 x 7-inch pan. Sprinkle sugar over top. Bake 9 minutes at 375\u00b0. Take out of oven immediately. Do not cook any longer.
Saute in pan. When cooked stuff into partially cooked large rigatoni. In baking dish put layer of rigatoni and cover with spaghetti sauce over all. Put in oven at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes to consume.

Stew chicken until thoroughly cooked and allow to cool slightly. Remove meat from bones and cut in chunks. Mix chicken with all other ingredients except cheese and pour into 3-quart casserole. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve with crisp green salad and Texas toast. Serves 6 to 8.

Melt first 3 ingredients in microwave. Put cereal in bowl pour melted ingredients in bowl. Mix well. Put powdered sugar in paper bag add cereal mixture and shake bag well. Put in airtight container to store.
Mix together refried beans Monterey Jack cheese cumin and garlic powder. Put in double boiler or microwave oven until spreading consistency.

Bring one gallon water to boil add salt and vinegar. Add sliced okra and bring it all back to boil. Can okra in hot sterilized jars. When you are ready to fry it pour into strainer and rinse real well under cold running water then drain and roll in flour or meal and fry.
Mix all dry ingredients together. Add egg and milk beat until smooth. Dip\tfranks\tin batter and fry in hot deep oil until brown. Serve hot with mustard.

Heat oil and fry tortillas until crisp. Put on paper towels to drain. Cook hamburger and mix with package of taco sauce. On top of tostada put a layer of refried beans and sprinkle with hamburger. Top with cheese onion lettuce tomatoes olives and salsa or sauce.

Brown meat add salt and pepper to taste onion and brown sugar. Add tomato soup and simmer. Cook egg noodles according to directions on package. Drain. Add chicken soup. Layer hamburger mixture and noodle mixture into casserole with cheese between layers. (Nowadays you can buy grated cheese which works wonderfully.)

Combine almonds butter vanilla wafer crumbs and almond extract. Mix thoroughly. Reserve 1/4 cup for topping. Line an 8-inch square or round pan with aluminum foil. Sprinkle 1/2 crumbs on bottom. Spread 1/2 of ice cream over crumb layer. Spread 1/2 of apricot preserves over ice cream mixture. Repeat sprinkle top with reserved crumbs. Cover with foil. Place in freezer. Makes 9 generous servings.

Drain the corn and potatoes. Layer the corn potatoes peppers and onions in a baking dish. Add 1/2 can Manwich. Sprinkle on Mrs. Dash to taste. Crumble the hamburger over the top. Spread the rest of the Manwich over the top. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour.

Mix sugar and coffee in a 3-quart saucepan. Add water and salt. Heat until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil and remove from heat immediately. Wait 5 full minutes. Add vodka and vanilla. Pour into favorite bottles and chill.

In mixing bowl combine flour baking powder and salt. Beat egg yolks lightly beat in milk and oil. Add egg yolk mixture to flour mixture. Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Fold egg whites into flour mixture leaving a few fluffs of egg whites. Put 1/4 to 1/2 cup on hot waffle iron and cook until done.
Place all in a blender process until smooth. Keeps several weeks in refrigerator. This can be used in any recipe calling for sweetened condensed milk.

Melt butter in a saucepan. Add flour and salt. Stir until blended. Slowly add milk and bring to a boil stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Blend in cheese and lemon juice. Arrange haddock in a greased baking dish. Pour cheese sauce over fish. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes.
Blend in blender and serve in salted glasses.
Mix margarine and sugar. Add eggs and rest of ingredients. Drop by spoonfuls on cookie sheet. Press down with fork dipped in water. Bake at 350\u00b0 until brown. May be frosted.

recipe_name: Mountain Mama(A.K.A Sex In The Pan)
directions: Combine flour oleo and pecans until crumbly. Press into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake 15 to 30 minutes at 350\u00b0. Cool.

Dissolve lye in cold water (use iron enamel or stainless steel pot never aluminum). Allow to cool. Dissolve or melt lard and remove from heat. Pour lukewarm lye solution in lukewarm grease stirring to mix thoroughly. As it cools add perfume if desired and beat until mixture becomes white and fluffy. Pour into molds to set. When firm cut into cakes and separate. Allow to harden and air dry at least 2 weeks before using.
Combine in mixing glass stirring well. Add ice and strain into old-fashioned glass. Rim glass with lemon peel and throw in peel.

Mix all ingredients in mixing bowl with dough hook until all is incorporated. Place dough on floured sheet pan. Chill and rest dough at least 3 hours. The dough needs to be firm and cold to roll. Prepare garnish in pan. Cover dough with garnish. Roll floured dough until paper thin. Cut and place on dry sheet pan. Brush excess flour off and cut into desired serving size. Bake at 375\u00b0 for 10 to 12 minutes or until crisp and golden brown. Best served warm with butter.
Melt chips and butter. Cool. Add marshmallows and pecans. Mix well. Grease waxed paper and hands. Roll in log on paper. Chill.

Mix margarine and sugar together. Let cool completely! Add eggs flour pecans and vanilla. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes in 9 x 13 pan. Cool in pan for 30 minutes before cutting into small squares. If you melt your margarine in baking pan you don't have to grease it.

Put the first 3 ingredients in skillet and saute. Add the peas. Cook for 5 minutes in 1 cup of boiling water and drain. Add pimento soup water chestnuts and 1/4 cup liquid from chestnuts. Mix up. Put in covered dish. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes.
Brown beef onions pepper and mushrooms. Add tomato paste sauce water and Worcestershire sauce. Cook over low heat for 30 minutes. Arrange in 2 small or one large oblong dish.

Preheat oven to 325\u00b0. To assemble place hot dogs in buns spread mustard over the hot dog and add chopped onion and relish and top with two tomato wedges per dog. Wrap each hot dog individually in foil and place in a warm oven about 10 minutes until heated through to simulate the Chicago carts featuring steamed hot dogs dressed in this way.

Blend sugar corn syrup and water in medium sized saucepan. Cook over high heat without stirring until a teaspoon of syrup dropped in cold water forms a soft ball remove from heat. In a large bowl beat egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Pour 1/3 syrup on egg whites. Cook remaining syrup fast over high heat until a teaspoon dropped into cold water forms a hard ball. Pour in fine steam over egg white mixture beating constantly. Add vanilla continue to beat until candy is very stiff and forms peaks that do not flatten out. Swirl on wax paper.
Mix all ingredients well. Heat and serve with French bread cubes.

Stir about 1/2 sifted powdered (confectioners) sugar into a bowl. Combine hot water with corn syrup and mix well. Add egg white and flavoring. Knead in sufficient sugar to make fondant type nature that won't stick to your hands while you are kneading it. Will use most of sugar (but depends on egg size used). Divide fondant and knead in food coloring. Roll about 1/4-inch thick. Cut into small circles and dust with more powdered sugar. Press into molds or shape but remove from molds immediately. Pack in containers sprinkle with powdered sugar. Close tightly and let ripen about 10 days. This also makes delicious bonbons. Use vanilla instead of mint flavors.

Spray 9-inch round pan with Pam. Open biscuit tube. Place biscuits in 9-inch round pan. Sprinkle grated cheese and bacon bits on biscuit dough. Place in oven and bake at 400\u00b0 for 10 to 12 minutes.
Thaw strawberries. Drain peaches. Cut pound cake in half lengthwise. Cut each half crosswise into 1/2-inch thick slices.

In top of double boiler over boiling water melt morsels with sweetened condensed milk and butter. Remove from heat. In large bowl combine nuts and marshmallows fold in chocolate mixture. Spread on wax paper-lined 13 x 9-inch pan. Chill 2 hours until firm. Remove from pan peel off wax paper and cut into squares. Cover and store at room temperature.
Mix well and freeze. At serving time fill glass half full with slush and fill rest of way with 7-Up.

Melt butter in 9 x 13-inch pan. Sprinkle in graham cracker crumbs. Sprinkle in chocolate chips. Sprinkle in coconut. Sprinkle in chopped pecans. Pour sweetened condensed milk over all. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool cut into bars.

Sift flour baking powder and salt together. Add milk. Knead the dough until it has a rubbery texture. Roll it out on a lightly floured surface until it is 1/2-inch thick. Cut into squares. Fry in oil until brown. They will puff up and cook quickly. Drain on paper towels. Dust with powdered sugar and serve with honey if desired.
Cut carrots 1/2-inch thick. Cook until tender. Cool. Add onions and pepper. Mix together soup oil sugar salt and pepper. Pour over carrots onion and pepper. Let stand overnight. Will keep 2 weeks.

Blanch broccoli florets in large pot of boiling salted water until just crisp-tender about 2 minutes. Drain and immediately place in a bowl of ice water. Drain and pat dry when cold. Melt butter in heavy large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots cover and cook until crisp-tender stirring occasionally about 15 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high. Add peppers stir for 5 minutes. Add squash stir 1 minute. Add lima beans broccoli and salt. Cover and cook until heated through stirring occasionally about 4 minutes. Season with pepper. Serve immediately. Serves 8.
Mix all ingredients mix will be dry. Roll out on cookie sheet or wax paper to desired thickness. Cut with cookie cutter or knife into desired shapes. Allow to dry 5 days.
Combine all ingredients and bake at 350\u00b0 about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Get a large pot and put in the spareribs beef and chicken wings. Boil spareribs for about 1/2 hour. Saute 1 pound of boneless chuck beef and put in large pot. Saute pack of chicken wings and put in pot. Put in can of tomato puree and tomato sauce. Add diced onions salt pepper mustard ketchup sugar Adobo seasoning and whole tomatoes. Simmer for 2 hours and then add 1 pound of deveined shrimp.

Dissolve yeast in a little warm water. Mix shortening salt sugar egg vanilla and milk. Add yeast mixture then flour. Mix well. Add raisins candied fruit and nuts. Let rise. Divide into 3 parts. Roll each portion into a long roll. Form into a braid. Let rise until light. Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 350\u00b0.

Brown burger meat and sausage. Drain. Stir in remaining ingredients (except Velveeta). Add cheese slowly (cut in cubes). Place one spoonful of mixture on each rye round. Put on cookie sheet and freeze. When frozen place in plastic bag and return to freezer. When wanted remove and bake 10 minutes at 350\u00b0 and serve hot.
Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Pour pie filling into greased 9 x 13-inch pan. Sprinkle dry cake mix over filling. Pour melted butter over cake mix and top with nuts. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes.

Pack okra into hot pint jars with a pod of pepper clove of garlic and head of dill or dill seed in each jar. Make a brine of water vinegar and salt heat to boiling. Pour over okra. Close jars. Process in boiling water bath 10 minutes. Start to count processing time as soon as hot jars are placed in actively boiling water. Makes 6 pints.

Butter 9x13 inch pan. Microwave 5 cups of marshmallows chocolate chips corn syrup and butter on high 2-3 minutes. Stir in vanilla. Pour over cereal. Quickly toss until evenly coated. Stir in remaining marshmallows. Press mixture into pan. Let stand for 1 hour. Cut and enjoy.

Heat butter and saute mushrooms until crisp and tender. Mix bread crumbs garlic and lemon juice. Arrange artichokes in buttered shallow baking dish. Spoon mushroom mixture over artichokes and sprinkle cheese over all. Bake in preheated 350\u00b0 oven for 25 to 30 minutes.

Boil chicken breasts cool and skin. Cut into bite size pieces. Place into 6 x 10-inch baking dish (greased). Cook Stove Top dressing following directions on box. Spoon over chicken bites. Spread broccoli over dressing. Cover with slices of Velveeta cheese (more is better). Microwave until cheese is melted and heated through or in oven at 375\u00b0 until cheese is melted and heated through about 1/2 hour.
Mix sugar milk and cream cheese. Add in Cool Whip. Crumble cake into mixture. Pour into a 9 x 13-inch dish or pan and smooth out. Top with one can cherry pie filling. Refrigerate and serve.
Brown ground beef with onion and seasonings (garlic powder and pepper). Stir in spaghetti sauce and let stew.

Cook spaghetti according to package directions drain. Rinse with cold water drain. Place spaghetti in a large salad bowl set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons sesame oil in a large skillet. Add red pepper green onions and garlic saute 2 minutes. Stir in spinach cover and cook over medium heat 3 minutes or until spinach wilts. Remove from heat cool. Spoon mixture over pasta. Add chicken and water chestnuts. Combine remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil soy sauce and remaining ingredients stir well. Pour over pasta toss gently to coat. Yields 6 servings.

Load family (husband included) into family vehicle (van preferably for separating kids). Drive to nearest location (can't stand kids for any longer) and release kids on the establishment (hopefully there's a playground). When food is gone (whether in stomachs or on floor) leave to the relief of others sitting around you. Oh! Don't forget your coupons!

Heat olive oil in a large skillet add garlic and onions. Cook until onions are tender but not brown. Layer remaining vegetables in the skillet sprinkling each layer with monosodium glutamate salt and pepper. Cook covered over low heat about 20 minutes. Uncover skillet continue cooking at a simmer until most of the liquid has evaporated about 15 minutes or less. Serve hot or cold. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over top before serving. Serves 6 to 8. This keeps well in the refrigerator for days.

In 4 or 5-quart Dutch oven or large pot heat oil until hot. Add onions garlic eggplant and peppers and cook over medium heat stirring often until onions are crisp-tender about 5 minutes. Stir in zucchini tomatoes parsley and basil. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat to medium cover and cook 15 minutes. Remove cover and stir in seasoned salt and pepper. Continue cooking uncovered 10 minutes longer. Stir in tomato paste. Serve as is or over hot cooked rice. Top each serving with a sprinkling of shredded cheese.

Brown ground beef drain. Combine sauces and water. Stir 1/2 cup into beef along with chilies half of cheese and half of onions. Mix well. Pour half of remaining sauce mixture on bottom of 10-inch round or 8 x 12-inch baking dish. Stuff cooked shells with beef mixture. Arrange in baking dish. Pour remaining sauce over shells. Bake covered at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes. Top with remaining cheese and onions. Bake uncovered for 5 minutes. (Hot chilies and/or picante sauce can be used for a spicier dish.)
Steep tea bags boiling water and sugar for 10 minutes. Add cold water lemonade orange juice and vodka. Freeze in gallon jug before serving. Spoon into glass and add ginger ale. Keep frozen.

Combine milk and pudding mix and blend 1 minute. Let stand 5 minutes. Fold in 2 cups of Cool Whip. Add about 1 1/2 cups of strawberries. In bowl combine sugar and cinnamon. Butter both sides of tortillas. Sprinkle one side with the sugar/cinnamon mixture. Put in 350\u00b0 oven sugar/cinnamon side up only about 2 minutes until bubbly. Take out of oven and let stand 3 to 4 minutes. Fill shells with sugar side out. Top each with Cool Whip and add sliced strawberries.

Put all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Fill 8 well-greased muffin tins or custard cups. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 10 minutes then lower oven temperature to 350\u00b0 for 20 minutes longer. Serve warm with butter and jam.

Chop onion and green pepper. Heat olive oil and saute in a heavy pan. Add cubed chicken breasts and saute until light brown. Add 1 teaspoon of salt 1 teaspoon oregano and 8 ounces of tomato sauce cook on low-medium heat. In saucepan melt butter and add minced garlic. Add scallops and shrimp and set aside. Add crushed tomatoes wine Parmesan cheese hot sausage (after browning) and remaining spices to the chicken mixture. Continue to cook for 30 minutes on low-medium heat. Add scallops and shrimp to sauce and cook for 20 minutes more. Add Mozzarella cheese. Cook sauce until cheese melts. Cook 16 ounces of linguine for 7 to 8 minutes add garlic and oregano to boiling water. Serve sauce over linguine and garnish with fresh parsley. Serves 6 to 8 people.
Marinate first 5 ingredients for 1 hour. Add macaroni. Serve warm or chilled.

In bowl mix shredded roast beef or chicken add onions green chilies Cheddar cheese small diced cooked potatoes and pepper. Mix together. Warm corn tortillas fill with chicken/beef and roll tightly and small. Fry in skillet with hot oil. Eat with sour cream salsa and guacamole.
1. Tortillas as \bread\: Corn or flour tortillas may be used.
Cook pork and grind meat in meat grinder with onions. Mix spices and cook over low heat until well done. Stir often.

Mix the first 6 ingredients in an 8 x 8-inch pan. Refrigerate until aspic has started to set (about the consistency of an unbeaten egg white). Then mix in the remaining ingredients. Chill and serve. This recipe doubles well.

Mix the syrup and water together. Stir over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Cook until a small amount dropped into cold water threads to a hard crack stage. Have ready the stiffly beaten egg whites. Pour syrup very slowly into egg whites continue beating using a large spoon until mixture holds its shape. Add the vanilla and nuts. Drop by teaspoon onto wax paper.

Cook macaroni and cool. Stuff each shell with a tablespoon of each of the cheeses. Place in a 5-quart baking dish. Pour spaghetti sauce over the shells. Top with Mozzarella cheese. Bake in 350\u00b0 oven until cheese has melted.

Salt and pepper chicken and bake for 30 minutes at 350\u00b0. In oil cook onion and bell pepper. Cover chicken with onion and bell pepper. Stir in tomato sauce water and flour. Cover and simmer for 1 hour on low heat.

Boil shells. Drain immediately. Arrange on a flat surface. Mix cheeses eggs and bread crumbs in a large bowl. Stuff shells with cheese mix. Place shells on a baking dish (spread sauce on bottom of dish). Spread sauce on top of shells. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 to 45 minutes.

Mix all together and slowly whisk into dry ingredients. Place mixture over medium-high heat and cook stirring constantly until mixture thickens and loses its wet look. Pour out on countertop or board and knead until of even consistency.

Cut each bacon slice in thirds. Cut water chestnuts in half. Wrap each half with a slice of bacon secure with toothpick. Dip each in teriyaki sauce. Arrange 12 in a circle on a glass or plastic cooking grill. Cover with paper towel. Cook on Full power for 3 to 5 minutes or until bacon is as crisp as you wish. Repeat with remaining appetizers. Dip each in additional heated teriyaki sauce when serving. Makes about 36 individual appetizers.

In skillet over medium heat cook broccoli zucchini green pepper onion and basil in butter until vegetables are tender. Stir in tomatoes and mushrooms. Toss vegetable mixture with hot fettucine. Serve with Parmesan cheese if desired. Serves 5.
Combine all ingredients and simmer for 45 minutes. After each use store remainder in freezer. Two cups equals free food exchange.

In a 5-quart saucepan over high heat bring 3-quarts water the salt and 1 tablespoon of the vegetable oil to a rolling boil. Add pasta stirring to separate strands. Cover pan until water returns to boiling. Uncover and cook pasta 7 to 9 minutes or until pasta is al dente that is cooked but firm to the bite.
