Pour hot pasta and water into a colander that has been set in the sink. Drain pasta thoroughly. Rinse with cold running water and drain pasta again. Transfer cooled pasta to a large bowl and set aside.

Cream together with a pinch of tenderness. Add 1 cup of faith hope and charity. Beat very lightly in a bowl of patience. Be sure to add a spoonful of gaiety that sings and also the ability to laugh at little things. Bake in a good-natured pan. Cut in large slices and serve repeatedly.

Saute onion and mushrooms in margarine until golden brown. Add meat and stir until all is brown. Add tomato puree/sauce and simmer 10 minutes. Cook noodles drain and rinse. Layer noodles then cheese and then meat in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes (be sure heated all the way through).
Completely dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Pour into 13 x 9-inch pan. Chill until firm about 3 hours. Makes 24 pieces. You can use cookie cutters to make fun shapes.

In a large bowl add\tflour sugar salt shortening eggs and baking\tpowder\tin the order\tgiven.\tAdd a little water just enough to hold the dough together. If it gets too sticky add a little more flour. Roll dough into a ball. Break off small pieces of dough and roll between floured hands into a long roll that resembles a pencil. Place on board and cut into 1/2 inch pieces. Fry in hot oil until golden.\tFry a small amount at a\ttime. Remove from hot oil with a slotted spoon and drain on brown paper until cooled. In a deep pan heat honey. Drop in cooked balls and stir until coated. Lift out quickly and place on a large platter. Mound high in center sprinkle with confectioners sugar crushed nuts and colored sprinkles if desired.

recipe_name: Delicious Hors D'Oeuvres("A Favorite From The '76 Cookbook.")
directions: Mix the three ingredients together well. Make small ball shapes about the size of marbles or roll in long rolls about 1/2-inch in diameter and slice and bake as needed at 400\u00b0 for 10 to 20 minutes. Can be frozen before baking.
Pour all ingredients over coal in order given. Watch it grow. Red stuff can be food coloring or merthiolate.
Peel the avocado. Cut avocado into cubes about 3 cups. Put the avocado into a mixing bowl and cut it back and forth with a knife to make a coarse mixture. Add the other ingredients. Chill.
Bring sugar and syrup to a boil in a saucepan. Add peanut butter and stir. Stir in cereal and spread in a 13x9-inch pan. Combine morsels and sprinkle over top. Cut into bars.
Combine punch milk and ice cream in an electric blender. Blend until smooth and frothy. Pour into tall glasses. Makes 3 to 4 servings.

Combine all ingredients in a 2-quart saucepan. Simmer on low heat for approximately 30 to 40 minutes for best flavor. Serve on 6-inch long rolls (not hot dog buns) with Polish or any other mustard and chopped onions if desired.

Marinate trout for 3 to 4 hours in Italian dressing in the refrigerator. Remove fillet and place in a deep pan (buttered). Add all spices according to taste. Add some olive oil. Pour in Italian dressing until it covers the trout. Bake fish at 350\u00b0 until almost done then remove and cover trout with cheese and sprinkle a few of the bread crumbs. Bake until cheese melts and fish is baked. Serves 2 people.

Combine 1 1/4 cups flour yeast sugar and salt blend. Heat water milk and oil until warm. Add egg and warm liquid to flour mixture. Blend well. Add remaining 1 3/4 cups flour. Knead about 5 minutes until smooth and pliable. Cover and let rise 1 hour. Roll out into rectangular shape and layer with filling.

Trim crusts from bread. Butter one side. Place buttered side down in 9 1/2 x 13 1/2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the bread then lay 1 pound cooked sausage on the cheese. Add Monterey Jack cheese over the sausage.
Combine all ingredients except soup and cheese in a cast-iron pan. Cook until done. Add soup and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes. Smother with cheese and place under broiler for 5 minutes.
Using a sharp knife cut avocados in half and remove the pits. Scoop the flesh into a medium sized bowl and roughly crush with a fork. Stir in lime juice.
Place first 5 ingredients in saucepan cook until tender (10 to 12 minutes) drain. In bowl mix butter mustard salt and pepper. Add to vegetables and toss lightly.
Mix first 3 ingredients together. Top with lettuce tomatoes and cheese. Serve with corn chips or nacho chips.

Combine all ingredients except the baking soda in a large heavy saucepan. Cook over low heat stirring gently until sugar dissolves. Cover and cook over medium heat for 2 to 3 minutes to wash down sugar crystals from sides of pan. Uncover and cook to soft ball stage (235\u00b0) stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in soda. Beat with a wooden spoon just until mixture begins to thicken. Working fast drop by tablespoons onto greased wax paper. Let stand until firm. Yield: 1 1/2 to 2 dozen.

Saute onion and margarine until tender. Add hot dogs brown lightly. Reduce heat add soup cheese and water. Cook over low heat until well blended and cheese is melted. Stir in pasta which has been cooked according to package directions. Serves 6.
If there's any fat in meat eliminate water.
Note: Make this up in a gallon size Ziploc bag and this will be a piece of cake!

Saute ground beef with onion in oil in skillet until ground beef is browned stirring frequently. Add mushrooms and spinach mixing well. Stir in eggs gradually. Cook until eggs are set stirring constantly. Season with salt and pepper. Yields 6 servings.
Mix the sugar and the lime in a small pitcher and crush it. Add \Cachaca\ or vodka and mix. Add ice. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Lightly grease cookie sheet set aside. In large bowl combine cake mix whipped topping and egg blend well. Cover and chill. Roll into 1-inch balls and dip in confectioners sugar. Place 1 1/2-inches apart on cookie sheet. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from cookie sheet cool. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.
Mix first three ingredients in food processor with steel blade. Slowly pour in butter while processor is running. Reheat in double boiler with a little water.

recipe_name: New Orleans School Of Cooking Gumbo(Yield: 15 To 20 Servings)
directions: In large skillet brown flour and oil until dark brown (Hershey's chocolate color) over medium-high heat stirring continuously. Do not burn! Add trinity (this is the onion celery and pepper) and stir continuously until vegetables are tender. Add garlic at very end. Gradually stir in liquid and bring to boil. Add chicken and sausage and simmer 1 hour or more (the longer the better). About 10 minutes before serving add green onions. Serve over rice if desired.
Bring first three ingredients to boil over medium heat until soft ball stage. Pour over Marshmallow Creme. Beat until forms small peaks. Add nuts. Drop by spoonful onto wax paper.

Remove all fat and place meat in the freezer. When the meat is semi-frozen slice into 1/4 inch strips (the thinner the slice the faster the drying). Meat cut with the grain will be chewy while meat cut against the grain will be tender and break more easily when dried. Mix all ingredients and marinate the meat for at least 1 hour then drain in a colander. Place meat on trays to dry. For faster drying do not overlap meat. Turn meat over at least once during the drying period. Dry at 145\u00b0 for 8 to 10 hours. It is dry when it bends like a green willow without breaking. Store in the refrigerator.
Mix all together very well and put into greased baking pan. Cover tightly with aluminum foil and bake at 350 degrees for approximately 1 hour.

With sharp knife cut skin of bologna. Cut into 1/2-inch or more diamond shapes. Punch holes all the way through so the basting gets in all the meat. Baste generously with brown sugar and pineapple or use any kind of jelly to suit taste. Bake in oven until piping hot all the way through or if you prefer put on rotisserie and use barbecue sauce instead of brown sugar. Baste every 15 minutes for a barbecue flavor. Delicious either way.
Clean celery. Fill celery with peanut butter. Put raisins on top.

Heat peas and water to boiling in medium saucepan. Cover and remove from heat. Let stand 1 hour. Fry bacon drain. Add onion to peas cover and simmer until peas are tender (1 to 1 1/2 hours). Stir in rice black pepper tomatoes and green pepper. Cover and simmer stirring occasionally until rice is tender about 25 minutes. Add additional water if necessary. Add dollop of plain yogurt to each serving. Serves 6 to 8.

Saute onion in margarine in skillet until tender. Dip steaks in milk coat with a mixture of crumbs salt and pepper. Brown quickly in the hot skillet from which the onions have been removed. Place in a baking dish. Add tomato sauce to skillet heat for several minutes stirring occasionally. Add mushrooms now and pour sauce over steaks. Bake covered at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with cheese. Let stand covered for a few minutes to melt the cheese. Great served with rice pilaf.

Blend together 2 containers yogurt vanilla and 6 tablespoons sugar in a bowl. In a separate bowl blend together remaining yogurt 3 tablespoons sugar and grape juice. Cut bananas in half crosswise quarter each banana half lengthwise. Stand up 4 pieces of banana in each of 4 sundae or dessert dishes. Spoon about half of the vanilla yogurt into dish. Dividing evenly spoon about half of the grape mixture into dish. Dividing evenly sprinkle each dish with 1/2 tablespoon of granola. Repeat layering until ingredients are used up. Top with granola and cherry.
Mix well and chill for about 1 1/2 hours in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Cut into squares.

Melt the caramels with the milk and set aside. Combine the flour oatmeal brown sugar baking soda and salt. Melt the butter and pour over the flour mixture mixing well. Divide in half and spread half the dough in the bottom of a 9 x 9-inch cake pan. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10-15 minutes.

Brown meat. Drain on paper towel. In separate pan saute onion in oil. Add 1/2 cup cheese meat garlic and enough sauce to cover meat. Simmer about 10 minutes. Cook shells according to package directions. Stuff shells with meat. Arrange in a baking dish. Cover with remaining sauce and cheese. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 30 minutes.

In a large microwave bowl toss chocolate and oil. Microwave uncovered at medium for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until chocolate is melted. Stir only once. Stir in marshmallows and graham crackers. Spoon into muffin cups and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm.
Beat eggs add pecans and dates. Spoon into greased mini tins. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 minutes. Makes 24 small treats. You must use mini tins.

Use 3\ttablespoons canning/pickling salt for\teach 5 pounds shredded cabbage. (Add 1 teaspoon of sugar for each 5 pounds of cabbage if cabbage isn't\tmature.) Mix shredded cabbage with salt and sugar. Pack into\tstone jar tightly. Let brine form. If more brine is needed make more by boiling 2 tablespoons salt and 1 quart water together and then cool. Set stone jar on rack to allow circulation. Cover kraut with glass plate and weigh the plate down with a jar of water heavy enough so brine covers cabbage. Drape a white cloth over top of stone jar.
Blend cheese and butter with fork. Add clams onions and salt. Toast bread on one side. Spread mixture on untoasted side. Put in oven at 325\u00b0. Serve when hot and bubbly.

Mix corn syrup sugar water and salt in saucepan. Cook stirring until sugar is dissolved. Cook to firm ball stage or 248\u00b0 on candy thermometer. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry. Pour about 1/2 of the syrup slowly over whites beating constantly. Cook remainder until 272\u00b0 on thermometer or soft crack stage. Add slowly to first mixture and beat until mixture holds its shape. Add vanilla and nuts and drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Yields 1 1/2 pounds.

Cook beef with onions stirring frequently. Add to remaining ingredients (EXCEPT cheese) in a large bowl. Turn into 9 x 13 pan or 3-quart casserole dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Top with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes in a preheated 375\u00b0 oven. Serves 8 to 10. Can freeze. Can do ahead.
Wash and cut leaves off celery. Cut celery stalks in desired length. Spread on peanut butter or cream cheese. Sprinkle on raisins.

Break angel food cake into small pieces and put into 9 x 9-inch glass dish. Make vanilla pudding according to directions. Pour over cake while still hot. Make jello according to package directions then pour jello over hot pudding. Cover with defrosted fruit and place in refrigerator until set. Serve with whipped cream topping. (Use frozen strawberries with strawberry jello and frozen raspberries with raspberry jello.)
Dampen fish or chicken before shaking or dip in a slightly beaten egg white then roll or shake meat in the dry ingredients. Bake chicken at 370\u00b0 for 1 hour. Bake fish for twenty minutes.
Bake at 350\u00b0 in 11 x 13-inch pan 1 hour and 15 minutes uncovered. Watch it!
Add salt seasoning and vinegar to hot water and bring to boil. Add fish and boil 20 minutes. Drain and serve with melted butter.

Mix the flour and seasoning together. Cut the meat into even-sized pieces and roll them in the seasoned flour. Place in a pie dish with layers of sliced onion and sage. Peel the potatoes and half-cook them. Cut them in thick slices and place over the top of the meat. Three-parts fill the dish with water cover with greased paper and bake in moderate oven (350\u00b0) for about 1 hour. (WCB)
Melt sugar and margarine together. Add flour eggs vanilla and pecans. Stir everything together. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes.

Saute meat and onion. Cover with Italian dressing water and broth. Simmer 3 to 4 hours or cook in crock-pot on low all day. Thicken sauce to gravy consistency with cornstarch and small amount of water. Serve over egg noodles or rice.

Wash stem and slice okra. In a large pan saute okra in drippings. Add green pepper onion garlic tomatoes paste water and seasoning. Simmer about 20 minutes then add shrimp and sausage or ham. Cook 45 minutes. If bacon is being used add after 35 minutes. Serve over fluffy rice. Yields 4 to 6 servings.
Serves any number of teddy bear lovers!

Cook pasta in boiling water in a saucepan for 9 minutes salt may be added if desired. Drain immediately. Cook spinach according to package directions drain. Add Ricotta cheese egg and 2 tablespoons Parmesan cheese to spinach mix well. Spoon into shells. Spread half the spaghetti sauce in two 2-quart baking dishes. Arrange filled shells in prepared dishes. Pour remaining sauce on shells. Sprinkle with shredded Mozzarella cheese and remaining Parmesan cheese. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 15 to 20 minutes. Serves 6.

Boil together the sugar syrup salt and water to 260 degrees soft crack stage on candy thermometer. Add to egg whites keeping syrup hot. Add vanilla and Jello. Beat until it holds a soft peak and begins to lose its gloss. Working quickly drop by teaspoons onto waxed paper.
Dissolve gelatin and Kool-Aid with sugar in hot water. Add cold water. Pour into molds. Freeze.
Brown the flour with the bacon drippings until brown and thick. Add the salt and pepper. Mix well and add milk cooking and stirring until desired thickness. Sop with biscuits.

Wash fruit carefully in colander. Let sugar and water come to a boil. Add lemons figs and spices tied in a bag. Boil slowly until figs are tender and clear about 1 hour. Lift fruit carefully into sterilized jars cover with juice. Seal while hot. Yields 4 pints.

Bring water and sugar to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes then cool. Add orange juice lemonade and gin. Freeze mixture. When ready to serve fill glass half full of mixture and half with 7-Up or Sprite. Great to keep on hand in the freezer.

Spray a baking dish lightly with cooking spray. Place 1/2 bag of tortillas on bottom of pan. On top of tortillas spread chili. On top of chili add cheeses. On top of cheeses add diced vegetables. Cover with aluminum foil. Bake approximately 25 minutes. Serve hot.
Peel fruits. Bring all ingredients to a boil in a kettle and let simmer as long as needed to scent the house. May be used more than once just save the juice.

Bring water to boil in a pot cook the bow ties. Drain and cool. Put kasha in a wide mixing bowl add the beaten egg. Mix with a fork until the egg is fully absorbed and all of the grains of kasha are slightly moistened. Let this mixture dry overnight or place in a skillet over moderately high heat and stir the kasha until it is dry and the grains separate from each other. In a large saucepan heat the olive oil and saute the onions and mushrooms until they are light brown and soft. Bring 2 cups salted water to a boil in a large pot. Add the kasha cook until the kasha has absorbed all of the water. Mix in the sauteed vegetables and bow ties. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Cream butter with sugar. Add eggs beat well. Add honey salt and vanilla. Combine baking powder and flour. Add to creamed mixture. Drop by half teaspoons onto buttered cookie sheet. Top with seeds 3 each. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 8 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Yields 6 dozen cookies.
Spread jalapeno bean dip on plate then alternate ingredients in layers as listed. Dip with chips.

Combine scalded milk 1/4 cup sugar salt and shortening. Cool to lukewarm. Soften yeast in lukewarm water. Add to first mixture. Stir in egg. Add flour work until smooth. Put dough on floured board let rest 10 minutes. Mix together sugar and cinnamon. Roll dough out into rectangular shape brush with butter. Sprinkle with some of the cinnamon sugar mixture. Roll and cut slices 1-inch thick. Put a generous amount of sugar on board. Roll each slice until flat 5 to 6-inch circle. Put on greased baking sheet and let rise 30 minutes. Bake at 300\u00b0 for 12 minutes.
Cook dates margarine and sugar over medium heat for 9 to 10 minutes stirring constantly. Add pecans Rice Krispies and vanilla. Roll into walnut-size balls. Dip in powdered sugar.

Mix cheese olives onions and mayonnaise. Spread on bread slices. Sprinkle crumbled bacon on top. Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Bake on cookie sheet for 15 minutes or until bubbly. Great for the holidays.
Combine all ingredients in blender except noodles. Blend. Cook fettucine according to package directions. Put on warm plate and toss with sauce.

Heat oven to 375\u00b0. Mix brown sugar shortening margarine coffee egg baking soda salt cinnamon and nutmeg. Stir in remaining ingredients. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonful about 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until almost no indentation remains when touched. Cool. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.
Grate onion. Peel potatoes and grate. Combine onion and potatoes rinse and drain in a sieve. Squeeze out excess liquid. Put in a bowl and stir in egg flour salt and pepper.

Dip bread in melted butter and brown on both sides on griddle. Cover 2 slices with ham. Top with second slice bread. Melt cheese with wine over hot water. Cover the sandwiches with the cheese mixture. Serve.

Melt butter in scalded milk. Cool to lukewarm. Add egg salt and sugar and dissolve yeast in milk. Stir in enough flour to make a soft dough. Let rise for 1 hour in warm place. Punch down and let rise again. Put into 2 (8 or 9-inch) cake pans. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Let rise until doubled and bake 20 minutes in moderate oven at 375\u00b0.
Dissolve the gelatin in boiling water. Add blueberries and pineapple mix well. Chill until gelatin mixture is partially set.
Mix all together. Roll out dough and cut into diamonds. Make a slit in middle of each diamond and pull one end through the hole. Fry with pulled side up. Makes approximately 60.

In a 10-inch skillet saute over medium heat all ingredients but eggs and cream until tender (about 8 minutes). Remove from heat. Beat eggs and cream in a bowl. Put skillet back on heat. Pour egg mixture over vegetables. Do not stir. Cook until eggs are softly set. Cover the mixture until the top sets. Salt and pepper to taste. Can add Parmesan cheese for added touch. Can also add imitation crab meat for special touch.
Peel and wrap the banana tightly in plastic wrap. Put it in the freezer for 2 hours. Place yogurt strawberries banana and orange juice in the jar of a blender. Puree until smooth and frothy.
Cream butter and sugar slowly over heat. Add eggs flour chocolate bits and flavoring. When well mixed pour into two 9 x 9-inch baking pans. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 35 to 40 minutes.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Gently toss with olive oil. Cover and set aside. Mix spinach garlic onion cheeses parsley egg spices and seasonings. Pour enough spaghetti sauce in 9 x 13-inch pan to sparingly cover bottom. Gently fill shells with spinach mixture and place side by side in pan. Spoon more sauce over all. Cover with foil. Bake 30 minutes at 350\u00b0. Uncover. Sprinkle with more Mozzarella if desired and bake 10 more minutes.

Mix ingredients. Soak 1 1/2 to 2 pounds boneless meat in marinade overnight. Cut into strips (1/8 to 1/4 x 1-inch). Lay strips on oven racks with the drip pan below and the door slightly open roast for 5 to 6 hours at 150\u00b0. The meat will shrivel and blacken as it dries. Pat off any beads of fat. Cook the meat until it is chewy and flexible enough to bend without breaking. Do not overdry.

Blend soup mayo lemon juice and curry. Stir in chicken and vegetables. Spread into 2-quart casserole. Top with cheese. Mix melted margarine parsley and cornflake crumbs and top casserole. Bake at 350\u00b0 uncovered for 45 minutes.

Mix butter and crumbs into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 325\u00b0 for 10 minutes. Let cool completely. Mix milk with pudding mix. Add ice cream. Spread over crust. Spread on Cool Whip and refrigerate overnight.

Peel onions and stud each with 4 cloves. Place onions pork chops salt pork carrots and bacon in large 8-quart kettle. Add black pepper and juniper berries tied in a piece of cheesecloth to the kettle. Cover all with drained sauerkraut and pour chicken bouillon and white wine throughout. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2 1/2 hours. Make diagonal cuts (3) in each of the knockwurst and add them to the kettle 15 minutes before the end of cooking.

Prepare cupcakes let cool. Prepare Filling using super shooter or decorating bag fill centers of cupcakes with Filling. Dip sparingly into chocolate coating. Place on waxed paper to cool allowing coating to harden.
Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Make out into patties and fry in hot oil until brown.

Blend with much Understanding and lots of Forgiveness. Bake continuously in the oven of Commitment and Trust. Baste often and liberally with a Sense of Humor. Serve with plenty of Communication in a Problem-Solving Atmosphere (especially good when shared with loving Family and Friends).

Brown onion and bell pepper in butter remove from pan. Brown ground beef until redness is gone. Add onion bell pepper rice tomatoes salt pepper and chili powder. Pour into greased dish. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour.
Put in blender all ingredients. Add ice cubes to make a thick shake.
Line the bottom of a deep glass bowl (wider at bottom) with ladyfingers stand ladyfingers all around side of bowl. Spread bottom ladyfingers with strawberry preserves then layer of strawberries.
Steam lobster pieces. Set aside. Toss scallions and mushrooms in butter cooking in skillet until starting to get tender. Add seasonings and lobster until everything is hot. Serve hot!!!

Preheat oven to 425\u00b0. Pour milk into blender. Add flour and salt. Blend slightly. Add eggs one at a time blending each. Spray muffin or popover pans well. Fill each cup 3/4 full. Bake for 20 minutes at 425\u00b0. Reduce heat to 325\u00b0 and bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Do not open oven door while baking. You may bake 5 minutes longer for a drier popover.
Brown pork in skillet then add all remaining ingredients and cook like a stew.

Mix beans and taco seasoning. Spread on large tray. Mix cream cheese with sour cream and spread on top of bean mixture. Layer remaining ingredients with cheese on top. Pour picante sauce over top. Refrigerate. Serve with tortilla chips.

Wash lentils under running water. Put them in a cooking pan with just one cup of water and bring them to boil over high heat 5-7 minutes. Lower heat and cook covered for 15-20 minutes or until water is absorbed.
Mix and eat. Use as topping for oatmeal.

Mix graham wafer crumbs with butter and sugar to make crust. Spread on cookie sheet or shallow cake pan. Put layer of chocolate chips first then butterscotch chips coconut and nuts. Top with Eagle Brand evenly. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool and cut into slices or squares.
Pour first 3 ingredients into large mixing bowl. Stir together well. Fold in pecans and Cool Whip.

Trim all fat from meat cut into very thin strips. Mix and soak overnight. Arrange strips on cookie sheet. Set oven at 200\u00b0. Leave oven door cracked to let moisture escape (put a spoon in the door). Bake 4 to 7 hours.

In a small bowl combine water yeast and 2 teaspoons sugar. Let stand about 10 minutes until yeast foams. Meanwhile combine milk vanilla butter egg 1/3 cup sugar salt and nutmeg. Stir in the yeast mixture. Add the flour one cup at a time mixing well after each addition. After three cups have been added knead in the remaining flour 1 to 2 tablespoons at a time. Knead until smooth about 10 minutes. Place dough in an oiled bowl turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk about 1 1/2 hours. Punch down dough and roll to a 1/2-inch thickness. Cut the dough into 2-inch diamond shapes. Place on ungreased baking sheets. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled about 1 hour. Pour oil to a depth of 3-inches in a heavy pot or fryer. Heat to 365\u00b0 and fry the beignets 4 or 5 at a time for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towel and place in a warm oven while frying the remaining beignets. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving warm. Makes about 30.
Brown ground beef and drain. Add onion potatoes water parsley basil salt and pepper and sugar. Simmer 15 to 20 minutes. Add both cans of corn. Let boil and add milk.
Sift flour then measure. Sift together flour baking powder salt and sugar. Add eggs and beat well. Add milk and vanilla mix well. Add oleo on low speed.
Combine flour sugar and baking powder. Blend in butter or margarine egg and vanilla to form a soft dough.

Boil pasta in salty water until barely tender drain. Saute onion celery green pepper and garlic in oil. Combine remaining ingredients except cheese then add sauteed vegetables and spaghetti. Pour into large casserole sprayed with Pam. Top with cheese. Bake in a 350\u00b0 oven until contents are bubbly and top is brown about 25 minutes. With French bread and a green salad this recipe serves a large group. We always made Turketti to take to the beach during spring break.

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Melt margarine and stir in brown sugar. Cool. Add eggs to sugar mixture. Beat. Add salt baking powder and flour. Mix well. Spread in a greased 15 x 10 x 1-inch pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips over top. Put in a 350\u00b0 oven for 1 minute. Remove from oven and swirl chips with knife. Return to oven and bake 20 minutes.

Dip fish in seasoned flour then in beaten egg to which cheese parsley salt and pepper have been added. Saute in oil or butter until brown. While fish is sauteing mix garlic wine lemon juice and butter together and bring to boil to evaporate wine approximately 1/2 minute. Add cooked spinach to serving dish. (Have spinach warm.) Lay fish over spinach. Pour hot mix (garlic wine lemon juice butter) over fish and spinach. Garnish with lemon slices. Please no substitutes.
Mix and serve warm as dip accompanied by tortilla chips.

Crush wafers fine. Add raisins milk and finely chopped nuts. Mix well. Press mixture evenly into a greased 9 x 11 pan. Cover with foil and place in refrigerator for 24 hours. Cut into 1-inch squares and roll pieces in powdered sugar. These are wonderful. I sometimes substitute chocolate chips for raisins.
Mix all ingredients. Put into a greased and floured spring form. Bake slowly at 325 to 350\u00b0F for 1 hour.
Clean and pat dry several stalks of celery. Spread peanut butter inside celery. Cut each celery stalk into thirds. Place raisins on peanut butter. Enjoy this healthy nutritious and fun treat.
Mix all together. Top with a few of the pecans and cherries. Refrigerate.

Combine the chocolate morsels corn syrup and water in top of a double boiler. Melt over hot (not boiling) water. Remove from heat and stir in raisins and peanuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Cool until firm. Makes about 3 dozen.

Put meat wine water bay leaves and spices into a glass bowl and cover. Let stand in refrigerator for 2 or 3 days. Baste frequently and turn over once a day. Then drain meat. Saving liquid sprinkle with flour salt and pepper. Brown in hot fat on all sides add marinade onions and carrots. Cover. Cook slowly for 2 1/2 hours or until tender.
Heat skillet. Add oil and meat brown. Add soy sauce sugar and chicken broth. Add vegetables sliced thin. Serve over rice. Serves 6 to 8 people.
Put ingredients in a large pan and boil 10 minutes. Put in jars and seal. For fried okra rinse thoroughly. Roll in meal and fry as you would any fried okra.

Cut tenderloin into 1-inch cubes. Season with seasoning salt. Melt 2/3 of butter in a pan. Braise beef cubes for 20 minutes. Saute mushrooms and shallots in the remaining 1/3 butter. Stir flour into the vegetables. Combine wine with all ingredients in pan. Cover and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over noodles. Serves 12 people.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl mix gently. Store in an airtight container.

Put vinegar and salt in saucepan and boil until dissolved. You can add some water from the gallon to the vinegar and salt to help get dissolved. When salt is dissolved add this to the remaining gallon of water. Pack sterilized jars with chopped cabbage and cover with solution leaving 1/2-inch of space at the top of the jars. Put caps on jars and store in cool dry place.

Melt butter and candy together in a heavy saucepan. Stir constantly over low heat until mixture is fully melted and smooth. Beat in vanilla and sugar. Spread on warm cake while icing is warm and pliable. Recipe can be doubled.

Peel avocados and break into chunks do not smash. Add sour cream lemon juice garlic and salt. Mix well but don't smash the avocados. Strain a jar of salsa to remove liquid. Add strained salsa to avocados and mix. Serve with warm corn tortillas or tortilla chips.
Pour sweetened condensed milk and soda pop into drum of ice cream maker and follow freezer operating instructions.

Mix flour salt and cream of tartar in a medium bowl. Mix oil water and coloring in small bowl. Quickly stir liquid into dry mixture. Dough will be stiff. Stir all of the lumps out. When cool store in a plastic container.

Flour pheasant. Brown in butter and oil. Place in a casserole which can be placed on a burner. Add broth. Cook at a slow heat for 2 1/2 hours. Saute onions and mushrooms in butter in browning pan. Add Worcestershire sauce catsup 2 tablespoons flour and the broth you cooked the pheasant in. Add sour cream last. Do not boil. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve over rice or pasta or potatoes.

Cream the cream cheese with butter. Add flour mix well and chill for 2 hours. Use 1/4 of dough at a time rolling out on surface sprinkled with powdered sugar to 1/4-inch thick. Cut into 1 1/2-inch squares. Put small amount of apricot jam (or other of your choice) on each square overlap opposite corners of dough and pinch to hold. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar before serving.
Brown and drain meats. Put back in skillet and add remaining 3 ingredients. Melt cheese slowly. Spread on party rye bread. Bake 10 minutes at 350\u00b0.

Place defrosted orange juice and lemonade (un-diluted) in bottom of large percolator. Add sugars ground spices whole cinnamon sticks and whole cloves to basket. Pour apple juice over basket and allow to percolate.
Mix all ingredients with electric beater. Pour on griddle. Serve immediately with your favorite syrup.
Mix flour and salt. Sprinkle with water and mix carefully. Work in enough additional water with hands to make mixture of clay consistency. Can add food coloring. Mold into shapes.

Cut sausages into strips and salami into slices. Rinse peppers remove seeds and cut into slices. Rinse and slice tomatoes. Peel and slice onions. Saute sausages and salami in a skillet for 3 minutes. Add onion and peppers. Saute a few minutes longer. Add tomatoes and reduce heat. Beat eggs. Put all ingredients into a pan and pour eggs over all. Stir mixture over medium heat until eggs set. Sprinkle with paprika and serve with rye bread or old-fashioned wheat bread.
Brown ground meat and onion. Add ingredients simmer for 15 minutes stirring often. Serve over Fritos.

Spread out bread cubes evenly in a 9 x 13-inch pan. In saucepan melt margarine. Add the package mix and garlic. Mix well. Drizzle mixture evenly over bread cubes. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and parsley. Toss to coat and combine. Bake in 350\u00b0 oven for 20 to 30 minutes. Stir once during baking. Let cool until crisp. Store in airtight container.

Pour popped corn in 13 x 9-inch baking pan and combine with wheat squares and oat cereal. Heat in 300\u00b0 oven about 5 minutes. Remove and drizzle with butter. Combine cheese and dry salad dressing mix. Sprinkle over corn and stir. Makes about 9 cups.
Pour liquid starch over Elmers glue already in pie tin a little at a time mixing with hands.
Stir and add 2 cups cold water. Pour into ice cube trays or frozen pop molds.
Cut hot dogs in half roll out biscuits and roll hot dog up into biscuits. Bake in oven at 350\u00b0 until brown. May add cheese or bacon.
You will need wax paper (3 x 6-inch) stapler or tape saucepan and potholder rubber spatula and plastic wrap.

Freeze unopened can of fruit for at least 12 hours (longer is even better). Dip frozen can in hot water a few seconds to loosen edges and make it easier to get out the contents. Cut the frozen fruit up into chunks and put into food processor. Add lemon juice liqueur and cranberries. Pulse on/off for about 30 seconds. Serve immediately or can be scooped into small balls and stored in freezer until ready to serve. Makes 2 to 3 servings.

Cook shells by directions (drain). Brown hamburger meat (drain excess fat). Mix picante sauce tomato sauce and water together. Add 1/2 cup sauce mix 1/2 cup cheese and 1/4 cup onions to meat. Pour half of remaining sauce into bottom of 9 x 13-inch Pyrex dish. Stuff shells and put into dish. Pour remainder of sauce over shells. Bake shells (covered) 30 minutes at 350\u00b0. Uncover and top with remainder of cheese and add onions. Return to oven just to brown onions and melt cheese.

Crush crackers fine add lukewarm milk and refrigerate overnight. Next morning in separate bowl beat eggs well adding sugar vanilla and brandy. Combine this with cracker mixture. If thick add small amount of milk to consistency of cake batter. Add fruit mix raisins and nuts. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour in a well-greased pan. Test middle of cake for doneness. Remove from oven and when slightly cooled sprinkle with sugar.
Boil sugar water and syrup together until a thread forms. Add hot mixture to beaten egg whites and beat until stiff. Add nuts and cherries. Either drop or put in pan.

Saute onions in margarine. Stir in rice and salmon. Add combined mayonnaise and egg mix lightly. Layer half the salmon mixture Parmesan cheese and broccoli in 1-quart casserole. Cover with 1 cup Cheddar cheese. Repeat layers ending with broccoli. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining Cheddar cheese continue baking until cheese is melted. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Season liver with salt and pepper coat with flour. In large skillet brown quickly in hot oil about\t1 minute on each side. Place in greased baking dish. Add seasoning and tomatoes cover and bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes. Remove cover and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer to thicken gravy. Serve on rice. Makes 6 servings.

Dissolve yeast in water in large bowl. Add milk sugar and salt. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in oil and flour. Allow batter to rise in a warm place about 1 1/2 hours. Stir batter down and place in refrigerator overnight or when needed. Stir batter down again and bake in a preheated waffle iron.
Cook ground sausage or diced ham (cook's choice). Mix with egg mixture. Pour in pie pan and bake at 350\u00b0 about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 4 to 5.

In a pan or casserole put dry onion soup mushroom soup cream of chicken soup and cup of rice into the water. Mix well. Put chicken on top. Cover with foil or lid. Put in oven for 2 hours at 325\u00b0. When time is up your supper is done.

In a 9 x 13-inch pan spread dry cake mix. Melt margarine and mix with 1 egg. Dribble this over dry cake mix. Press down on bottom of pan. In another bowl mix softened cream cheese 2 eggs and sugar. Pour over top of cake mix. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 minutes. Cut into small squares. Very rich!

Spread peanut butter on one cracker. Cover with another cracker. Melt chocolate in double boiler. Allow to get very thin. Using tongs place crackers into chocolate. Cover both top and bottom roll to cover sides. Place on cookie sheet covered with wax paper. Continue until all chocolate is used. Place tray in freezer for 15 minutes to set. Store in cool place.

Heat the sugar water corn syrup and salt stirring constantly until the sugar has dissolved. Continue to cook without stirring until the syrup forms a hard ball when dropped in cold water. Beat egg whites until they peak. Pour the syrup slowly into the egg whites. Continue to beat until the candy is stiff enough to hold its shape. Add nuts and vanilla. Drop by teaspoon on wax paper or pour into greased pans cutting into squares.
First Layer: Blend butter and flour. Add nuts then press mixture into a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake about 20 minutes at 350\u00b0 until light brown then cool.

In saucepan or large skillet add oil and garlic simmer for 5 minutes. Add all other ingredients except scrod and angel hair simmer for 25 to 30 minutes. Wash scrod in cold water and towel dry. Add to tomato mixture.

Let bread raise place dough on greased cookie sheet. Pat it out long and thin. Arrange ham on top and center then pepperoni on top. Sprinkle half of spices. Next Provolone then Mozzarella. Sprinkle rest of spices. Moisten edges of dough with water. Bring edges up over meat and cheese to form loaf. Pinch closed. Turn over and cover with butter. Sprinkle with cornmeal. Bake in 375\u00b0 oven 20 to 22 minutes. Heat jar spaghetti sauce while cooking. Cut servings and pour sauce on each serving.

Thaw frozen dough roll to 12-inch square. Cut in 3 strips. Spread butter or margarine down lengthwise center of each strip. Combine brown sugar and cinnamon sprinkle over butter. Top with chopped pecans. Bring dough up around filling sealing edges to form 3 ropes. Place on greased baking sheet and loosely braid. Let rise until double (about 30 minutes). Bake at 375\u00b0 for 30 to 35 minutes. Combine confectioners sugar and enough milk to make a thin glaze. Drizzle over braid while it is still warm. Sprinkle top with red sugar and trim with pecan halves.

Slice sausage in half lengthwise then slice sausage 3/4-inch thick in half moon shapes. Slice onion and peppers into strips. Slice the potatoes. Drain liquid from water chestnuts. Place all ingredients in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until vegetables are tender. Serve over cooked noodles or rice. When camping vegetables can be prepared before you leave and stored in Ziploc bags. The sausage should be left in its original wrapping and prepared that night before cooking.

(It suds less if you put the water in the gallon first and then add other ingredients.) Mix ingredients together in a gallon jug. Transfer to a spray bottle. Label bottle. Excellent for many household chores!

Preparation: Chop the onion and green pepper. Mince the garlic. Skin bone and cut chicken into bite sized pieces. Cut the sausage into 1/2-inch slices and quarter each slice. Rinse clean and halve the shrimp.
In large frying pan brown bacon and steak in olive oil. Add a layer of each vegetable. Pour in beef broth. Cover and simmer until done. Makes its own gravy.
In an electric mixer (Cuisinart) beat butter cream cheese and salt until smooth. Work in flour with fingers or fork. Flatten dough in tinfoil to form an 8 x 6-inch rectangle and chill overnight.
Mix everything together in casserole heat in 350\u00b0 oven 35 minutes.

Brown hamburg drain. Add chopped onions and pepper. Saute for a few more minutes to cook onions and pepper. Add chili powder. Add can of tomatoes to heat for about 5 to 10 minutes. Add kidney beans last and heat stirring gently. Serve with cheese sprinkled on top and Doritos served on side of plate.

Blend all together and shape into a log. Mix another 8 ounces cream cheese softened with dry mustard salt pepper and onion powder to taste. Beat with electric blender until it looks like whipped cream. \Ice\ the log and refrigerate. Serve with crackers. Recipe will feed several.

Put oil in a big aluminum pot (approximately 2 quarts). Saute onions. Add okra salt and pepper. Smother okra down until it is slimy. Add the vinegar 1 tablespoon at a time. Vinegar will disappear as it cooks. Cook 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Saute meat and drain on paper towel. Combine all ingredients in large stewpot. Cook until okra turns color.

Stir sugar corn syrup and water over low heat until sugar is\tdissolved. Cook without stirring until a small amount of mixture dropped into cold water forms a hard ball or the candy thermometer reads\t260\u00b0. In mixing bowl beat egg whites until stiff peaks form. Continue beating while pouring hot syrup in a thin stream into egg whites. Add vanilla beat until mixture holds its shape and becomes slightly dull.\tFold in nuts. Drop mixture from tip of buttered spoon onto waxed paper. Four dozen is this recipe's yield.

Layer sliced potatoes onion and beef in baking dish. Season with salt and pepper and chili powder after each layer. Lightly stir in pork and beans. Pour tomato sauce over top. Cover and bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
Preheat oven to 425. Cut pork and veal into 1 inch cubes. Cut ham into 1/2 inch cubes. Set aside.
Combine mashed avocados with remaining ingredients. Yields 1 1/2 cups.

Sprinkle chicken pieces with salt and pepper. In large saucepan heat margarine and oil and saute chicken pieces turning often until all sides are lightly browned. Add onion and garlic and saute until transparent but not brown. Add ground cloves and cinnamon and stir. Then add wine tomatoes and tomato paste diluted in a little water. Mix well with chicken pieces. Add the 2 cups of water bring to boil reduce heat cover and simmer for 30 to 45 minutes or until chicken is tender. Stir occasionally during cooking. Taste for seasoning and serve with pasta or rice.
Remove fat from lean meat. Combine flour salt and pepper in a bag. Add meat and shake bag to coat. Fry in hot fat until brown. Add water cover and simmer 2 hours or until tender.
Partially melt chocolate over hot water. Remove from heat and beat until smooth. Stir in marshmallows and nuts. Spread in buttered 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan. Chill. When firm cut into squares.

Cover 2 cookie sheets with waxed paper set aside. Use a wooden spoon to mix brown sugar and milk in a 2-quart glass container. Stir well to make sure there are no lumps which tend to burn during microwaving. Add pecans. Microwave on High for 6 minutes stir. Then microwave on High 3 to 4 minutes or until the mixture reaches 240\u00b0 on a candy thermometer (the soft ball stage). To test drip some candy mixture into a cup of ice water. It should form a soft ball when pressed between the fingers. Use the wooden spoon to beat the mixture about 3 minutes or until it begins to thicken slightly. Quickly drop mixture by tablespoonfuls onto the prepared waxed paper making sure that each praline includes about 3 pecan halves. Let harden completely before pulling off paper. Store them in an airtight container. Yields 24 pralines 110 calories each.

Combine the first four ingredients. Set aside. Cook okra in boiling water 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Heat oil over medium heat and saute onion and pepper until tender. Stir in sugar mixture. Add okra and simmer until heated through stirring as little as possible. Serve with rice if desired.

Combine almonds oleo crumbs and extract mix well. Sprinkle 1/3 of crumbs over bottom of 8 1/2 x 11-inch pan that is lined with foil. Spoon half of ice cream over crumbs. Drizzle with preserves. Sprinkle with crumbs. Repeat layers. Store in freezer. Cut in squares and garnish with whipped cream if desired.
In a Dutch oven melt margarine. Add onions and green pepper saut until tender. Brown ground beef. Add tomato sauce chili powder pepper and rice. Cover. Simmer for 25 minutes.

Combine flour brown sugar melted butter and chopped nuts mix and spread in a 9 x 13-inch pan. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 minutes. Remove stir and return to oven to bake another 10 minutes. Remove half of the crumbs to be used for topping.

Put sugar water and butter in a saucepan. Without stirring cook until a little of the boiling syrup dropped in cold water makes a hard ball or is brittle. Flavor with 5 to 10 drops of oil of peppermint or to suit taste and pour out on a marble slab or platter. When cool pull until light. Make a long roll and cut into cubes with scissors or cut into finger length pieces. Fold 2 ends together and cut across the center. This will give a twisted effect and make the right size. When candy is cut put in a tightly closed tin box and leave for 8 to 10 hours to cream.

To de-stem peas decoratively pinch off stem end from each pod pulling strings down pod to remove. Make a \v-shaped\ cut at opposite end of pod. Heat wok or large skillet over high heat. Add sesame and vegetable oils swirling to coat sides. Heat oils about 30 seconds or until hot. Add onions ginger root peas and carrot briskly toss and stir keeping vegetables in constant motion for about 4 minutes or until peas are bright green and crisp-tender. Stir in soy sauce. Transfer to warm serving dish sprinkle with sesame seed. Serve immediately.

recipe_name: Next Best Thing To Robert Redford #1
directions: Mix butter flour and pecans until combined pat in oblong baking dish (9 x 13-inch or close). Bake for 15 minutes at 350\u00b0. Let cool. Mix with beater the cream cheese sugar and Cool Whip spread over cooled crust. Whip together the milk and pudding spread on cream cheese mixture. Spread small container of chocolate Cool Whip over pudding mixture. Refrigerate 2 hours then serve.
Cream margarine add sugar eggs and remaining ingredients. Butter a cookie pan and drop by small spoonfuls 1 1/2 inches apart. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 minutes. Makes about 6 dozen.
Add plenty of faith and mix well. Spread over a period of a lifetime and serve everybody you meet daily include self.

Measure words carefully. Add heaping cups of understanding. Use generous amounts of time and patience. Cook with gas on the front burner. Keep temperature low do not boil. Add dash of humor and a pinch of warm personality. Serve individually.
Put ice cream in blender. Add milk and grape juice. Liquify until smooth.

Sprinkle neck and body cavity of each chicken with monosodium glutamate and salt. Stuff with Walnut Stuffing. Hook wing tips onto back to hold neck skin. Tie legs together and then to tail. Place chickens in shallow roasting pan (it is unnecessary to use rack). Roast 1 1/2 hours at 375\u00b0. Brush with Cranberry-Orange Glaze. Roast 15 minutes longer. Yields 8 servings. Contains 350 calories per serving.

Melt margarine in a large skillet. Brown venison and drain. Cook egg noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. Saute onions and peppers in skillet. Add browned venison soup milk and mushrooms and mix well. Heat through. Remove from heat. Season to taste and stir in sour cream. Mix well. Serve over noodles.
Mix all ingredients. Beat with mixer 3 to 5 minutes. Will keep in refrigerator for several days. Keep covered when you aren't using.

In top of double boiler over hot water melt shortening add cocoa and stir until smooth. Set aside over warm water. In large saucepan combine sugar syrup and water cook over medium heat stirring until sugar dissolves. Lower heat slightly and cook uncovered without stirring to 260\u00b0 (hard-ball stage). Remove from heat. Immediately pour syrup in a thin stream into egg whites beating on high speed of electric mixer. Add vanilla beat until candy begins to hold its shape. Quickly blend in cocoa mixture nuts and cherries. Drop by teaspoons onto wax paper.
Mix all ingredients together and cook. Makes 6 round waffles. Can be frozen.

Grind the cranberries in food processor. Place in plastic or glass container with sugar or Equal. Stir well and refrigerate overnight or all day. Drain the pineapple and fold into cranberries. Add pecans. Fold all into the Cool Whip. Chill. Serve anytime of year or at your holiday get-togethers.

Let dough rise in a warm place until doubled. Punch down. Roll loaves together into one 15 x 12-inch rectangle. Layer ham and pepperoni on half of the dough (lengthwise). Sprinkle with onion and green pepper. Top with 1/4 cup of pizza sauce. Layer Mozzarella cappicola salami and Provolone over sauce. Sprinkle with basil oregano garlic powder and pepper. Spread another 1/4 cup of pizza sauce on top. Fold plain half of dough over filling and seal edges well. Place on a greased 15 x 10 x 1-inch baking pan. Bake at 375\u00b0 for 30 to 35 minutes or until golden brown. Brush with melted butter. Heat the remaining pizza sauce and serve with sliced stromboli.

Break up and cook sausage drain. Beat together eggs salt and mustard. Grease baking dish. Layer bread cheese and sausage. Cover with egg mixture. Refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.

Crush crackers add butter and sugar. Mix well and line a 1 x 13 x 2 1/2-inch pan reserving a small amount of crumbs for topping. Dissolve each package of Jell-O in hot water and in separate bowls or flat pans. Chill in pans until firm. Then cut into 1/2-inch squares. Soften plain gelatin in cold water add hot pineapple juice and cool. Whip cream and sugar and vanilla. Fold in cooled gelatin and pineapple mixture. Fold in Jell-O cubes pour into crumb-lined pan. Sprinkle on rest of crumbs chill 6 to 8 hours until very firm.
Melt chips over low heat add nuts and noodles and stir well. Drop teaspoons onto waxed paper.

In large bowl combine butterscotch chips and peanut butter. Microwave at 7 for 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 minutes or until melted stirring every 30 seconds. Add cornflakes and peanuts. Stir until coated. Drop by rounded teaspoonful onto wax paper. Chill until set.
Slice raw hot dogs down the middle. Place shredded Cheddar cheese inside. Wrap with raw bacon strips held with toothpicks. Cook under broiler until done.
Mix all ingredients one egg at a time. Fill buttered tins halfway. Bake 15 minutes on 400\u00b0 then lower heat to 350\u00b0 for 20 more minutes.

Brown sausage and hamburger. Drain then add salt pepper green pepper garlic salt and onion. Cook for 30 minutes. Roll out bread. Spread some sauce. Add a layer of ham sausage and hamburger mixture layer of olives layer of both cheeses layer of salami and layer of pepperoni. Add another layer of sauce then add a layer of ham. Close to make a loaf. Bake at 325\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes.
Spray a large skillet with Pam. Stir-fry on medium-high heat the first 3 ingredients. Stir vegetables and stir-fry 3 to 5 minutes. Remove vegetables from skillet and set aside.
Heat butter and oil. Saute onion and garlic until onion is soft. Add all ingredients. Warm in oven before serving (about 30 to 45 minutes). Especially good served with roast beef.
Mix ingredients and knead like dough. Add food coloring if desired. Store in airtight container.
Place juice and Marshmallow Creme in blender container. Cover process until well blended. Add yogurt process until smooth. Makes 6 (3/4-cup) servings.
Mix together. Mold into the shape of a candy bar. Freeze on tinfoil.
Boil and stir 10 minutes. Test for soft ball stage. Add vanilla and pecans. Remove from heat. Stir until thick.
Brown beef and pork together. Melt Velveeta in double boiler then mix with meat mixture. Put on party rye (can freeze at this point). When serving heat 15 to 20 minutes at 350\u00b0.

["Puree peaches and sugar, if using, in blender.", "Add half of the ice cubes and the margarita mix and blend until smooth. Continue to add ice cubes until desired thickness is reached.", "Add a dash of lime juice for a stronger margarita taste."]

["Heat oven to 350\u00b0", "Spread the pecans on a cookie sheet and toast in the oven until lightly browned, about 6-8 minutes. Cool", "Process pecans in a blender or food processor or finely chop with a knife. (not too fine)", "Beat the butter, salt, vanilla, almond extract and 1/2 cup of the powdered sugar until fluffy. (about 5 minutes)", "Add the pecans (by hand)", "Add the flour until incorporated (by hand)", "Roll the dough into balls the size of large marbles", "Place on a greased cookie sheet (or one lined with parchment) and bake for 15 minutes or until just starting to brown", "Remove from the cookie sheet to cool thoroughly, then roll in the remaining powdered sugar (twice)"]

["Cut off the crusts of the bread as close to the crust as possible.", "Figure out how you will need to cut some of the slices in order to make several layers in the pan, as close to the edges as possible.", "Spread the apple butter on the top of the bread for the first layer and set into the pan.", "Spread peanut butter on the bread for the second layer, set in the pan with the peanut butter side up.", "Spread apple butter on the bread for the next layer, turn these slices over so the peanut butter and apple butter are mingling ( just like making a regular sandwich) leaving the top \"plain\" for now.", "Depending on the size of the pan, continue until it reaches the top of the pan.", "I was able to get three layers from one small loaf of bread.", "Just make sure the top layer is plain for now.", "Put plastic wrap on top of the \"cake\" pressing it down onto the top.", "Using a couple of cans or jars, lay them on top, to weight it all down and help \"mingle\" the flavors.", "Put in the fridge for at least 1 hour, moving the cans / jars around every so often to distribute the weight evenly.", "After that, remove the cans / jars and the plastic wrap.", "Spread apple butter on the top layer, cover the pan with foil (it won't stick to the spread on top as much) and return to the fridge.", "Slice and serve when you are ready!"]

["Sift together the flour, baking powder, almond meal, and salt.", "Melt the chocolate and butter together in a stainless steel bowl over a pan of simmering water.", "In an electric mixer fitted with a whisk, whip together the eggs and sugar at high speed for 3 to 4 minutes, until they become fluffy.", "Add the melted chocolate mixture and mix until incorporated.", "Add the dry ingredients slowly (better to take your bowl off the mixer for this part so flour doesnt fly around your kitchen) and mix until incorporated.", "Stir in the coffee, vanilla, and rum.", "Transfer to a small bowl and refrigerate for about an hour.", "It will become firm.", "Preheat the oven to 350F.", "Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper.", "Put the granulated sugar in one bowl and the confectioners sugar in a second bowl.", "Using a sturdy spoon, scoop the chilled dough into 1-inch scoops and place them 1 inch apart on the prepared cookie sheet.", "Roll each individual cookie between your hands until it is a smooth ball, dip in the bowl of granulated sugar, then in the bowl of confectioners sugar, coating each one fully.", "Return them to the cookie sheet.", "Bake for about 10 minutes, or until the sugar cracks and the cookies just start to firm up.", "(They are especially delicious with a little softness in the center.)", "Allow them to cool on a rack, then store airtight."]

["Preheat oven to 300 degrees.", "As you toast the sesame seeds, pour in the vegetable oil and stir over low heat until fragrant, about 5 minutes; set aside to cool for a few minutes and fold in the sugar.", "Fold in the egg white and gently incorporate the flour, one tablespoon at a time into a creamy consistency.", "Put 1 teaspoon (walnut-size) onto parchment paper, 1 inch in between to prevent sticking; bake for 5~10 minutes, until brown and crisp.", "When cool enough to handle (~1 minute), carefully release the cookies and let it cool. Or press into palm with thumb and curl them a bit.", "Enjoy."]
["Beat cake mix, eggs, oil and pudding for 4 minutes, gradually adding the soda. Add nuts and cherries. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour in a well-greased tube pan."]

["Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F. Bring a small pot of water to a boil over high heat. Using a small, sharp knife, cut a small \"x\" into the skin at the bottom of each peach. Place the peaches in boiling water for 20 seconds. Pour into a colander and rinse under cool running water. Starting at the \"x,\" peel the skin from the peaches and discard. Slice the peaches and place in a small bowl, sprinkling with the 3 tablespoons sugar and set aside.", "In a medium bowl, combine the remaining 5 tablespoons sugar with the flour, Earth Balance, nutmeg, and almond extract. Using your fingers, rub the mixture together until incorporated and set aside.", "Dust a clean work surface with flour. Roll the pastry dough out into a circle about 13 inches across, trimming the edges so they are even. Transfer the dough to a sheet of parchment paper. Spread two-thirds of the sugar-flour mixture on the bottom of the crust, leaving a 2-inch border around the edge. Place two-thirds of the peaches over the flour mixture. Sprinkle the remaining flour mixture over the peaches. Add the remaining peaches on top. Fold the outer edge of the pastry dough in over the crostata to create a crust, pinching excess dough to secure.", "Leaving the crostata on the parchment paper, transfer to a baking sheet. Sprinkle the sliced almonds on top and bake until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbly, about 50 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on a wire rack for at least 10 minutes before serving. Serve hot, warm, or at room temperature."]

["* Use sweet cream butter and Don't substitute margarine.", "** Make the passion fruit pulp from fresh passion fruits or possibly substitute your favorite jam, or possibly it can be left plain.", "NOTE: Prebaked crusts are much crisper than the chilled ones and this can be important if you want a crisp crust.", "CRUST:If you are prebaking the shell, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Place the crumbs in a mixing bowl and add in the butter and sugar blending well.", "Press the crumb mix into the bottom and up the sides of an 8-inch springform pan.", "Smooth the mix to create an even layer on the bottom and sides.", "Bake the crust in the oven for 10 min and let cold to room temperature before filling.", "NOTE: This crust can be chilled for 5 - 10 min in the freezer till it is set but is not recommended in this recipe.", "CHEESECAKE:Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl, beat the cream cheese and sugar till light and fluffy.", "Add in the egg yolks, one at a time, beating well after each.", "Beat in the flour, lemon rind, lemon juice, and vanilla till just mixed.", "Whip the cream till stiff in a medium mixing bowl.", "Set aside.", "In another mixing bowl, beat the egg whites till they form stiff peaks, then fold them into the cheese mix.", "Mix in the reserved whipped cream.", "Stir in the passion fruit pulp then pour the mix into the prepared crust and bake fro 45 min to 1 hour.", "Cold, in the oven, to room temperature, then chill."]
["Mix and pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 35 minutes."]

["Mix chocolate chips, condensed milk and vanilla.", "Melt over low heat.", "Stir in pecans and them pour into a buttered 13x9 inch baking dish.", "Spread out and refrigerate until it becomes cool and firm.", "Then cut into small squares."]
["Spray Scrub Free over brass, rinse with warm water and towel dry.", "Work great for a quick touch up without the mess of brass cleaners!"]

["Remove meat from the lobster, and coarsely chop.", "Mix in scallions and season with salt and pepper.", "In a seperate bowl, mix wheat starch, tapioca starch and potato starch.", "Add boiling water, mix in a stand mixer.", "Add 1 tablespoon oil.", "Mix well, pinch small pieces of dough, flatten with cleaver, fill with lobster, fold and press edges to seal.", "This should make about 12 dumplings (3 per serving).", "Place in steamer basket and steam for 3 to 4 minutes.", "Sear tuna, slice about 12 sashimi slices, 3 pieces per serving, and season with truffle salt.", "Set aside.", "Mix all ingredients except caviar in blender, insert into foamer and shake to combine.", "Lay scallions across each plate.", "Place tuna and steamed dumplings next to each other.", "Top dumplings with osetra caviar, spray foam into ramekins for dipping.", "Serve.", "This recipe was provided by professional chefs and has been scaled down from a bulk recipe provided by a restaurant.", "The Food Network Kitchens chefs have not tested this recipe, in the proportions indicated, and therefore, we cannot make any representation as to the results."]

["Combine the cake flour and sugar, add and cream the margarine, then knead with your hands until the dough comes together.", "Divide the dough into 3 big pieces and 1 little piece (for the leaves).", "Add the coloring ingredients to each piece and knead the different colors of dough until the coloring is evenly distributed.", "Chill the dough in the freezer for about 5 minutes (it will be hard to form the dough if it is soft).", "Soot Sprites!", "Roll out the cocoa cookie dough into circles.", "Use plain cookie dough to make two small circles for the eyes.", "Little Totoro!", "Roll out the plain cookie dough into an egg shape.", "Create 2 small triangles for the ears and 2 small circles for the eyes, and assemble them to make a little Totoro.", "Large Totoro!", "Roll out the black sesame cookie dough into an egg shape and make 2 small triangles for the ears.", "Assemble them to make a large Totoro.", "Roll out the plain cookie dough into 2 circles for the eyes and an oval shape for the belly, and place them on the large Totoro's body.", "Place pairs of 2 grains of black sesame seeds together on the belly and push them in to make the pattern as shown in the picture (3 on top and 4 at the bottom).", "Place chocolate chips on the centers of the eyes of the Soot Sprites, Little Totoro, and Large Totoro.", "Make the green cookie dough into leaf shapes and place them on the heads of the Little Totoro and Large Totoro.", "Bake the dough in an oven preheated to 170C for 12-15 minutes and let cool.", "Adjust the baking time according to the oven manufacturer's recommendations.", "The plain dough was overdone at 15 minutes with my oven.", "Ponyo cookies", "Porco Rosso cookie", "Kodama cookie", "Jiji cookie"]

["Prepare tiramisu mix as directed on package.", "Layer on glass bowl.", "Keep in refrigerator for 15 min.", "Crush the oreos, put over tiramisu layer.", "Keep in refrigerator.", "Cover layer of oreos with whipped cream and finally sprinkle cocoa powder over cream layer.", "Keep in fridge for at least 2 hours before serving.", "Also can layer in individual desert bowls and refrigerate."]
["Mix until creamy and bake in 3 (9-inch) pans at 325\u00b0."]
Mix all ingredients well. Pour into a 17 x 10 x 1 inch pan that has been sprayed with Pam. Bake at 350\u00b0 until done.

["Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.", "Sift the all-purpose flour with the baking powder and salt.", "Add the Parmesan cheese, semolina and pepper.", "Place in a bowl, making a well in the center.", "Pour in the butter, egg yolks and milk and mix vigorously.", "Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold in.", "Spoon into a greased, round eight-inch cake pan and bake in the pre-heated oven for 30 to 35 minutes until firm and browned.", "Serve cut into four to six pieces as an hors d'oeuvre with drinks or as a bread with stews to mop up the sauce, or merely toasted."]

recipe_name: You'Ll Never Go Back To Store Bought' English Eccles Cakes
directions: ["Preheat the oven to 200C/425\u00b0F.", "Cut the pastry into rounds approx 4 inches in diameter.", "Cream the butter and sugar together, add the currants, lemon zest and spices.", "Add spoonfuls of the mixture to the centre of each pastry round.", "Gather the edges of each round to form a sealed ball, and with the smooth side uppermost, flatten onto a greased baking sheet.", "Cut 2 slits in the top of each cake with a sharp knife, brush with water (not milk or egg) and dust with caster sugar.", "Bake until golden brown for approx 20 minutes.", "Allow to cool for around 20 minutes before serving whilst still warm-ish or wait until completely cooled.", "To die for!"]

["Pour cereal into large bowl.", "Melt chocolate chips, peanut butter and margarine until smooth, stirring often.", "Remove from heat.", "Add vanilla.", "Pour mixture over cereals, stirring until all are evenly coated.", "Pour cereal mixture into Ziploc bag with powdered sugar; shake until well coated.", "Spread on cookie sheet to cool."]

["Preheat a two-sided electric griddle on medium-high to high for about 20 minutes, or preheat the oven to 300 degrees and preheat a cast-iron skillet on top of the stove for about 5 minutes.", "Prepare a bechamel sauce: in a small saucepan over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon butter.", "When bubbles have subsided, add flour and whisk vigorously for 1 minute.", "Slowly whisk in milk until smooth.", "Bring to a boil, and cook until thick.", "Remove from heat, and season to taste with salt and nutmeg.", "Spread two slices of bread generously with sauce.", "Lay two slices of ham on top of each, and top each with a slice of cheese; ham and cheese should slightly overlap edges of bread.", "Top each with a slice of bread.", "In a small saucepan, melt remaining the 4 tablespoons butter.", "Brush the sandwiches on both sides with butter, making sure that the edges are well covered.", "If you're using a griddle, place cheese side down, close the griddle and cook until the bread is toasted dark and cheese is leaking out and bubbling.", "If you're using a skillet, place sandwiches cheese side down and cook on stove top until well browned, then turn and brown again.", "Transfer skillet to oven, and bake until heated through and cheese is bubbling.", "Meanwhile, fry the eggs in a skillet with little butter.", "Slide one fried egg onto each sandwich.", "Serve hot."]

["Place leaves vein side up on a cutting board. Trim the stem from the leaf. I found kitchen shears to be the best tool for this job.", "Bring 1 quart water and salt to a boil. Blanch the leaves for 30 seconds. Remove leaves from pot with tongs or a slotted spoon taking care not to rip them. Allow to cool in a bowl.", "Bring 1 1/2 cup water and lemon juice to a boil. Stack leaves in piles of 5 and roll up from side to side. Place rolls upright in a sterile wide-mouth pint mason jar. Fold over tops to allow 1/2 headspace. Pour hot water/lemon juice mixture over the leaves leaving a 1/2 inch head space. Wipe rim of jar with a clean towel. Top with a lid and screw down lid. Process for 15 minutes in a boiling water bath or keep in the refrigerator."]

["Mix the cocoa powder into the water or juice. Place all the dry ingredients in a large bowl including the nuts, add orange zest. Make a well in the center and add the eggs and the water cocoa mixture. Slightly beat the liquid in the center well and begin to bring in the dry ingredients. Gradually add vegetable oil to form the dough. You may need to wet your hands with oil. The dough will be thick and will have an oily glaze. Place the dough in the refrigerator for 1 hour.", "Place the dough on a lightly floured surface. Cut small portions and roll out the dough in the form of a cylinder. Pat down the top and cut into 1\" slices on a diagonal to form a diamond shape. Place the cookies on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper."]

["In a microwave-safe bowl, melt the semisweet chocolate; stir until smooth. Stir in corn syrup just until mixture is well blended, forms a ball and is no longer shiny. Turn onto an 8-in. square of waxed paper. Press chocolate mixture into a 7-in. square. Let mixture stand at room temperature until dry to the touch, about 2 hours.", "Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Grease and flour three 8-in. round baking pans. Let separated eggs stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. In a microwave-safe bowl, microwave white chocolate with water at 30% power until chocolate is melted; cool to room temperature.", "In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg yolks, vanilla and white chocolate mixture. Combine flour and baking soda; add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk. In a small bowl, beat egg whites on high speed until stiff peaks form. Fold into white chocolate mixture with coconut and pecans.", "Transfer batter to prepared pans. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.", "For frosting, in a large bowl, beat cream cheese and butter. Add the confectioners' sugar, milk and vanilla. Set aside 1/2 cup for decorating.", "Roll out semisweet chocolate mixture on waxed paper to 1/8-in. thickness. Using a sharp knife and pre-cut templates, if desired, cut out two ears, two ovals and two small circles for eyes, a muzzle, a thin strip for muzzle detail, a small heart-shaped nose, a curved strip for the dog collar and a small U-shaped hook; set aside.", "Flatten gumdrops with a rolling pin over a small amount of sugar. Cut one into a heart-shaped dog tag and the other into the shape of a tongue.", "Add candy detail to collar using the reserved frosting for decorating.", "To assemble, place the bottom cake layer on a large platter. Spread with 1/2 cup frosting. Add the middle cake layer; spread with an additional 1/2 cup frosting. Top with remaining cake layer; frost top and sides with remaining frosting.", "Position ears, eyes, M&M pupils, muzzle and nose onto cake, using reserved frosting, if necessary. Add frosting wrinkles and whisker spots. Place collar directly onto platter, below the cake.", ":", "For cat: Follow directions above using templates resembling cat features."]
["Mix well and refrigerate."]

["Preheat oven to 350F.", "Mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.", "Beat butter in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until creamy.", "Add flour mixture, milk and vanilla.", "Beat 1 min.", "on low speed until well blended.", "Beat 2 min.", "on medium speed, scraping bowl occasionally.", "Add egg; beat 1 min.", "longer.", "Stir in 2/3 cup of the coconut.", "Pour into greased and floured 8-inch layer pan.", "Bake 40 min.", "or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.", "Cool in pan 10 min.", "; remove from pan.", "Cool completely on wire rack.", "Split cake horizontally, making 2 layers.", "Reserve 1 Tbsp.", "each jam and remaining coconut for garnish, if desired.", "Mix remaining jam and coconut; spread between cake layers.", "Frost with whipped topping.", "Garnish top with reserved jam and coconut.", "Store leftover cake in refrigerator."]

["Mix; bring to boil.", "Turn to low temperature and cook for about 15 minutes (hard ball stage).", "Remove from heat and add vanilla flavoring, butter and chopped pecans.", "Beat until stiff.", "Pour into buttered dish."]

["SAUTE ONION IN OLIVE OIL until softened.", "Add garlic and saute another 2 minutes.", "Add tomatoes, 1/2 teaspoon herbes de Provence.", "Cover and simmer 10 minutes.", "Uncover and simmer 10 minutes more.", "Remove from heat and add the eggs beaten with anchovies, oil, tomato paste, parsley, paprika and cayenne.", "Pour into prepared shell and top with olives, grated cheese and little oil."]
["Chill bowl and beaters.", "Whip all ingredients together.", "Makes about 2 cups."]

["Peel the peaches and slice them. Put in glass bowl and sprinkle them with sugar. Toss and let stand for 20 minutes or until juicy.", "Prepare pudding by putting the mixes in a bowl and adding the 3 cups of milk. Beat on low speed for about 2 minutes or until it starts to thicken slightly.", "The goal is to repeat the layers twice in order to get a great looking trifle. If I haven't said this already, this works best with a trifle bowl, but if you want to use a 3 quart clear punch, salad, or mixing bowl, that would be fine too.", "Place 1/2 of the cubed angel cake in the bottom of the trifle bowl. Pour a little of the liquor over the layer of cake. Then layer on half of the vanilla pudding spreading to make a nice layer. Then put in half of the peach slices (we don't use all the juice). Then layer on half of the Cool Whip. Be sure to use a spatula to even out each layer. Repeat the process again adding the rest of the cake, then pudding, then peaches, then Cool Whip. Cover the trifle and chill in the refrigerator for at least 8 hours.", "OPTIONAL: Sprinkle the top with slivered almonds just prior to serving. You can also arrange extra peach slices on top to make it extra pretty."]

["In saucepan, combine chocolate pieces, cream cheese and evaporated milk. Stir over low heat until smooth. Stir in nuts. Preheat oven to 375\u00b0.", "In a large bowl, cream the sugar and margarine until light and fluffy. Blend in eggs and vanilla. Add flour, baking powder and salt.", "Mix well.", "Press half of flour mixture onto bottom of a 12 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan. Spread chocolate mixture over crust.", "Sprinkle with remaining crust mixture."]

Mix dry ingredients add liquids and mix until smooth. Add 1 can poppy seed and nuts beat on medium for 2 minutes. Bake in loaf or sponge pan at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until tested done. Do not overbake.
Heat milk on medium in pot. Cut cheese into small pieces. Stir until melts. Add Parmesan cheese and salt. Add hot and drained macaroni to sauce. Makes 4 servings.
["Mix all ingredients together.", "Do not drain pineapple.", "Pour into greased and floured 9 x 13-inch glass pan.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 minutes."]
["Preheat oven 350Fahrenheit", "Put yams into pan", "Salt them add sugar marshmallows and pecans", "Bake 40 minutes", "Hope you enjoy"]

Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0. Scrub the yams and bake 1 to 1 1/2 hours depending on size until they are soft. Remove them from the oven. Peel cut into chunks and puree in blender or food processor. You should have 1 1/2 cups set aside to cool.

recipe_name: Polish Style Cheesecake Of My Childhood
directions: ["Preheat oven to 350\u00b0F.", "Pan sizes: 9x13 or 11x17-inches, depending on how high you want the cake. (I use 2 disposable foil pans, one inside the other. To remove from the pan after baking, I loosen the sides then cut the pan and peel it away).", "OR you can line the foil pans with foil [;), and lift it out to cut.", "COOKIE DOUGH:", "Mix flour, baking powder, 1/2 cup sugar, and margarine.", "Work as for pie dough.", "Then add beaten eggs and milk.", "Pat in pan which has been greased on bottom and sides.", "Cover dough with pineapple.", "CHEESECAKE FILLING:", "Cream the cheese with the sugar until very smooth.", "Add lemon juice, salt and potato starch.", "Add eggs yolks and beat slightly.", "Beat heavy cream until soft peaks form.", "Fold into the cheese mixture.", "Beat egg whites until soft peaks form and fold into cheese mixture.", "Pour cheese over pineapple.", "TO BAKE:", "Bake for about one hour.", "Test with knife in center to see if done."]

In a medium mixing bowl add 1/2 amount of cheese to egg salt flour milk and pepper. Mix and pour into well greased 8-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and meat. Bake at 425\u00b0 for 30 minutes.

["Mix together the cake mix, butter,1 egg,coconut and pecans.", "Spread evenly in a square pan (8x8).", "Then mix well the box of sugar, creamcheese and 2 eggs.", "Pour on top of the other ingredients.", "Then bake at 325 degrees for 45 minutes."]

["In a large bowl, combine the brown sugar and flour in a bowl; add the butter and blend with your fingertips or a fork until mixed and crumbly.", "Add the walnuts and stir to blend.", "Sprinkle the topping evenly over the surface of baked cakes of your choice."]

["Mix flour, nuts and margarine and pat into the bottom of a 9 x 13 pan.", "Bake crust at 350\u00b0F for 10-15 minutes.", "Beat cream cheese, confectioners sugar and 1/2 the tub of whipped topping and spread over crust.", "Mix milk and pudding mixes and spread over the cream cheese mixture.", "Top with remaining whipped topping.", "Serve cold."]

["Cream butter and sugar until very fluffy.", "Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.", "Sift flour, salt and baking powder three times.", "Add flour and milk alternately to creamed mixture, beating well.", "Add extracts.", "Divide evenly into three greased and floured 9-inch pans.", "Bake at 325\u00b0 (preheat oven) for about 25 to 30 minutes.", "Cool in pans for 5 to 10 minutes.", "Remove from pans and cool on cake rack."]
Melt oleo for 45 seconds. Stir in eggs and sugar. Microwave 6 minutes. Stir in pineapple set aside.

["Sift the flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl.", "Add the milk and eggs and mix with an electric mixer on low speed until well blended and smooth.", "Mix in the oil (batter can be kept in a tightly covered container and kept for up to 1 week).", "Heat a greased griddle over med-high heat.", "Using 1/4 cup of batter for each pancake, spoon the batter onto the griddle.", "Cook the pancakes on the first side until bubbles form in the center and they are browned on the bottom.", "Turn and brown the other side.", "Serve hot with warm maple syrup."]

["Preheat oven to 350 degrees.", "Grease large baking sheet.", "Remove stems from drained cherries.", "Make a small slit in whole cherries and pat dry with a paper towel.", "This is to stop the red juice from the cherries running into the buttery color of the biscotti.", "Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in bowl.", "Cut in butter with pastry blender until coarse crumbs form.", "Stir in eggs and extract until well blended If mixture is crumbly dry, add milk.", "Stir in cherries.", "Divide mixture in half.", "On lightly floured surface, press dough together and shape into two 10-inch-logs.", "Place logs on prepared baking sheet.", "Flatten to 2-1/2-inch width.", "Bake in 325-degree oven for 30 to 35 minutes.", "Using a couple of spatulas, transfer logs to rack to cool for 20 minutes.", "With serrated knife, cut each log diagonally into 3/4-inch-thick slices.", "Return to baking sheet.", "Bake 10 minutes or until cookies are crisp and firm to touch.
