["Melt caramels and 1/3 cup of milk. Set aside.", "Mix dry cake mix, pecans, 1/3 cup milk and margarine.", "Pat 1/2 cake mixture into greased 9 x 13-inch pan and bake at 350\u00b0 for 6 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle chocolate chips on top.", "Pour caramel mixture over chips.", "Crumble remaining cake mixture on top.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes."]

["Add onion soup mix to melted butter and stir.", "Pour mixture over pretzels and stir and mix until pretzels are coated.", "Place in two 8 1/2 x 13-inch cake pans (these fit side by side in my oven) with oven rack in middle of oven.", "Bake for 1 hour at 225\u00b0; stir every 15 minutes."]

["Pre-heat oven to 350 degrees F.", "Combine first four ingredients into a blender.", "Pour into Grahm Cracker Crust.", "Bake for 20 minutes, or until set.", "Refrigerate for 1 hour.", "Combine fruit and sugar in blender just before serving.", "Pour over pie.", "Enjoy!", ":)."]

["Crepe: Mix all ingredients together.", "To a hot skillet add 1 tsp.", "of oil, pour 1/4 cup batter spreading it evenly on the whole bottom of the skillet.", "Fry lightly on both sides.", "Flip them over on a pile in a dish.", "Filling: Beat eggs well and melt margarine.", "Add to cheese filling.", "Spread the filling in an even layer over the crepe and roll, cut in the middle and place in baking dish with the cut ends against the side of the pan.", "At this point you can cover the nalysnky and freeze for later or proceed to baking.", "When you decide to bake the nalysnky, pour heavy or whipping cream over the top, cover and bake for 20 - 25 minutes at 300\u00b0 Fahrenheit.", "Watch that they do not get scorched."]
["Mix milk and pudding in blender.", "Fill pie shell with pudding.", "Let set up in fridge 10 minutes.", "Top with pie filling.", "Makes 8 servings.", "Very easy your kids could make it."]

["Thoroughly wash the potatoes and peel them.", "After peeling cut of the round edges from the top and bottom of the potatoes to get even cut fries.", "Make sure all the fries are of the same thickness to enable even cooking.", "Place the cut fries in cold water for 2 or 3 minutes and then pat them dry with a kitchen towel.", "Heat oil in a wok and fry the fries in it for 6 to 7 minutes, turning them around in between so they cook on all sides.", "Take out the fries on a kitchen towel to soak excess oil and sprinkle in the salt and pepper/chilli flakes and toss the fries to coat them.", "Enjoy with your favourite sauce or dip."]
Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Saute onion and garlic in hot oil. Add meat. Cook until browned. Blend tomatoes taco seasoning and chilies. Simmer 10 minutes. Drain fat.

["Beat the cake mix briefly with the egg and butter, until just blended. Press into a 9x13 inch pan lightly coated with vegetable oil spray. Sprinkle the nuts and chocolate chips on to and lightly press into first layer. Beat together the confectioners sugar, eggs and cream cheese. Spoon over top, spreading mixture evenly to edges. Bake 1 hour to 1 hours, 15 minutes at 350\u00b0 or until top is puffed and lightly browned. Cool and cut into bars. Makes 30 bars."]
["Mix flour with sugar; add butter, beaten eggs and coconut, then add milk.", "Pour into unbaked pie shell.", "Bake at 375\u00b0 for 30 minutes."]

["Mix peanut butter, powdered sugar and oleo together.", "Roll into balls and refrigerate for one hour.", "Melt 2/3 bar paraffin wax with the chocolate chips.", "Dip cookies in chocolate with spoon and set to dry on wax paper."]
Mix all together except the crackers. Put crackers in a bowl and coat with the mixture. Bake 15 to 20 minutes at 250\u00b0.

Brown hamburger and onion. Set aside. Bring to a boil the salt pepper sugar garlic powder tomato sauce tomato paste and mushrooms. Simmer 15 minutes set aside. Soften cream cheese and sour cream together. Set aside. Cook noodles. Put 1 cup of the tomato sauce mixture and 1 cup hamburger on the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan. Add 1/2 cream cheese mixture then 1/2 noodles on top of that and 1/2 of the cheese then repeat the layers. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 20 minutes or if baking cold bake for 40 minutes.

["Combine sugar, cornstarch, and salt in a medium saucepan; stir mixture to remove lumps.", "Stir grenadine syrup into sugar mixture.", "Cook over medium heat until smooth, stirring constantly.", "Add cherries; simmer until liquid is thickened and transparent (about 4 minutes), stirring gently once or twice.", "Add almond extract and butter, stirring until butter melts; cool.", "Roll out half of pastry to 18 inch thickness on a lightly floured surface.", "Place in a 9-inch deep-dish pieplate; trim off excess pastry along edges.", "Pour cooled cherry mixture into pastry shell.", "Roll remaining pastry to 18 inch thickness; transfer to top of pie.", "Trim off excess pastry along edges.", "Fold edges under and flute.", "Cut slits in top crust for steam to escape.", "Brush top of pastry shell lightly with milk.", "Bake at 400F (200C) for 55 minutes or until golden brown.", "NOTE: Two pounds fresh cherries, pitted, may be substituted for 2 (16-ounce) packages frozen cherries; use 1/4 cup cornstarch instead of 3 tablespoons."]

["Put one slice of cheese over one slice of bread, making sure to cover it completely.", "Spread the pepper rings on top evenly.", "Sprinkle the cilantro over that.", "Now cover with the second slice of cheese and then the second slice of bread and press down.", "Brush a small, heavy frying pan with half the butter or oil and set on medium-high heat.", "When hot, put down the sandwich, pressing down on it.", "Cook until golden brown, still pressing down with a spatula.", "Then brush the top of the sandwich with the remaining butter or oil, flip the sandwich over, and brown the second side, pressing down again.", "Cut it in half, if you like, and serve immediately."]

["Combine sugar, margarine, and eggs.", "Combine soda, buttermilk, and all flavorings.", "After sugar, eggs, and margarine are blended, add buttermilk mixture (1/3 of it at a time) with 1 cup flour at a time, blending well.", "Start in a cold oven with a pan of water underneath.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 in a buttered and floured Bundt cake pan, for about 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until done.", "Using toothpick for testing.", "Remove from pan as soon as you remove from oven."]

["Cook noodles according to directions. In large skillet, brown beef and onion over medium heat, then drain. Add spaghetti sauce, mushrooms and Italian seasoning. Drain noodles. In a 5-quart crock-pot, spread a third of the meat sauce. Cover with a third of the noodles and pepperoni. Sprinkle with a third of the cheeses. Repeat layers twice. Cover and cook on low for 3 to 4 hours or until heated through and cheese is melted. Yield 6 to 8 servings."]

["Combine crumbs, sugar and cinnamon; blend in butter.", "Set 1/4 cup aside.", "Press remainder onto bottom and sides of 9 inch pie plate.", "Bake in 375 degree F oven for 8 minutes; cool.", "FILLING: In saucepan, mix sugar with cornstarch; blend in milk.", "Cook over medium heat, stirring, until boiling; stir a little into yolks, then retUrn to the saucepan.", "Cook over low heat, stirring, for 2 minutes or until thickened.", "Remove from heat; add vanilla and cool slightly.", "Pour into pie crust.", "MERINGUE: Beat egg whites with cream of tartar until soft peaks form; gradually beat in sugar until stiff peaks form.", "Spread over filling, sealing to crust.", "Top with reserved crumbs.", "Bake in 400 degree F oven for 5 minutes or until lightly browned.", "Cool to room temperature, about 4 hours."]

["Place all the dough ingredients in bread machine pan and select dough cycle.", "Add more flour or water, if necessary, to form a soft, smooth dough.", "( If you are using a stand mixer, knead it for 7 to 10 minutes and let it rest for 1 hour before shaping the rolls.", ").", "When cycle is finished, turn dough in a floured surface and cut it in 12 pieces.", "I usually cut the dough in 3 pieces and divide them in half, then, each piece in half again.", "Shape into balls.", "Place them in a greased 13X9 inch pan.", "In a small bowl, combine melted butter, garlic powder and dash of salt.", "Brush the rolls with the mixture and sprinkle them with parmesan cheese.", "Turn on the oven for 1 minute, turn it off and put the pan ( uncovered ) inside of the warm oven.", "Let the rolls rise for 2 to 2 1/2 hours.", "Set the oven at 350 degrees F and bake the rolls for 20 minutes or until light golden brown.", "Serve warm."]

["Line a baking sheet with foil.", "Toast bread slices in a toaster.", "Place toast slices onto foil lined pan and top with 1 slice each ham, then a pineapple ring, then top with a slice of cheese.", "Pop under the broiler briefly, just until the cheese melts- watch carefully- don't let the cheese burn.", "This only takes a few minutes, depending upon your broiler, and will vary depending upon the type of cheese you use.", "Remove toast from oven- the cheese should have melted around the pineapple ring, leaving a well to place the cherries.", "Serve immediately.", "NOTE: Some folks spread their toast with a little mayo, Miracle Whip, or butter before topping with the ham- by all means do so if you wish."]

["Sift dry ingredients and set aside.", "Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs, one at a", "time, until light and creamy.", "Fold in flavors and milk. Then fold in the dry ingredients (flour, salt and baking powder).", "Fold in cut up cherries and nuts.", "Bake in a thick jelly roll pan (greased and floured), 15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes.", "Cut in 3 long lines and then in pieces 1-inch across.", "Lay each piece in pan again and toast in oven until light tan."]

["Cream oleo, Crisco and sugar until fluffy.", "Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.", "Sift flour, baking powder and salt together.", "Add alternately with milk to cream mixture.", "Add flavoring.", "Pour into greased and floured loaf pan or tube pan. Bake at 325\u00b0 for 1 1/2 hours."]

["In large mixing bowl, combine 1 1/2 cups flour, yeast, sugar and seasonings.", "Mix well.", "In saucepan, heat milk, water and 2 tablespoons butter until warm (butter does not need to melt).", "Add heated liquids to flour mixture.", "Add egg.", "Blend with mixer at low speed until moistened; beat three minutes at medium speed.", "By hand, gradually stir in 1/2 cup cheese and enough remaining flour to make a firm dough.", "Knead on well floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 3 to 5 minutes.", "Place in greased bowl, turning to grease top."]

recipe_name: Pie Crust And Butterscotch Pie Recipe
directions: ["Work flour, salt and baking pwdr into Crisco till pea-sized then work in egg, water and vinegar."]

["Place half the ingredients in blender in the order given.", "Mix with first half in blender. Add rest. Blend well.", "Pour into a 9-inch pan sprayed with Pam.", "Makes its own crust.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 40 minutes."]

["Cream the butter and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time. Beat well after each egg. Stir in sour cream. Blend well. Combine soda and flour together. Add flour to the sour cream mixture. Beat at lowest speed until well mixed.", "Beat in vanilla. Smooth batter into greased and floured loaf pan. Bake at 325\u00b0 for 1 hour and 30 minutes.", "Remove from oven and let stand in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan.", "Makes 24 servings."]
["Mix these ingredients well.", "Pour into unbaked pie shell. Cook 35 to 40 minutes at 325\u00b0."]

["HEAT oven to 350\u00b0 F. Line cookie sheets with parchment paper.", "BEAT cake mix, eggs, water and oil in medium bowl with an electric mixer on medium speed for 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.", "DROP batter onto prepared cookie sheets, preferably using a medium scoop (2 tablespoons). Spread batter into 2 1/4-inch diameter circles, 2 inches between pies. Bake 7 to 9 minutes or until center is set. Cool 1 minute on cookie sheet. Cool completely on cooling rack.", "BEAT cream cheese in small bowl until light and fluffy with electric mixer on medium speed. Add frosting, mixing until blended. Place half of pies flat side up. Spread with 2 tablespoons filling in center of each. Top with remaining pies, rounded side up. Press gently to spread filling. Chill until ready to serve.", "TIP Whoopie pies may be wrapped individually in plastic wrap and stored in the refrigerator for several days."]
Grind in blender the Cheddar cheese and olives. Mix with remaining ingredients. Mold in a ball and roll in chopped pecans. May add a cherry to top and parsley leaves for decoration.

["Cream sugar and butter together.", "Drop in eggs and mix.", "Sift together salt, flour, cream of tartar and baking soda.", "Add to first mixture and beat until smooth.", "Make a small ball and flatten with fork.", "Place on greased cookie sheet, sprinkle with cinnamon and sugar mixture.", "Bake at 325\u00b0 for 12 to 15 minutes."]

["In a 12x7 inch baking dish combine potato slices and onion.", "Add 1/4 cup water.", "Bake, covered, at 350 till nearly tender, about 45 minutes.", "Meanwhile, in a skillet brown pork chops on both sides in hot oil.", "In bowl combine sauerkraut, undrained pineapple, and brown sugar; spoon over potato mixture.", "Place chops atop.", "Season with salt and pepper.", "Bake, covered, 45 minutes longer."]
["Crust:", "Mix oleo, flour, 3 tablespoons confectioners sugar and 1/2 cup pecans.", "Line bottom of 9 x 12-inch pan and bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 to 20 minutes until light brown."]

["Heat water, butter, sugar and salt to boiling point, then add flour.", "Stir vigorously and cook until batter leaves side of pan and follows spoon.", "Remove from stove.", "While still hot, add eggs one at a time and beat well after each egg, then drop from teaspoon onto greased baking sheet 2 inches apart.", "When cold, cut with sharp knife and fill with cream filling.", "Bake 50 minutes (at 425\u00b0 for first 15 minutes, then at 350\u00b0 for 35 to 40 minutes longer). Serves 18."]

recipe_name: Almond Butter Cake With Crunchy Almond Topping
directions: ["Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9-inch cake pan.", "In a large bowl, stir together sugar and butter until blended. Stir in eggs, one at a time, mixing well. Stir in almond extract, vanilla, and salt. Stir in flour until it is mixed in well.", "Pour the batter into cake pan. Smooth the top. Sprinkle sugar over the top. Sprinkle with almonds.", "Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until top is golden. Using a toothpick won't work with this cake!", "Cut into wedges and serve warm, chilled, or at room temperature."]
["Fry hamburger; then add mushroom soup, onion and taco seasoning.", "Layer tortillas, then sauce.", "Repeat layers.", "Add cheese 5 minutes before done.", "Cook at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes."]

["Cook bacon in large skillet until crisp.", "Remove bacon; reserve 2 tablespoons of drippings in skillet.", "Crumble bacon; set aside.", "Saute onion in drippings until tender.", "Add remaining ingredients, stirring well.", "Spoon mixture into a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish or pan.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 minutes.", "Garnish with bacon.", "Makes 6 servings."]

["Blend together butter and sugar.", "Add eggs, one at a time, beat well.", "Mix in milk, vanilla and coconut.", "Pour into unbaked 8-inch pie shell.", "Bake at 325\u00b0 for 45 minutes, or until delicately brown."]

["Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (175 degrees C).", "In a large bowl, mix together rhubarb, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries and sliced apples. In a separate bowl, combine the sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and nutmeg together and blend with the fruit.", "Pour fruit mixture into a 9x13 inch glass baking dish.", "For the topping: In a large bowl, mix the oatmeal, flour, brown sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon together. Add the butter in little pats and cut into the flour mixture until it looks crumbly, (no big chunks). Sprinkle over the fruit.", "Bake at 400 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 to 35 minutes, or until topping is brown."]

["Prick bottom of pie shells.", "Combine cheese and flour.", "Add eggs, milk, ham, pimento and seasoning.", "Mix well.", "Pour into shells.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 50 to 60 minutes or until knife put in middle comes out clean."]
["Heat olive oil and butter in a 12 inch skillet over medium heat, add onions and cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally."]
["Bake cake according to directions in a 13 x 9 x 2 pan. Mix pie filling and almond flavoring together. While cake is still warm, poke top with fork and spread pie filling over cake."]

["Spray 9\" pie plate with non-stick cooking spray.", "In large bowl combine eggs, onion, thyme, salt and pepper and beat well.", "Stir in potatoes, cheese, ham and green pepper.", "Pour into pie plate and bake 40 to 45 minutes in preheated 350 degree oven (or until set).", "Garnish with sliced tomato slices and serve."]

["Mix together and press to the bottom of a 9 inch spring-form pan. Chill while preparing the filling.", "Cheesecake: Preheat oven to 350F. Combine the cottage cheese, eggs, sugar, lemon zest, lemon juice, vanilla extract, and salt in a food processor and combine until smooth and creamy, scraping down sides once. Bake for 50 minutes or until filling is slightly puffed. Cool for 5 minutes.", "Sour Cream Topping: Whisk the sour cream, sugar, and vanilla until smooth in a small bowl and spread carefully over the hot filling. Bake for 5 minutes longer. Cool and chill."]

["Preheat your oven to 350 degrees F.", "In a large mixing bowl, combine the cookie ingredients.", "Roll dough into 1 1/2 inch balls (ping pong ball-size) and place on a greased or parchment-lined cookie sheet. Make sure you have an even number of cookies. Smash the balls down just a bit.", "Bake for about 7-8 minutes. Take them out of the oven when the tops have cracked a little.", "Let them sit on the hot cookie sheet for 2 minutes. Transfer cookies to a wire rack to finish cooling.", "Make the filling: With a mixer, cream the butter and cream cheese. Add the vanilla. Gradually add the powdered sugar and mix until smooth.", "Frost the underside of a cookie and place another cookie on top.", "Wrap individually in plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator."]
["Blend together margarine, sugar and eggs.", "Cook over low heat until eggs are set.", "Blend in the crumbs, marshmallows, coconut and pecans.", "Press into a buttered 8 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish."]

["Finely chop onion.", "Combine cornmeal mix and onion in bowl. Add 1 egg (beaten) and milk stirring to combine.", "Add garlic to taste.", "Let set for 2 or 3 minutes to thicken.", "Drop by teaspoon into hot fat (375\u00b0) frying only a few at a time.", "Fry until golden brown.", "Drain on absorbent paper."]

["FOR THE FILLING:", "1. Adjust oven rack to lowest position, place baking sheet on oven rack, and heat oven to 400 degrees. Process plums and 1 cup halved cherries in food processor until smooth, about 1 minute, scraping down sides of bowl as necessary. Strain puree through fine-mesh strainer into large bowl, pressing on solids to extract liquid; discard solids. Stir remaining halved cherries, sugar, salt, lemon juice, bourbon (if using), tapioca, and cinnamon (if using) into puree; let stand for 15 minutes.", "", "2. Transfer cherry mixture, including all juices, to dough-lined plate. Scatter butter pieces over fruit. Roll second disk of dough on generously floured work surface (up to A1/4 cup) to 11-inch circle about 1/8 inch thick. Roll dough loosely around rolling pin and unroll over pie, leaving at least A1/2-inch overhang. Flute edges using thumb and forefinger or press with tines of fork to seal. Brush top and edges with egg mixture. With sharp knife, make 8 evenly spaced 1-inch-long vents in top crust. Freeze pie 20 minutes.", "", "3. Place pie on preheated baking sheet and bake 30 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees and continue to bake until juices bubble around the edges and crust is deep golden brown, 30 to 40 minutes longer.", "", "4. Transfer pie to wire rack; let cool to room temperature so juices have time to thicken, 2 to 3 hours. Cut into wedges and serve."]

["Line 13 x 9 x 2 inch baking pan with foil.", "Place butter in pan and melt.", "Combine next 4 ingredients, spread over butter.", "Blend cream cheese and egg.", "Gradually add frosting mix, stirring well. Spread over mixture in pan.", "Slice cookie dough into 1/4-inch slices and arrange over cheese mixture.", "Bake at 350 degrees for 35 - 40 minutes, or until cookies are light brown.", "Invert immediately in cookie sheet.", "Cool.", "Chill thoroughly before cutting. Refrigerate leftovers."]
["Combine all together.", "Pour in unbaked pie shell.", "Bake at 350\u00b0.", "Later cover with egg whites."]

Dissolve yeast in warm water. Combine in a bowl flour salt baking powder soda and sugar. Cut in shortening buttermilk and yeast water to dry ingredients. Mix well. Store in half gallon container in refrigerator. Use as needed for hot rolls. Bake at 400\u00b0.

["In a large saucepan, bring the dashi and water to a simmer. Add the grated ginger, sliced shiitake, edamame, tofu and water chestnuts and simmer over moderate heat for 5 minutes. Add the spinach, soy sauce, mirin and lemon juice and stir just until the spinach is wilted. Serve in bowls with the scallion and bonito."]

["Measure peanut butter and corn syrup into mixing bowl.", "Mix until thoroughly combined.", "Add Rice Krispies cereal; stir until well coated.", "With back of tablespoon, press mixture evenly and firmly in bottom and around side of lightly buttered 9-inch pie pan to form crust.", "Chill until firm.", "Spread ice cream evenly in chilled crust.", "Freeze until firm.", "Cut into wedges to serve. Garnish with peach slices or other fresh fruit, if desired."]
["Mix everything together; pour into graham cracker pie crusts. Sprinkle with nuts.", "Chill for 1 hour before serving."]

["See Note#1 at bottom of page.", "Preheat oven to 350F.", "There are 3 steps you must do in order: Step 1: Mix in a bowl, 1 large container of Cool-Whip, 1 cup powdered sugar, 2 8-ounce Philly cream cheese.", "With a mixer, beat sugar and cream cheese until well blended.", "Add cool-whip and blend lightly until all is mixed.", "Spread this on the crust.", "Place in the refrigerator.", "Step 2: In a bowl mix large box of instant chocolate pudding and 3 cups milk.", "Mix until it starts to thicken, then pour over step 1 without disturbing that layer.", "Refrigerate for 10 minutes.", "Step 3: In a bowl, mix large box of instant french vanilla pudding and 3 cups milk.", "Mix until it starts to thicken, then pour over step 2 without disturbing that layer.", "Refrigerate 10 minutes.", "----Topping: Take 1 large container of cool-whip and 1 cup of pecan pieces.", "Mix together and spread over the top.", "Keep in the refrigerator.", "-----NOTE# 1: Mix flour and pecan pieces in bowl,add melted butter,pour into 9x13 pan.", "Bake at 350F for 20 minutes or until brown.", "Remove and cool completely.", "Do this first it is the crust."]
Mix together beaten egg milk and juice from clams. Place dry ingredients in greased loaf pan. Pour milk mixture over dry ingredients. Bake 40 to 50 minutes at 350\u00b0.

Press rolls together in a pie plate. Cover the crust with chips. Follow the directions for preparing the taco seasoning mix with the hamburger and onion. Put this mixture on top of the chips. Top with some of the diced tomatoes several dollops of sour cream and then the cheese. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 30 to 40 minutes. Garnish with the lettuce tomatoes and salsa before serving. For guests put the garnishes in separate bowls and let them choose what they wish. More sour cream and black olives could be other optional garnishes.

["Melt margarine in heavy saucepan or skillet.", "Add sugar, egg and dates.", "Cook 2 minutes after it starts to boil.", "Remove from heat.", "Stir in nuts, Rice Krispies and vanilla.", "Let cool.", "Roll into balls.", "Roll in coconut."]

Doris is an old dear friend from Missouri. She gave me this recipe so many years ago I don't remember when. I'm sure it isn't exactly like it was then but I served it to my Sicilian neighbors and they told me it was the best they had ever had. Here again the homemade noodles are better.

["Preheat the oven to 450\u00b0F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.", "In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, brown sugar, and spices. Blend in the margarine using a pastry blender.", "In a medium bowl, combine the pumpkin, coconut milk, and agave nectar.", "Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until the mixture holds together. Knead lightly on a floured surface and roll out to 1\" thickness. Using a 2\" biscuit butter, cut the dough into circles.", "Re-roll the scraps and cut out biscuits until you have used all of the dough. Place on the prepared baking sheet.", "Bake 12-14 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm."]
Melt butter and add sugar. Mix all other ingredients. Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake for 1 hour at 325\u00b0. Makes 1 pie.
["Press water out of tofu between paper towels.", "Cut into cubes.", "Puree all ingredients together in a food processor."]

Heat oven to 325\u00b0. Grease a round 8-inch pan or pie plate with shortening. Mix sugar margarine vanilla salt flour eggs and cocoa in a medium bowl with wooden spoon. Stir in nuts. Pour into pan. Bake until wooden pick inserted comes out clean about 25 minutes. Immediately prick holes in pie with pick spread fudge sauce over top. Cool completely. Beat the whipping cream and powdered sugar in a small bowl until stiff. Drizzle fudge sauce on top. Store in refrigerator.

["Preheat ove to 350. Line a 13 x9 inch pan with Parchment paper for easy clean up. Arrange crackers evenly in pan.", "In saucepan over medium heat melt butter. Stir in brown sugar until melted and smooth. Bring mixture to a boil stirring constantly until mixture is smooth and bubbly. Boil for 2 minutes and then pour mixture evenly over cracker.", "Bake in oven for 5 minutes.", "Sprinkle chocolate pieces evenly over caramel mixture. Return to oven just long enough for chocolate to melt. Spread chocolate evenly with spatula.", "Place pan in refrigerator or freezer until chocolate is firm. Cut or break into pieces.", "Cooking time is cooling time."]

["Sift flour before measuring; spoon lightly into measuring cup and level without shaking or packing down.", "Combine flour and salt.", "With a pastry blender or two knives, cut in vegetable shortening until uniform; mixture should be fairly coarse.", "Sprinkle with water, a tablespoon at a time; toss with a fork.", "Work dough into a firm ball with your hands; divide dough into two parts and press into flat circles with smooth edges.", "On a lightly floured surface, roll bottom crust to a circle about 1 1/2\" larger than inverted pie plate.", "Gently ease dough into pie plate; trim edge even with plate and add filling.", "Moisten rim of bottom crust with water.", "Roll top crust the same way and lift onto filled pie; trim 1/2\" beyond the edge of pie plate.", "Fold top edge under bottom crust and flute with fingers or fork.", "Prick or slit top crust to allow for escape of steam; bake according to time and temperature recommended for filling used."]

["Mix cooked drained ground beef with taco seasoning.", "Place 1 tortilla on plate.", "Top with lettuce, half of meat, and another tortilla.", "Spread guacamole even over tortilla.", "(Use sour cream if you don't like guacamole.)", "Sprinkle with half of each: cheese, olives, pepper and onion.", "Sprinkle with cilantro and top with another tortilla and meat.", "Top with last tortilla.", "Spread sour cream evenly on tortilla.", "Sprinkle with remaining cheese, olives, pepper and onions.", "Top with reserved guacamole.", "Serve immediately, or cover and refrigerate up to 3 hours.", "Cut into wedges and serve with salsa."]

recipe_name: Party Roll-Ups:  An American, An Englishman, And An Italian
directions: ["For each roll-up, spread the cream cheese as evenly as possible across the slice of meat (but don't be anal about it if it glops up a bit--room temperature cream cheese is ideal).", "Then spread or sprinkle the other filling on top.", "Roll it up.", "Make as many as you want.", "Eat or serve as is or cut on the horizontal into pinwheels (not recommended for the salami unless you've got a tortilla on the outside).", "Optional: garnish with toothpicks securing a cranberry for each American, a dried apricot for each Englishman, and an olive for each Italian.", "Feel free to add additional seasonings: some like the American with a little mayo in it, some like the Englishman with a touch of dijon mustard, and some like the Italian with garlic powder (or an herbed cream cheese)-- horseradish might go in there somewhere!"]

["Place yeast in water.", "Melt butter and add sugar and egg.", "Add yeast, then flour.", "The batter will be thin and requires no kneading.", "Put in airtight bowl and refrigerate.", "Bake in muffin pans at 350\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes.", "Makes 2 dozen."]

["Spread rice in casserole.", "Drain asparagus, reserving juice. Arrange asparagus spears on rice.", "Mix mushroom soup and asparagus juice.", "Pour over mixture and stir gently to moisten rice.", "Place pork chops on top and season with salt and pepper.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour."]

["Bring the butter to room temperature.", "If you use a microwave, 15 seconds at 600W.", "Sift the almond flour and cake flour together.", "Put the butter and sugar in a bowl, add the salt and mix until the mixture becomes as smooth as shown in the photo.", "Add the egg yolk and mix further.", "Add the vanilla extract here if you use it.", "Mix until the mixture is evenly colored.", "Add the almond flour and cake flour.", "Change to a rubber spatula and fold in the flour mixture.", "When it has mostly mixed in, use your hands to gather the dough into a lump.", "Wrap the dough with cling film and rest in the fridge for 3 hours.", "Rest the dough at least more than 1 hour.", "Coat a tart pan with vegetable oil (not listed).", "After you've rested the dough, bring it to room temperature and make it soft enough to roll out.", "Place the dough on a piece of cling film, dust the dough with strong flour and roll out with a rolling pin.", "Roll the dough out to the size that is 1cm bigger than the tart pan.", "Place the tart pan upside down on the dough.", "Put your hand under the cling film, flip over the dough and tart pan together.", "Cut off the extra dough by rolling the rolling pin over the tart pan.", "Using a fork, pierce the dough to create air holes.", "Then, use it for a tart of your choice.", "For blind baking, bake for about 14 minutes at 170C.", "If you cut out the shapes or cut into pieces and bake, you can make cookies.", "They are also delicious.", "A tart with caramelized apple and appaleil.", "\"Apple Tart\""]

["Dissolve yeast in water.", "Add sugar, salt and 1/2 of the flour.", "Beat two minutes.", "Add egg, oil and rest of the flour. Mix until smooth.", "Put a little oil on the top of the dough. Cover bowl and refrigerate for two hours."]

["Heat oven to 350\u00b0.", "Grease jelly roll pan (15 1/2 x 10 1/2 x 1-inch).", "Beat eggs, sugar, oil and pumpkin.", "Stir in flour, baking powder, cinnamon, baking soda, salt, ginger and cloves. Mix in raisins.", "Pour batter into pan.", "Bake until light brown, 25 to 30 minutes.", "Cool; frost with Cream Cheese Frosting.", "Sprinkle with nuts.", "Cut into bars, about 2 x 1 1/2 inches.", "Refrigerate any remaining bars.", "Yields 49 cookies."]
["Mix all ingredients together. Grease pie pan.", "Pat mixture into pan and bake for 15 minutes at 375\u00b0. Cool."]

["Unroll crescent rolls and pat into 2 cookie sheets, pinching seams together.", "Bake about 10 minutes.", "Cool.", "Mix Ranch dressing and milk.", "Beat cream cheese with dressing mixture.", "Spread on cooled crust.", "Sprinkle with green onions, broccoli buds, carrots and Cheddar cheese.", "Cut into desired size bars."]

["Combine baking mix, milk and cheese in a bowl and mix well. Roll into 8 x 12-inch rectangle on floured surface.", "Cut into strips.", "Twist each strip into a pretzel shape and place on greased baking sheet.", "Brush with beaten egg.", "Sprinkle with salt. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown."]
Mix all together. Form ball and put back in refrigerator to set.
Crust: Melt margarine mix with flour and add 3/4 cup pecans. Pat out in pie pan. Bake at 350\u00b0 until brown. Take out of oven. Let cool completely.

["Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil, and cook rigatoni pasta for 8 to 10 minutes, until al dente. Drain, and set aside.", "Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Season the chicken with salt and pepper, and cook in the skillet 20 minutes, or until no longer pink and juices run clear.", "Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly butter a 10 inch casserole dish.", "In the prepared casserole dish, mix the cooked pasta, cooked chicken, spaghetti sauce, broccoli rabe, and mozzarella cheese. Top with Cheddar cheese.", "Bake 25 minutes in the preheated oven, until bubbly and lightly brown."]

recipe_name: Delicious Oven Baked Rosemary & Garlic Fries / Chips
directions: ["Slice the potatoes into fries (chips for those in the UK!)", "LEAVE THE SKINS ON!", "Then, rinse under cold water and leave to drain on one side.", "Pull leaves off of thyme and rosemary and discard stalks.", "Slice and chop garlic cloves.", "Slice up thyme and rosemary a little to release the flavours.", "Add a couple of tablespoons of oil to a roasting dish and place in the over for 5 minutes to heat.", "Once heated, pop the fries into the rosting pan and drizzle a bit more oil over, and sprinkle the herbs and garlic over before shaking to coat nice and evenly.", "Pop back in the over, at the top of the oven for about 25-30 mins, checking every 10 minutes and shaking to coat.", "Drain them on kitchen towel before serving."]
Mix all dry ingredients. Add liquid when ready to fry. (You may need to add a little water to batter.) Drop by teaspoon into hot grease.

["Drain tofu and cut into small slices.", "Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat.", "Add tofu and cook in a single layer about 5 minutes or until browned slightly on bottom.", "Then stir and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until thouroughly cooked (about 5-7 minutes).", "While tofu cooks, prepare sauce by mixing water, peanut butter, vinegar, soy sauce, honey, ginger, garlic, and chili sauce.", "Whisk in a small bowl until well-mixed.", "Add vegetables and sauce to skillet.", "Cook, stirring, 1 to 2 minutes or until vegetables are lightly steamed.", "Serve with brown rice."]
["Spread cream cheese over tortillas.", "Roll tortillas and cut into small segments.", "Serve tortillas with salsa for dipping!"]

recipe_name: Cream Cheese Pound Cake For Two With Strawberries
directions: ["Before baking a pound cake, I recommend setting out all ingredients on the counter and allowing them to come to room temperature.", "Butter a 5 3/4\" x 3\" x 2\" mini loaf pan. Preheat the oven to 350\u00b0.", "In a medium bowl, beat together the butter, cream cheese and sugar with an electric mixer. Beat very well (about 3-5 minutes) until the sugar is fully incorporated and the mixture is pale yellow and fluffy. Next, add the egg and vanilla and continue beating. Add the baking powder and half of the flour. Add the remaining flour and mix just until combined. Scrape batter into the loaf pan and bake on a cookie sheet for 42-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.", "Before you plan to serve the pound cake, mix the strawberries, sugar and lemon juice or Frangelico and let macerate for 30 minutes. Serve fat slices of the pound cake with juicy strawberries. Garnish with whipped cream if desired."]

["Generously grease", "a", "12-inch pizza pan.", "Sprinkle with cornmeal.", "In bowl, combine", "biscuit", "mix and the 1/2 cup cold water.", "Stir with", "fork", "until dough follows fork around bowl. Turn out on lightly floured surface; knead 5 or 6 times.", "Roll to 14 inch circle;", "pat into prepared pizza pan.", "Crimp edges."]

["In a very large bowl, combine cheese, soup, sour cream, onion, 1/2 cup margarine, salt and pepper; mix well.", "Fold in hash browns.", "Pour mixture into a greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish. Toss together corn flake crumbs and 1 tablespoon margarine. Sprinkle over casserole.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour or until casserole is golden brown and potatoes are tender.", "Serves 10."]

["Assemble to your liking, but if staying from scratch, follow below", "Start on your Vietnamese Caramelized pork and work up to Step 4 in which you begin the long simmer.", "While the pork is simmering, prepare the Pickled Red Onions up to Step 2 in which the onions are soaking in hot water.", "While the onions are soaking in hot water, make the Pickled Carrots & Radish.", "When you're done with the Pickled Carrots & Radish, come back and complete the pickled red onions.", "Make the Habanero Lime Garlic Crema.", "By this time, your pork should be done or close to done.", "Chop your cilantro and cabbage.", "Warm or char your tortillas.", "I char the tortillas directly over a medium high gas flame for about 10 seconds per side.", "Serve the components buffet style, left to right, in the order in which the tacos should get filled - tortillas, cabbage, meat, pickles, crema, cilantro, sriracha - and let everyone build their own."]

["Preheat oven to 325.", "", "Cream butter, peanut butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla until fluffy. Add flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt and mix until combined.", "", "Fold in peanut butter chips. Spread dough in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Other sizes will work too, it will just determine the thickness of the bars.", "", "Bake at 325 for 25-30 minutes."]

Mix oleo granulated sugar and eggs. Add dry ingredients and vanilla. Chill dough for several hours. Roll into balls the size of a walnut. Then roll balls in a mixture of sugar and cinnamon. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 10 minutes.
["Mix all ingredients.", "Leave in refrigerator until hard.", "Form into ball and roll in walnuts."]

["For each serving: Grill 1 beef patty on medium-high heat 2 to 3 min.", "on each side or to medium (160 degrees F), or desired doneness.", "Top with 2 cheese slices.", "Grill 30 sec.", "or until cheese begins to melt.", "Spread 1/2 Tbsp.", "of the steak sauce onto bottom half of roll.", "Top with 1/2 cup spinach, cheeseburger, 2 prosciutto slices, 1 Tbsp.", "onions and 1 Tbsp.", "of the remaining steak sauce.", "Cover with top of roll."]

["Preheat oven to 350 degrees.", "Streusel for topping:.", "Mix 2 tbsp four and 2 light brown sugar, 2 tbsp crystallized sugar and 1 tbsp butter in a small bowl.", "Sprinkle on top.", "Evenly coat a 10 inch springform pan with nonstick cooking spray.", "Beat butter, sugar, baking powder, ginger and salt in large bowl with mixer on medium high speed until smooth.", "Beat in eggs and vanilla until blended.", "Reduce mixer speed to low, beat in flour and milk just until combined.", "Spread batter evenly into prepared pan.", "Place nectarine slices on top.", "Sprinkle Streusel topping on top.", "Bake 45 to 50 minutes until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.", "Cool 15 minutes in pan."]
Combine Eagle Brand milk and lemonade. Blend with mixer until well blended and stiff. Add Cool Whip fold in with spoon. Mix together and pour into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate.

["Rub the flour and coconut oil together then mix in the salt and sugar. Add 1 egg and mix well then knead until smooth, gradually adding the vinegar and 3-4 tbsp cold water. Try not to let the dough warm up too much. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and chill for 1 hour.", "Place the pumpkin and 1/2 cup water in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Remove 2 tbsp pumpkin after 5 mins of cooking and continue to cook the rest cook for a further 10 mins. Drain the excess liquid.", "Preheat the oven to 325\u00b0F. Mix the heavy cream, milk and brown sugar together then stir in the cinnamon, cloves, ginger, nutmeg and 3 eggs. Thoroughly mix in the stewed pumpkin.", "Grease a 10 inch round pie pan with coconut oil. Roll out the dough on a lightly floured work surface to make a circle large enough to fit in the pan, then lay it inside. Press down gently. Trim away any excess and use this to make pastry decorations for the top. Beat 1 egg yolk and brush over the pastry. Bake for 15-20 mins.", "Increase the oven temperature to 400\u00b0F. Pour the pumpkin mixture into the pastry and add the pumpkin pieces. Bake for 50 mins to 1 hour. Top with the pastry decorations and bake for 5-10 mins, depending on their size. Remove from the oven and garnish with pumpkin seeds and dill. Serve."]
["Brown meat, onion, parsley, garlic powder and salt.", "Add soups and pepper.", "Blend in sour cream and milk.", "Place in casserole."]
["Mix everything together except chocolate chips, then fold in chocolate. Bake at 325 degrees for 1 hour."]

["Preheat oven to 350\u00b0.", "Spray 2-quart baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.", "In large bowl, combine potatoes, milk, sour cream, cheese and 2 tablespoons of the melted margarine; stir gently until well combined.", "Spread evenly into prepared baking dish.", "In small bowl, combine crushed cornflakes with remaining 2 tablespoons margarine; sprinkle evenly over potato mixture.", "Bake, uncovered, until bubbling and lightly browned, about 50 minutes."]

["In large bowl, mix 1 1/2 cups flour, sugar, salt and yeast. Combine water, milk and butter.", "Heat over low heat until very warm, 120\u00b0 to 130\u00b0.", "Add to dry ingredients \"slowly.\"", "Beat 2 minutes at medium speed.", "Add 1/2 cup flour; beat 2 minutes at high speed.", "Stir in additional flour to make soft dough."]

Beat eggs on high for 1 minute then add sugar lemon juice spices salt and soda. Mix well then fold flour and pumpkin in. Spread on greased cookie sheet then sprinkle with nuts. Bake at 375\u00b0 for 10 minutes. Turn out on towel and sprinkle with powdered sugar and roll up with towel. Let cool. When cake is cool unroll and spread with filling.

["Preheat oven to 375\u00b0F. Pulse flour and 1 tsp. salt in a food processor to combine. Stir oil, honey, and 2/3 cup water in a liquid measuring cup. With motor running, add oil mixture to dry ingredients and continue to pulse until a ball of dough forms around blade.", "Turn dough out onto a work surface. Divide in half. Cover one half with a moistened towel, then roll remaining half into a rough 15x10\" rectangle. Repeat with second half. Transfer each to a large parchment-lined baking sheet. Using a pizza cutter or sharp paring knife, trim ragged edges. Cut each rectangle into 24 (6x4\") pieces.", "Fill a spray bottle with water and mist top of dough (or use a pastry brush to brush water on dough). Sprinkle with seeds and more salt. With your hands, press down lightly on dough to adhere seeds.", "Bake crackers, rotating sheets halfway through and checking for doneness frequently toward end of baking time (they can quickly brown), until slightly brown and crunchy, 15-18 minutes. Let cool (they'll crisp up) before serving."]

["Mix the chicken, cheese, mushrooms, onions, mayonnaise, salt and pepper together.", "Beat one egg and add to 1 1/2 cups Bisquick with enough water for usual biscuit consistency.", "Fold in first mixture with second mixture.", "Heat oven to 450\u00b0.", "Spread mayonnaise on one side of 6 pieces of bread."]

Heat 3 to 4-inches oil to 375\u00b0. Measure flour 1/4 cup sugar and nutmeg into bowl. Add oil milk and egg beat until smooth. Drop by teaspoons (too large puffs will not cook) into fat. Fry 4 or 5 at a time about 3 minutes or until golden brown. Drain. Sift together 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon. Roll warm puffs in sugar-cinnamon mixture.

["Beat cream cheese, 1 tablespoon milk and sugar in a large bowl with a whisk until smooth.", "Fold in topping.", "Spread on bottom of crust.", "Pour 1 cup milk in bowl.", "Beat with whisk 1 to 2 minutes (it will be thick).", "Stir in pumpkin and spices with whisk.", "Mix well.", "Spread over cheese mixture.", "Refrigerate 4 hours or until set.", "Garnish as desired.", "Serves 8."]

["Dissolve yeast in water.", "Add sugar and flour.", "Mix well and let rise 30 minutes.", "Add second set of ingredients.", "Mix. Refrigerate in greased bowl.", "Cover.", "Shape into rolls.", "Put in greased pan.", "Let rise in warm place about 2 hours.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 15 to 20 minutes."]

Mix everything together. Chill for several hours or overnight. Roll out dough into a thin rectangle. Spread jar of mincemeat over 1/2 rectangle. Add nuts if desired. Roll up like a jelly roll. Make slits across top of roll. Bake on a cookie sheet for 25 minutes at 350\u00b0 then for 25 minutes at 325\u00b0.

Brown ground beef and onion together. Chop up tomatoes. Mix in saucepan tomatoes tomato paste parsley flakes sugar salt basil garlic and oregano. Heat to boiling. Stir occasionally. Reduce heat and simmer covered 15 to 20 minutes.

["Combine both meats in a skillet and brown", "Drain fat in a strainer while preparing sauce", "Slice and saute onion and bell pepper", "Combine Ragu, tomato paste and tomato sauce in a large enough pot to eventually hold all ingredients.", "Add onions, bell pepper, and meat", "Simmer for 15 minutes", "Boil spaghetti pasta for 12 minutes and then drain in a strainer.", "Dish spaghetti pasta onto plate and ladle the sauce over. Enjoy!"]

["Preheat oven to 350.", "Place sliced rhubarb in a buttered 8-inch square baking dish.", "In mixing bowl, combine brown sugar, flour, oats, butter and cinnamon; mix together until crumbly.", "In a saucepan combine granulated sugar, cornstarch, and the 1 cup of water and vanilla. Cook together until clear, then pour over rhubarb.", "Top rhubarb with crumb mixture and bake at 350\u00b0 for 45 to 55 minutes"]

["Lightly butter the slices of bread. Make them into sandwiches with 1-2 slices of cheese in each sandwich, adding any of the optional extras you like.", "Heat the oil and knob of butter in a frying pan, over a moderate heat. Put the sandwiches into the hot fat, and fry for a few minutes on each side, until the bread is golden and crispy, and the cheese is beginning to melt.", "Remove from the pan, drain on a piece of kitchen paper if they seem a bit greasy. Eat at once while hot."]

recipe_name: Minestrone with Garlic and Parmesan Croutons
directions: ["In a large saucepan heat 1 tablespoon oil over moderately high heat until hot but not smoking and saute onion, carrot, and potato with salt to taste until vegetables are lightly browned.", "Add tomatoes and their liquid, broth, and pasta and simmer, stirring to break up tomatoes, 10 minutes, or until pasta and vegetables are tender.", "In a skillet saute garlic in remaining tablespoon oil over moderately high heat until golden and discard with a slotted spoon.", "In garlic-flavored oil fry bread, seasoned with salt, over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until golden on all sides.", "Remove skillet from heat and add parsley and Parmesan, tossing croutons to coat well.", "Add zucchini and half the croutons to tomato mixture and simmer, stirring occasionally, 5 minutes, or until zucchini is almost tender and croutons are dissolved.", "Stir in romaine and cook 1 minutes.", "Serve soup sprinkled with remaining croutons."]

["Wash the rice as you would normally, and cook it with a little less water.", "Add to a saucepan and turn on the heat, and let it cool once the sugar and salt have dissolved.", "Add the vinegar mixture from step 1 into freshly cooked rice, and mix together as if cutting the rice.", "It is good to go once the rice has cooled and turned glossy.", "Slice the avocado 5 mm thick, and spritz with a bit of lemon juice to prevent it from changing color.", "Cut the cucumber vertically into fourths.", "Remove the imitation crab out of its package, and cut the cream cheese into sticks.", "Place the nori seaweed on top of a bamboo sushi mat (if available), and add half of the sushi rice from step 2 on top of the seaweed.", "Spread it out evenly, and sprinkle with sesame.", "Cover with a piece of plastic wrap larger than the nori seaweed, and flip it over.", "With the seaweed-side up, line up cream cheese towards the front, and lightly squirt some mayonnaise.", "Add avocado and imitation crab on top of the cream cheese and lightly top with some more mayonnaise.", "Use the plastic wrap to roll up the ingredients.", "Make sure that the end of the plastic wrap is on the bottom, and shape the roll.", "Make 1 more roll in the same manner.", "Remove the plastic wrap, slice into easy-to-eat portions, arrange onto plates, and you are done .", "Enjoy it with wasabi and soy sauce if you'd like ."]

["Mix hamburger and onion in casserole.", "Microwave on High 9 minutes.", "Add remaining ingredients except noodles.", "Cover and microwave about 3 minutes.", "Sprinkle noodles on and microwave another 2 minutes."]

["Melt candy bars on Low in microwave.", "Remove candy from microwave and blend well with whipped topping.", "Then place the mixture in the pie shell and refrigerate to firm.", "Makes eight servings."]

["For the cake:", "In a large bowl, cream butter and shortening with an electric mixer. Add sugar and continue beating until mixture is smooth. Add egg yolks and beat well.", "Combine flour and baking soda. Add to the butter mixture, alternately with buttermilk, and scrape down the sides of the bowl as necessary.", "Stir in vanilla, 1/2 cup coconut and walnuts. Fold in beaten egg whites.", "Pour batter into a greased large Pyrex glass bowl. Bake at 350\u00b0F for 55-60 minutes or until cake tests done. (This cake can also be baked in three 8-inch round cake pans for 25 minutes.) Allow cake to cool in the bowl for about 20 minutes, then flip out onto a cake plate to continue cooling.", "For the icing:", "In a bowl, mix butter and cream cheese with an electric mixer until creamy. Gradually add in confectioner's sugar, beating well after each addition. Mix in vanilla.", "Frost cake with icing and garnish with remaining coconut flakes to create the \"Snowball\" look.", "Add a decorative flag on top labeled as \"Snowball Cake\" to finish off the cake."]

["For the spring rolls: Put a daikon radish slice on a flat surface.", "With your fingertip, spread a layer of sesame oil over the surface and lightly season with salt and pepper.", "In the middle of the slice, put a small amount of each of the remaining ingredients, placing horizontally.", "Roll the radish slice tightly to encompass all the ingredients and create the look of a spring roll.", "Add a small amount of sesame oil on the edge of the radish slice to seal the roll.", "Continue this process until all ingredients are used.", "Refrigerate until ready to serve.", "For the dipping sauce: Mix ingredients in a blender until smooth."]

["Beat egg well.", "Grate cheese.", "Add mustard and salt.", "Heat milk.", "Add cheese mixture.", "Cook on low for 15 minutes.", "Keeps well for one week in fridge.", "Can add garlic, onion or crumbled bacon."]
Combine first 5 ingredients in a mixing bowl mix 3 minutes at low speed. Set aside.

["In a bowl, combine flour and salt. Cut in lard until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle in water, a tablespoon at a time, until pastry holds together. Shape into a ball; chill for 30 minutes. On a lightly floured surface, roll dough to 1/8-in. thickness. Transfer to a 10-in. pie plate. Flute edges; fill and bake as pie recipe directs."]

["Directions", "1. Mix the dry ingredients well, with a fork.", "", "2. Beat egg. Add milk, vanilla and butter, and mix well.", "", "3. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients mixture. Slowly pour the liquid ingredients mixture into the well, gently mixing as you pour, using a fork. DO NOT OVER MIX. Batter should be thick and lumpy.", "", "4. Heat two 12-inch skillets over medium heat for about 4 minutes. Add a little oil to each skillet and brush to coat. Pour 1/4 cup batter onto three spots on each skillet. Cook until large bubbles begin to appear, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the other side until golden brown, about 1 more minute."]

["Position one oven rack in the middle setting. Position another rack in the lowest setting, and place a rimless baking sheet on the bottom rack. Preheat oven to 500\u00b0.", "Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Add sliced mushrooms to pan, and saute for 5 minutes or until moisture evaporates.", "Remove plastic wrap from Basic Pizza Dough; discard. Brush oil over dough. Remove preheated baking sheet from oven; close oven door. Slide dough onto preheated baking sheet, using a spatula as a guide. Bake on lowest oven rack at 500\u00b0 for 8 minutes. Remove from oven.", "Spread Basic Pizza Sauce in an even layer over crust, leaving a 1/4-inch border. Top sauce with mushrooms. Sprinkle mushrooms evenly with mozzarella and Parmesan. Arrange pepperoni in an even layer on top of cheese. Bake on middle rack an additional 10 minutes or until crust is golden brown and cheese melts. Cut into 12 wedges."]
Drain pineapple. Add cream cheese and onion mix well. Crush pecans. Roll cheese ball in pecans. This is best if made a day ahead. Serve with any type of cracker.
Preheat oven to 400\u00b0. In a bowl combine flour oats sugar cinnamon and salt. Add butter. Mix well.

["Mix together all ingredients in a big bowl until incorporated.", "Shape into 12 burgers about 1/2 thick and about 6 inches in diameter.", "Place burgers on a medium-high grill (or a skillet) and cook for 4-6 minutes (3-4 minutes on each side) until cooked through.", "(Note: heat temperatures, thickness of burgers etc.", "can effect cooking time.)", "Top with a mixture of mesclun mix, feta and red peppers that have been tossed in olive oil and red wine vinegar and a big dollop of tzatziki!", "OPA!"]

Heat butter in a skillet. Place 1 tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle with half the cheese half the diced onion picante sauce and seasonings to taste. When the cheese has melted and the tortilla is lightly browned cover with another tortilla. Flip to brown the second side. Remove from heat cut the sandwich into quarters. Keep warm in a low oven. Arrange on a plate with refried beans on the side shredded lettuce and diced tomatoes. Serve with guacamole and/or sour cream for dipping.

recipe_name: A Touch Of Garlic's Zuppa Di Pesce Recipe
directions: ["* Note: Mince 1/4 of a small onion together with \"A TOUCH OF GARLIC\" (one garlic clove).", "For the Shrimp Stock: Preheat medium-size saucepot on high heat for approximately 3 min.", "Add in extra virgin olive oil.", "Wait 2 min, then add in shrimp shells.", "Saute/fry shells for 2 to 3 min or possibly till they are a bright orange in color.", "Add in remaining ingredients, then lower heat to medium and reduce by half, approximately 10 to 15 min.", "Pour through a fine strainer discarding shells and reserving liquid stock.", "May be prepared and refrigerated up to 5 days in advance.", "(Makes 4 ounces)", "For the Pommodoro Sauce: Saute/fry garlic and onion mix and extra virgin olive oil in a small saucepot on medium-low heat for approximately 5 min stirring frequently.", "Don't brown.", "Add in remaining ingredients and simmer for 30 min, stirring occasionally.", "May be prepared and refrigerated up to 5 days in advance.", "(Makes 8 ounces)", "Saute/fry garlic and onion mix with extra virgin olive oil in a large skillet for two min on high heat.", "Add in white wine, salt, pepper, oregano, Shrimp Stock, Pommodoro Sauce, mussels and clams.", "Cover and poach for 5 min.", "Add in swordfish and sea bass, cover again and continue to poach for 5 min.", "Add in shrimp, calamari, scungilli, capers and basil.", "Cover once more and simmer for 3 min or possibly till shrimp are cooked through.", "To serve: Arrange shellfish around linguine in large pasta bowl.", "Pour remaining seafood sauce over center of pasta.", "This recipe yields 1 to 2 servings."]

["In a food processor, process banana chips until they are of a flour-like consistency.", "Add the dried pineapple and chopped dates.", "Process all of the ingredients until they begin to combine and ball up.", "Spread mixture into a 9-inch pie pan.", "Press dough out until it is evenly distributed in the pan.", "Edges may be fluted if desired."]

["if you have a blender large enough for this batch, go ahead and blend all the ingredients. if not, use an electric mixer as i do.", "pour into a greased 25cm backing dish.", "bake in a preheated oven at 350*F for 45 min(check on it after 30 min).", "the flour should form a ouhg at the bottom and the coconut will be on top.", "enjoy."]

["Beat together eggs and sugar.", "Add flour sifted together with baking powder and salt.", "Add dates cut in half (pit removed) and pecans.", "Be sure to grease and flour cookie sheet, 17 1/4 x 12 1/2 x 1-inch.", "Pour mixture in pan and spread evenly.", "Sprinkle the colored sugar on top of mixture before baking.", "Green and/or red combination looks pretty at Christmastime.", "Bake slowly at 250\u00b0 for 1 to 1 1/2 hours until firm to touch.", "Cool and cut into squares."]
["Combine all but nuts and parsley.", "Divide in half.", "Roll into balls.", "Roll one ball in nuts, the other in parsley."]

["Dissolve Jell-O in water.", "Add sugar and lemon juice and rind. Chill to consistency of egg white.", "Fold in rhubarb and cream. When partially set, pour into baked 10-inch pie shell and chill thoroughly."]

["Preheat oven to 375\u00b0. In a large skillet, cook and crumble beef with onion and garlic over medium heat until no longer pink, 5-7 minutes; drain. Stir in chili sauce and vinegar.", "In a small saucepan, combine water, cream cheese and butter; bring to a boil. Remove from heat; stir in potato flakes.", "Separate biscuits; press each onto bottom and up sides of a greased muffin cup. Fill with beef mixture; top with mashed potatoes. Sprinkle with potato chips.", "Bake until topping is golden brown, 20-25 minutes. If desired, sprinkle with paprika.", "Freeze cooled pies in a single layer in freezer containers. To use, partially thaw in refrigerator overnight. Reheat on a", "in a preheated 375\u00b0 oven until heated through, 15-18 minutes."]
Add Cool Whip pineapple condensed milk and pecans. Stir together until mixed. Add lemon juice stir. Pour into crusts. Chill and refrigerate.

["Peel potatoes,wash,dry, and slice with a french fry slicer into 1/4 inch square strips.", "Rinse strips in a large bowl with 8 cups water until water becomes milky, drain.", "Cover strips with 8 more cups water and add ice; let sit 1 hour.", "Remove fries from water and dry on paper towels for 10-15 minutes.DO NOT let them start tot turn brown. Meanwhile, preheat shortening to 375 degrees.", "Blanch a bunch of fries for 1 1/2 minutes at a time. Be sure they do not begin to brown. Drain and cool on paper towels.", "Put in large zip bags and freeze at least 4-5 hours before final frying stage.", "To fry:", "Add desired amount to preheated 375 degree shortening. Deep fry for 4 1/2-6 minutes or until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels and salt generously."]

["Beat eggs", "until light; add the sugar gradually.", "Blend these ingredients until", "they", "are", "very light.", "Add dates and broken nuts.", "Sift", "before", "measuring", "1", "scant", "cup", "of bread flour. Resift with", "baking", "powder", "and salt.", "(If spices are desired, add", "cloves", "and cinnamon.) Add sifted ingredients to the egg mixture", "with", "vanilla.", "Beat", "batter until it is well blended. Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan lined with buttered paper. Bake at 325\u00b0 about", "25 minutes.\tCool; cut into bars.", "Roll in confectioners sugar.", "Makes 42 (2 1/2 x 1-inch) bars."]
["Melt butterscotch morsels over boiling water.", "Add peanut butter.", "Stir in chow mein noodles.", "Add salted nuts.", "Drop by teaspoon onto waxed paper; put into refrigerator."]

["For the first layer:", "Combine the ingredients in a microwave safe bowl and microwave in 30-second intervals until the ingredients have melted together. Mix in between each interval. It took me about 90 seconds total to melt them together. Spread the first layer evenly into your greased 8x8 baking dish. Refrigerate while you make the second layer.", "For the second layer (the filling):", "Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add sugar and milk and bring to a boil. Stir for 5 minutes until thickened. Remove the saucepan from heat and stir in marshmallow fluff, peanut butter and peanuts. Spread over the first layer. Refrigerate while making the third layer.", "For the third layer (caramel layer):", "Unwrap the caramels and combine the two ingredients in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave in 30-second intervals (about 60 seconds total) until melted. Spread evenly over the filling and refrigerate while making the last layer.", "For the last layer:", "Do the same as the first layer. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours until the bars are completely set. Cut into eight 4x2 inch bars and enjoy!"]

Cook milk sugar and butter to soft ball stage. Remove from heat stir in chopped dates nuts and vanilla. Beat until too heavy to move spoon. Turn out on cloth sprinkled with 1/2 cup powdered sugar mixed with 2 tablespoons cornstarch. Roll firmly into a roll (like sausage). Refrigerate until easy to slice.

["Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.", "In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add the ground beef and onion.", "Cook until the beef is browned and the onions are translucent, about 6-8 minutes.", "Drain.", "Return it to the skillet and add the refried beans, green chilies, tomatoes, taco seasoning, water, and salsa; simmer for about 10 minutes.", "In a round 9-inch baking pan, place a tortilla.", "Spread a layer of the beef mixture on top along with some cheese.", "Drizzle a little bit of taco sauce over the mixture.", "Continue to layer.", "Put cheese and taco sauce only again on the top.", "Cook in the oven for 20-25 minutes, until bubbly.", "Serve with sour cream."]

["Cream butter and sugar first.", "Add eggs, one at a time.", "Add flour, one cup at a time; add flavoring.", "Do not beat over 4 minutes.", "Grease and flour pan.", "Preheat oven for 5 minutes at 350\u00b0.", "Bake for 1 hour.", "If browning too fast, place a pan of water under cake."]

In a medium bowl combine Ricotta eggs Parmesan cheese and Mozzarella cheese. Spread 1 cup of meat sauce into a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Layer 1/4 of the lasagne 1/3 of the Ricotta mixture and 1 cup meat sauce and repeat twice. Top with remaining ingredients. Top layer should be Mozzarella. Bake in a 375\u00b0 oven for 35 minutes uncover and bake 15 minutes longer. Let stand for 15 minutes. Serves 12.

Thoroughly cream sugar and shortening. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Sift together flour soda and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Mix in 1/2 to 1 cup nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet. Bake 12 to 15 minutes in a 350\u00b0 oven.

Soften butter to mix with cheeses salt and pepper. Add flour and mustard. Mix in Rice Krispies by hand and roll into small balls. Put on ungreased cookie sheet. Flatten with a fork. Bake at 375\u00b0 for about 10 minutes. These freeze well. Makes over 100.

["Cut cake horizontally into 4 layers.", "In a small bowl, combine the milk, coconut and almonds.", "Place bottom layer on a serving plate; top with half of the coconut mixture, one layer cake and 1/2 cup frosting.", "Repeat layers so that the top ends frosted. Enjoy!"]

["Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; stir well. Cut in shortening with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle milk over flour mixture, stirring until dry ingredients are moistened. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface; knead lightly 4 to 5 times. Roll pastry to fit casserole."]
["Bring syrup and sugar to boil. Remove from heat and add peanut butter and mix. Add cereal and mix. Press in 9 x 13 pan. Melt chips and spread over top."]

["Preheat oven to 350 degrees (F).", "", "In a medium bowl, add the flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda.", "In a large bowl, add the shortening, egg, vanilla extract, sugar, and salt.", "Using an electric hand mixer, beat the ingredients of the large bowl together until evenly moist (this should take 15 seconds at most).", "Pour in half of the milk and continue beating. Add half of the flour mixture and continue beating. Add the rest of the milk. Continue beating.", "Add the rest of the flour mixture.", "Beat until fluffy and smooth.", "", "Using a 1/3 cup measuring cup, scoop the batter and drop it onto a cookie sheet. Make each droplet about 2 inches apart; the cookies will spread as they bake. Bake for 15 minutes, or until edges of the cookies are firm. Let cool completely.", "For small cookies, use a tablespoon as your scoop. As with the bigger cookies, keep the droplets about 2 inches apart. Bake for 10 - 12 minutes, or until edges of the cookies are firm. Let cool completely.", "", "Once cookies are completely cool, slice the cookies horizontally, like an english muffin. Spread your favorite vanilla frosting on the bottom half & replace the top, making a sandwich.", "", "Eat fresh, pack in a lunch, or freeze (and eat frozen!).", "Enjoy!"]

["Spray a 9 x 13-inch pan with cooking spray.", "Spread 1/4 of sauce on bottom pan.", "Layer 1/3 spaghetti on top of sauce. Arrange 1/3 cauliflower over sauce; sprinkle with hamburger.", "Pour eggs evenly over all.", "Add another layer of sauce and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons cheese.", "Repeat 2 more times, ending with sauce and cheese.", "Bake at 375\u00b0 for 45 minutes."]

Heat oven to 425\u00b0. Cook and stir meat and onions in skillet until meat is brown and onions are tender. Drain. Stir in tomato sauce green pepper 2 tablespoons flour the basil and oregano. Heat to boiling. Boil and stir 1 minute. Pour into ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking pan. Arrange cheese on top. Beat eggs milk oil 1 cup flour and salt until smooth. Pour over cheese. Bake until puffy and golden brown 25 to 30 minutes. Serve hot.

["Preheat oven to 400 degrees.", "Brush the crust (especially the edge) with roasted garlic oil.", "Evenly spread the crust with pesto.", "Equally distribute and layer the chicken, artichokes, tomatoes, and goat cheese.", "Top with shredded cheese.", "Bake in the oven until cheese has melted and lightly browned, approximately 10 minutes.", "I've used store bought crusts (like Boboli) and homemade ones with equal success (whole wheat). I use a pizza stone in the oven but especially like the times that I have cooked the pizza on the grill. It adds a great smoky flavor."]

["In medium skillet with cover, heat olive oil. Add ground beef (or ground turkey) and onion. Cook until meat is browned and onions are translucent. Drain off excess fat.", "Add rice, contents of seasoning packet and remaining ingredients except cheese and tortillas. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low-boil and cover. Cook for 25 minutes without uncovering or stirring.", "Remove from heat. Uncover and let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in grated cheese.", "Spoon rice mixture on top of warm tortilla. Fold to make into a burrito."]
["Cream together.", "Spread over baked pie.", "Bake at 425\u00b0 for 10 minutes.", "Cool.", "Chill overnight or put in freezer for later date."]
*Or try cream of mushroom soup and 1/2 cup Burgundy wine.

["Preheat the oven to 450 degrees.", "Set the dough (of choice) on a baking sheet.", "Spread the sauce over the top, then dot with mushrooms and cheese.", "Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.", "Bake for 10 minutes."]

["Fry hamburger", "and", "onion", "until brown.", "Drain off fat. Add the", "remaining", "ingredients and mix well.", "Brown hamburger buns under", "broiler,", "then", "add\thamburger mixture; cover with Provolone cheese and return to broiler until melted."]
Drain pineapple mix well with milk and lemon juice. Add pecans and Cool Whip and mix until thick. Pour into pie crusts refrigerate for at least 6 hours.

["Melt peanut butter and margarine in saucepan over low heat. Stir in vanilla and remove from heat.", "Add sugar and cracker crumbs.", "Shape into small balls.", "Chill while preparing dip mixture.", "Melt chocolate chips and wax in double boiler over medium heat.", "Dip balls and cool on wax paper.", "Reheat dip mixture if it becomes too thick.", "May want to dip candy a second time. Store, covered, in a cool place."]

["Beat egg whites until foamy.", "Add salt and cream of tartar; beat until soft peaks form.", "Add 2 tablespoons of sugar at a time, beating constantly, until stiff peaks form.", "Fold in pecans and vanilla.", "Spoon into lightly greased pie plate, shaping as for a pie shell.", "Bake at 300\u00b0 for 50 minutes or until light brown and firm.", "Cool."]

["Preheat oven to 425 degrees.", "Using a sharp knife, cut potatoes lengthwise into 1/4-inch-thick slices, then cut slices into fry-shaped sticks.", "Pour melted butter or oil into medium bowl.", "Add potato sticks and toss to coat.", "Spread on baking sheet.", "Bake 20 minutes, then turn potatoes and bake until crisp, about 30 minutes.", "While still warm, season with salt and pepper and serve."]

["Prepare Pie Crust: Begin by freezing the butter. Place 2 sticks unsalted butter cut into 1 inch cubes into freezer and allow sit for at least 15 minutes, but preferably an hour. The longer the better.", "Add flour, salt, and sugar to a food processor. Pulse to combine.", "Flour a surface and add dough ball to surface. Divide in half and create two circular discs.", "Wrap discs in plastic wrap or sandwich bags and refrigerate for immediate use, or freeze for later use. Dough keeps for up to 2 months; one disc equals one layer of standard pie dough.

(NOTE: When using/baking the All Butter Pie Crust: make sure to puncture holes with a fork into the dough. Can be pre-baked, or baked with a pie).", "Prepare Pie: Slice peaches away from the pit making sure to keep skins on (this is Alanna's tip for an excellent homemade peach pie). The aesthetic nature of your slices matter little, just make sure to cut them into even levels of thickness (for me, this meant 1/4-inch thick slices).", "Place peaches in a nonstick saucepan with sugar, flour, and cinnamon, and rest for about 20-30 minutes or until a natural syrup forms.", "Warm saucepan over medium heat stirring in extracts when mixture becomes bubbly. Remove from heat and rest while you prepare the pie crust. Preheat oven to 425F. Roll out discs of pie crust on a well-floured surface and transfer to a pie pan. Press dough down evenly into pan and instead of trimming off dough excess, roll up hanging dough into a thick crust to fill the pan's edges (you will fill in any gaps in the crust when placing the latice-top over the filling).", "Transfer peach filling to pie and spread out evenly over pie crust. Roll out second disc of dough and using a pastry wheel, slice long even layers of lattice at about 1-inch thick.", "Create lattice-top crust: place 4 strips running left to right over the top of the filling and four strips running up and down on top. If feeling fancy, weave every other strip under and over the following strips in the pattern pictured above. 

Finally, take extra dough and fill in any gaps with the pie crust by pressing excess dough into empty spots and meshing with existing crust (if you're lucky, you'll use all of your pie dough like me).", "Paint lattice top with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar. Bake pie for 10 minutes at 425F and drop heat to 350F. Bake pie for an additional 25-35 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Remove from oven and cool.

Serve with whipped cream, vanilla ice cream, or by itself."]
["Mix cake mix per package instructions.", "Put half of mix in a 13 x 9-inch pan.", "Bake at 350\u00b0 for 15 to 20 minutes."]

["Preheat oven to 350 degrees.", "Put the water and butter in a heavy saucepan and heat to melt the butter.", "Bring to a boil, then remove from the heat and beat in the flour all at once.", "Beat in sharp cheese and seasonings until smooth and the mixture forms a ball.", "Gradually beat in the eggs to make a smooth, glossy dough.", "Drop the dough in blobs from a heaped teaspoon onto a buttered baking sheet.", "Bake for 20-25 minutes or until risen, golden brown and crisp.", "Make a slit in the side of each puff to allow the steam to escape, then return to the turned-off oven to keep hot.", "To make the filling, beat the cream cheese with the Pickapeppa sauce, then mix in the pimento and capers.", "Pipe or spoon filling into the cheese puffs and serve hot.", "Variations: For an alternative filling, combine 6 oz.", "cream cheese with Tabasco or other hot pepper sauce to taste and mix in 1/2 cup finely chopped cooked shrimp and 1/4 cup chopped scallions."]

Cook rice according to package directions. Saute ground chuck add Ro-Tel tomatoes and kidney beans and simmer. Mix rice into meat mixture. Grate cheese into mixture. Pour into 9 x 13-inch dish. Top with Fritos. Bake at 350\u00b0 about 20 minutes.
["Melt the chocolate morsels.", "Add the nuts and raisins to the melted chocolate, until not much chocolate is left.", "Drop onto wax paper by teaspoonfuls until set."]

Combine milk shortening sugar and salt. Cool to lukewarm. Add 1-1/2 cups flour and beat well. Beat in egg and yeast. Add remaining flour and beat well. Put in greased bowl and let rise 1-1/2 to 2 hours. Turn on floured board. Shape rolls and let rise until double in size. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 12-15 minutes. Makes 2 dozen rolls.
["Mix all ingredients except flour, then add in flour (sufficient flour so dough can be rolled out).", "Use floured cutting board.", "Use cutters.", "Bake at 350 degrees for 15 min."]

["Preheat oven to 400F and grease 8\" round baking pan.", "Make stuffing as directed on the package.", "Let stand for 5 minutes, fluff with a fork, add an egg and mix thoroughly.", "Press into bottom and up sides of pan and top with sauce, toppings and cheese.", "Bake for 15 minutes and let cool for 5 minutes before cutting into six slices to serve."]

["Mix together crust ingredients and press in ungreased 8-inch square pan.", "Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes no longer then cool slightly.", "Mix topping and spoon it onto baked crust.", "Bake for additional 35 minutes at 350 degrees.", "Serve warm with whipped cream, plain cream or ice cream."]

["Peel and quarter potatoes, carrots and cabbage.", "Dump sausage, veggies and water into pot.", "Cover and cook for 30 min or possibly till veggies are tender.", "Remove to a platter and keep hot.", "Sauce: Retain 1 1/2 c. pot juice.", "Add in flour, sugar, vinegar, mustard, salt and pepper.", "Cook, stirring till sauce is smooth and thickened.", "Pour over hot sausage and veggies.", "Yum!"]

Brown hamburger meat. Drain. Mix in chili and heat thoroughly. Pour ingredients into casserole baking dish. Top mixture with crumbled Fritos then sprinkle with cheese. Bake in 350\u00b0 oven until cheese is slightly brown. Serve on lettuce leaf.

["Mix sugar, cornstarch, salt and soda together. Add milk, mix well. Fold in rhubarb. Beat egg yolks and add to rhubarb mixture. Cook in double boiler until thick. Pour into 9 inch baked pie shell. Cover with meringue and bake until brown at 350\u00b0."]
["Mix all dry ingredients; add chopped onions and peppers, then beat milk and egg together and add to mixture.", "Drop small spoonfuls into hot grease."]

["In a large glass bowl, melt the butter in the microwave.", "Stir in the worcestershire and all the spices, whisk until well blended.", "Pour the snack ingredients into a large turkey roaster, pour the sauce over top.", "Mix well, bake uncovered at 225 degrees for one hour, stirring every 10 minutes.", "Store in tins, makes a great hostess gift."]

Preheat oven to 350\u00b0. Melt butter. Mix with graham cracker crumbs. Start layers beginning with graham cracker crumb mixture then add other layers as follows: coconut chocolate chips butterscotch chips condensed milk nuts. Press down gently as you add layers. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool and cut into squares.

["Cream together eggs, sugar, vanilla sugar and margarine.", "To this mixture add the remaining ingredients.", "Bake the basic recipe at 350\u00b0 for 1 hour in a Bundt form which is greased with margarine and sprinkled with breadcrumbs."]

["Slice potatoes into buttered casserole.", "Cover with meat. Add undiluted soups and onion.", "Crumble potato chips on top. Cover with foil."]
["Combine and bake 20 minutes at 350\u00b0."]
Mix together the graham crackers sugar and butter. Press on bottom and sides of pan. Bake at 400\u00b0 for 5 minutes. Cool crust.

Mix Ragu sauce and Cheddar cheese soup with 2 cups of Mozzarella cheese in baking dish. Drain grease off ground beef. Mix ground beef in sauce. Add cooked noodles mix well. Top with 2 cups of Mozzarella cheese. Bake at 350\u00b0 for 25 minutes.

["In a large bowl combine the cooked quinoa, cheddar cheese, cottage cheese, carrot, eggs, flour, green onions, Splenda, pepper, cumin, salt, and garlic powder.", "Heat a frying pan and a couple teaspoons olive oil over medium-low heat.", "Mixture will be slightly sticky, so using a 1/4 cup measuring cup, drop mixture into pan and lightly flatten to 1/2 inch thick.", "Fry until golden-brown, about 4 minutes on each side."]

["Heat oven to 375F.", "Unroll each can of dough into 2 rectangles.", "Press onto bottom and up sides of 15x10x1-inch pan, firmly pressing seams and perforations together to seal.", "Bake 11 to 12 min.", "or until golden brown; cool.", "Mix cream cheese, mayo and seasonings until blended; spread onto crust.", "Top with remaining ingredients.", "Refrigerate 2 hours."]

Cream shortening with peanut butter and salt until light and fluffy gradually adding confectioners sugar. Blend in vanilla then flour. Stir in peanuts mix well. Shape dough into small balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a 375\u00b0 oven 12 minutes or until golden brown. Roll immediately in confectioners sugar.

["In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt together the peanut butter and honey, stirring frequently until warm and creamy. Stir in the peanut butter mixture. Shape into balls of desired size and refrigerate until serving."]

["Soften the cream cheese.", "Mince the garlic (you can also use roasted garlic that you mash, YUM), sprinkle with black pepper and add herbs of your choice.", "Combine thoroughly and serve.", "For the herbs, I prefer thyme for this recipe but feel free to use tarragon or rosemary.", "Serve on crackers!"]

["Note: you'll need a cookie iron (similar to a waffle iron) for this recipe.", "Mix the flour and baking powder in a large bowl, set aside.", "In a very large bowl, cream the butter until smooth.
